After three big Kickstarter campaigns, we're amped to introduce the all-new Taskin Edge—the upscale business backpack for people who appreciate great style and what it can do for them.
If the buzz from our past campaigns is any sign, you'll be glad you got your Edge:

Finally: A business backpack that elevates your style for wherever you are now—and wherever you're headed next. Sharp, without being showy. Smart, without all the gimmicks. Premium quality and design, without the foolishly-high price tag.

Like some of our other previously Kickstart-ed Taskin gear? We love our backers, especially those who have backed us before. So as a thank you, you will get the credit as indicated by the table above. The credit will be available to you when you take the survey and can be applied to any of the following products.
These products are made at a different factory (and country) so can't be packed together. They will ship separately.

The Edge doesn't do droopy. Unlike backpacks that need air pillows or paper stuffing to stand up straight, the Edge's unique construction and underlying materials ensure that it's always ready, whether it's empty or packed full.

Edge also doesn't need something to lean on or a chair to slouch in, it will stand where you put it down. Edge is well balanced to ensure that it stays upright no matter its content. Shell-Body also ensures that the contents inside are better protected.

You don't buy the laptop to fit the backpack, right? That's why we designed the Edge to ensure that no matter your laptop preferences, it'll fit safely and securely. Edge's unique, adjustable strap keeps it well-protected within a specially-padded compartment.

column2: tablet compartment can accommodate laptops up to 41 x 26.5 x 2.5 cms and tablets or documents up to 34 x 25 x 1.5 cms. Depending on the manufacturer up to 17"" inch laptop but check your laptop size to confirm.

column1: How's this for easy access? You can ""pop the hood"" by simply opening the top of the Edge's front cover to quickly reach your things. The front also opens up to 360° so you can easily access the whole interior of the bag.

The Edge features two sleek, 1-inch deep sleeves in the front, so you can stow your smart phone, wallet or other essentials for instant access. The streamlined pockets not only ensures a clean look, but it also helps protect your belongings from being crushed.
Now you can come and go with confidence. The Edge's external side pocket with built-in retractable key-reel means your days of digging around for keys, fobs or batches are (thankfully) over.
Yes, it's that well-thought out. The Edge's backing is designed with airflow channels and air-breathable foam padding to keep your back cool, dry and comfortable. For a change.
Stays flat and out of the way when not in use, but holds its shape when op so you can easily insert your water-bottle with one hand. But now you're just showing off.
Get in touch with your inner secret agent with this hidden pocket for your passport or other essential documents.
Need some extra juice? Bring along a battery pack—there's a special sleeve with an external USB port so you can make some power moves when you're on the go.
Off on a business trip? Let your carry-on do the heavy lifting with this special carry-on attachment, which secures the Edge to most standard carry-on handles.
Look sharp when you stow access- or credit-cards in this quick-access strap pocket. Smooth, right?
We designed the Edge to accommodate a full range of awesome Taskin travel gear.

Like some of our other previously Kickstart-ed Taskin gear? We love our backers, especially those who have backed us before. So as a thank you, you will get the credit as indicated by the table above. The credit will be available to you when you take the survey and can be applied towards some of our previous campaign products.
The delivery date are the date we expect the rewards to ship from the factory. The date the reward will be delivered to our backers would vary depending on the shipping region.
We put hundreds of hours and dozens of prototypes into the Edge, and we're sure you'll love it as much as we do. Please back us so we can bring this product to market. Thank you!

Our stretch goal of $200k will help fund our infomercial. Chawel will then take the world by storm. We have it all lined up and ready to go, we just need your help.

I created the Chawel in 2002 during my first season as a beach lifeguard. It was meant to be a replacement for moms always having to hold towels up for their kids to change. Now everyone uses it to changing at the beach or on the pool deck or in parking lots. It's faster than having to hold towels up for other to change behind, or worrying about your towel falling off while changing out of wet swimwear.
No more hiding behind car doors in a parking lot, slip on your Chawel and be changed faster than with a small towel wrapped around your waist.

Chawel developed its other functions/uses, adapting to the needs of backpacking travelers, and the situation that may occur (like flight cancelations or layovers, leaving you stuck in the airport overnight).

Functionality is one of the things that our customers love. Not only is the Chawel Hybrid an antibacterial, quick dry towel, but it also functions as your personal CHANGING ROOM wherever you are. And if you are flying away for vacation, airlines charge for blankets and pillows now, so pack your Chawel onboard with you and use it as a BLANKET or roll it up for a comfy NECK/TRAVEL PILLOW.
Whether you are a world traveler, a soccer mom, a camper, or a beach bum, Chawel will come in handy wherever you are!
As the air gets a little cooler at sunset. A normal towel won't cut it to block the wind. Just slip into your Chawel feet first, pulling it up to your chin. And just like that, warm and comfy again.
From just cruising around or waiting for your next turn on the wake, keep warm and dry in your Chawel.
On the Beach, Pool or Parking lot

Can't find a Changing room? Or maybe mom can't let kids go off on their own to changing rooms. A quick solution is to put on their Chawel and change right there with complete privacy. It's easier and faster than having to hold a towel up to change behind

Like most people who travel to hot destinations, you probably never pack a sweater. Yet, when you go from the sweaty outside heat, back into a train or bus for travel, the Air Conditioning is usually cranked. I know, I've been stuck on a top bunk bed on a train in India for 12 hours. I wish i had a Chawel back then!
Pocket: hide your money, phone, car keys and go for a swim
Elastic: keeps your Chawel rolled, and secures neck pillow comfortably
Fleece: doesn`t stay wet, light weight, soft and warm
Simple design: no buttons, no zippers, no velcro to break or catch
Arm holes: this is a new feature. You get to choose if you want armholes by snipping the threads. Reinforced stitching ensures only the armhole opens up
Wearable: on windy ways at the park or beach. Chawel Hybrid will keep your body heat in, and shield you from the breeze
Long lasting: We have customers coming to us from over 6 years ago with their original Chawels. They are built to last.
• Package: includes Chawel Hybrid, mesh bag, eye mask, reusable zip up bag

Mesh bag and eye mask are made from cut fabric that would otherwise be thrown away. This is our way of reducing wastage. As well as being able to use the packaging for separting dirty clothes from clean or use as a toiletry bag.
These travel accessories could cost up to $80 VS. Chawel $30. Save room and weight with the functionality of the Chawel
Fabric: 100% polyester for quick drying. 1 side moisture wicking, other side soft/warm microfleece

column1: At 29 Dan took a night course to touch up on his sewing skills and before long, found that he owned a home serger and cover stitch machine, and an industrial straight stitch. His small apartment was soon filled with fabric, a homemade cutting table, and fabric fluff EVERYWHERE.
Along with working summers as a beach lifeguard, Dan is also a full-time mailman to keep the Chawel dream alive (and provide a good future for his family and little 1.5 year old daughter).
Chawelmobile - the trusty and cool looking Chawel truck
With your support we will have enough to stock up for the 2013 season. This will also go towards 2 big trade shows, and a number of smaller events where we get excellent exposure.
Our big goal is to get an infomercial done and shown around the world. We already have a major group lined up and ready to do this.

Even if we don't hit our stretch goal, this will still get us into the right places, and events. We can also get mini videos displays done for our retailers. Shoot more YouTube commercials and even get you guys involved who want to submit their own ""Just 1 of the Many Uses"" videos for future prizes. And even appear as a true testimonial for our infomercial.

With your support, you get to pre order the new Chawel Hybrid. This is our first release of the customers choice armholes feature in our 2nd generation of the Hybrid. We will also have a limited edition 2014 Chawelendar, and some CanOflage can covers, made with the cut fabric that would otherwise be thrown away.

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help. A big part of our success over the years has been word of mouth. If you like what you see, and know of friends, family or sport teams and retailers that could make use of Chawels, tell them. TELL EVERYONE! Your enthusiasm speaks volumes.
• Like Us on Facebook and tell your friends
• Follow us on Twitter and retweet our updates

• Think about Chawel everytime you get a chill at the beach, or sit in your seat on the plane and realize you will have to use your coat to keep comfortable or tell your neighbour about Chawel if they complain about having to pay for blankets and pillows
Our stretch goal of $200k will help fund our infomercial. Chawel will then take the world by storm. We have it all lined up and ready to go, we just need your help.

I created the Chawel in 2002 during my first season as a beach lifeguard. It was meant to be a replacement for moms always having to hold towels up for their kids to change. Now everyone uses it to changing at the beach or on the pool deck or in parking lots. It's faster than having to hold towels up for other to change behind, or worrying about your towel falling off while changing out of wet swimwear.
No more hiding behind car doors in a parking lot, slip on your Chawel and be changed faster than with a small towel wrapped around your waist.

Chawel developed its other functions/uses, adapting to the needs of backpacking travelers, and the situation that may occur (like flight cancelations or layovers, leaving you stuck in the airport overnight).

Functionality is one of the things that our customers love. Not only is the Chawel Hybrid an antibacterial, quick dry towel, but it also functions as your personal CHANGING ROOM wherever you are. And if you are flying away for vacation, airlines charge for blankets and pillows now, so pack your Chawel onboard with you and use it as a BLANKET or roll it up for a comfy NECK/TRAVEL PILLOW.
Whether you are a world traveler, a soccer mom, a camper, or a beach bum, Chawel will come in handy wherever you are!
As the air gets a little cooler at sunset. A normal towel won't cut it to block the wind. Just slip into your Chawel feet first, pulling it up to your chin. And just like that, warm and comfy again.
From just cruising around or waiting for your next turn on the wake, keep warm and dry in your Chawel.
On the Beach, Pool or Parking lot

Can't find a Changing room? Or maybe mom can't let kids go off on their own to changing rooms. A quick solution is to put on their Chawel and change right there with complete privacy. It's easier and faster than having to hold a towel up to change behind

Like most people who travel to hot destinations, you probably never pack a sweater. Yet, when you go from the sweaty outside heat, back into a train or bus for travel, the Air Conditioning is usually cranked. I know, I've been stuck on a top bunk bed on a train in India for 12 hours. I wish i had a Chawel back then!
Towel: quick dry, antibacterial, light weight
Pocket: hide your money, phone, car keys and go for a swim
Elastic: keeps your Chawel rolled, and secures neck pillow comfortably
Fleece: doesn`t stay wet, light weight, soft and warm
Simple design: no buttons, no zippers, no velcro to break or catch
Arm holes: this is a new feature. You get to choose if you want armholes by snipping the threads. Reinforced stitching ensures only the armhole opens up
Wearable: on windy ways at the park or beach. Chawel Hybrid will keep your body heat in, and shield you from the breeze
Long lasting: We have customers coming to us from over 6 years ago with their original Chawels. They are built to last.
Package: includes Chawel Hybrid, mesh bag, eye mask, reusable zip up bag

Mesh bag and eye mask are made from cut fabric that would otherwise be thrown away. This is our way of reducing wastage. As well as being able to use the packaging for separting dirty clothes from clean or use as a toiletry bag.
These travel accessories could cost up to $80 VS. Chawel $30. Save room and weight with the functionality of the Chawel

Help bring hope and funding to thousands of people across the globe by helping us raise money to get MountKarma off the ground.
Check out our gift images below!  go to mountkarma.com to find out even more!
Crowdfunding goal:  To raise enough money to get our organization off the ground.  To have enough working capital to make this dream a reality.

Our Organization

Mountkarma is a lifestyle brand that represents success and awareness for the world and those in need.  The incredible thing about creating a brand is that by gaining followers and support we can use that to fuel powerful projects to help give back to those in need.  It’s important to us that no matter what we are selling that we are giving back to help make our world a better place.

Action is the most important thing for all of us.  Without it nothing can be accomplished.  With it anything is possible.  We are about action.

The Karma Project

Whenever you purchase anything from Mountkarma a portion of the proceeds go to “The Karma Project”.  Our mission is to help bring hope to people around the globe by taking a journey to some of the tallest peaks on earth.  In 2014 we are going to have a two month long video documented journey from NYC to Mount Everest.  The purpose of this trip is to raise enough charity to build a school for kids in Nepal that are in serious need for one.

We will be not only raising money to build a school but will be collecting messages from around the world and taking them with us to the Himalayas.  We want to give people a unique outlet to release their written thoughts and prayers.  We want to create a humbling and inspiring experience for people who have donated and sent their messages.  We will do this through a documentary from NYC to the top of the world, Mount Everest.  All along the way we will be stopping to help people, build relationships, showcase the people Nepal and India, advocate the importance of our environment, and document the willpower and goodwill we can achieve.

Have you ever sat down and taken the time to write out a thought or feeling that means a lot to you?  If you haven’t you should try it some time.  When you acknowledge the things that you care about they become very potent and powerful.  Now imagine taking that message and sending it on a journey to the top of the world, a place where very few have ever set foot.

We are collecting messages of hope from around the globe and taking them on a journey to the Himalayas to be blessed by a Buddhist monk, cremated in a ceremony, and ash released on Mount Everest.  This will all be recorded in a video documentary that we will be filming as part of “The Karma Project”.  To find out how to send us your message go to the ""sending your letter page.
We are combining giving to charity, our own personal message, and entertainment to provide people a unique experience unlike anything they have ever taken part in.

My name is Kevin Lanuk and I have a vision.  It all began with a single idea just a couple of months ago.  Oddly enough, I was watching the Olympics when an idea came to me.  What if there was a way to help give people hope by taking them on a unique video documentary to Mount Everest?  What if we could raise charity by taking a journey and providing people with an outlet to send their own messages about things they cared about?  I decided to take it a step further by allowing these messages to be blessed and cremated, condensing all of these positive thoughts together.

Essentially, what I’ve done is combined giving to charity along with writing your own personal message.  We all have people and things that we care about in our lives.  Wouldn’t it be nice to tune out of the every day struggle, whether it’s your job, making ends meet, or beating an illness by sending a message on a journey, knowing that you’re giving to charity, and having the ability to tune in, gain hope, find inspiration, and create strength
column2: doing this will humble us and do great good for each other.

column1: I grew up in the Northeastern United States, in the suburbs of Greenwich, Connecticut.  Something I haven’t always talked about is my background, so I would like to take a moment and share it with you.  Most people associate Greenwich with money and kids with spoons in their mouths however
column2: this was not the case with me.

column1: I come from a small working class home in Pemberwick, a place they call HappyValley.  These are modest homes bordering Port Chester, New York.  While my friends were raised by their parents, I grew up being raised by my grandparents, Marcelle and Ritchie.  They are the most amazing people I know and let me tell you why.

My whole life my mom has battled an addiction to drugs and alcohol.  She’s been in and out of prison more times then I can count or remember.  One of the first memories I have with her is being taught to ice skate out on the pond behind our house.  I will never forget that.  I have other memories that will never fade as well.

I remember being taken into the Bronx and walking up a dark dusty staircase into a drab building to see my moms “friend.”  I’ll never forget the distinct smell of that place.  Opening the door into his apartment and walking through beaded passageways I was told to wait in the living room while they discussed business in the kitchen.  My intuition even at a young age of 8 told me something was wrong.  I went to look and was immediately turned away
column2: things were quickly hidden from sight.  That evening while on our way home, I remember the red and blue lights penetrating the rear view window behind me.  The police officer came to the window and shined his flashlight into my eyes.  The next thing I remember was my mom being arrested.  These are the memories that I will keep with me until the day I die.

column1: I’m twenty-three now and my mom is still doing the same things and still making the same mistakes as she did 15 years ago.  I would like it very much to see my mom recover from her addictions so she can spend time with her family and get to know us.   For small periods of time she does.

Recently, she got out of prison again after being there for seventeen months this past October of 2012.  I was so excited to see her, for a month I had my mom.  She had a probational requirement to wear a tracking bracelet and to be home at nine each night.  She was mandated to wear this for one month.  The day she got it off and left the house I was worried about her.  However I let it go because I thought she would be okay.  Two days later, on the day of Thanksgiving she never made it.  She never passed her urine exam
column2: she hasn’t been the same since.  Cocaine or heroin… I don’t know.

column1: If not for my grandparents, who I call nanny and poppy (and still do), I don’t know where I would be or who I would be.  They helped raise me until I was 13 years old.  It was then that I went to live with my father.  When I moved to Stamford I was soo excited.  His home heating oil business was doing great.  He bought a nice big home in the back country of Stamford.  I was very proud of my dad and excited for this new start.  I may not have had my mom, but I had my dad.  I was looking to him for guidance however, I didn’t know that he too was struggling inside, struggling with a serious alcohol addiction.  One that has torn up our family and caused him to lose almost everything he’s ever gained.  His business, his home, and his family.

It’s hard to see your parents or the people you love destroy themselves.  You want so badly to help them.  You want to look up to them and be guided through this crazy world.  Maybe that’s why I am who I am today.  That’s why I want to help people.  People who are struggling.  For me, it’s never been about social status, it’s never been about money, it’s been about being a good person.  At the end of the day, when you look at yourself in the mirror, what kind of person are you?  That has been the driving force for me.  A force for doing good, a force for success.  My background doesn’t make me weak, it makes me strong.  It’s my jet fuel to accomplish great things.  Mountkarma is a projection of who I am and what I want to do for the world.  I want to help create the next generation of forward thinking people.  I want to give the world the ability to come together to create positive energy.  May we live in relationship with one another and be united with one another, in one cause.  I am blessed.

Starting a company and movement is no easy feat.  It takes a lot of time, energy, and funding.  Time and energy is in abundance, however funding is not.  We've accomplished so so much this far with little money.  I’ve put everything I’ve had into working on this vision however we’ve reached a point where we really need capital to help take this organization to the next level.

Are biggest goal is this.  To have enough to make our message bearers of the world trek to the top of Mount Everest possible.  In order to make it possible there are all sorts of costs that have to be covered.  To start we have legal fees.  This includes business structure and permits.  Next there are office supplies.  We plan on having a lot of letters coming through our headquarters and there is a lot of mail that will be going out to our trekkers (message senders).  We have to mail out bracelets to each person who sends their letter.  With that being said there is a cost to produce each bracelet.  Once we send the letters to Nepal there is a bunch of shipping costs.  International ocean freight. ground transport from Calcutta to Katmandu, and then by foot to the base camp.  We will be taking a camera man with us along the journey as well.  Now those are some of the biggest expenses but there are many small ones as well such as having a landline, internet, and P.O. Box.
A sincere thank you from the founder, every dollar gets us one step closer to Everest!
A custom created thank you postcard from us. We will send your handwritten message on our journey to the top of Mount Everest.  A very spiritual &

column4: affiliates page.  This includes a company summary, direct link to your website, and logo.  (no drugs, alcohol, or firearm related company is permitted)

column1: By contributing to our cause your helping us build a foundation for not only a organization but your helping to fund a grass roots movement to help change the world and shape the next generation of forward thinkers.

Its all about a mindset, a set of morals and ideals.  Most people have great ideas and intentions but fail to get there plan accepted on a large scale especially by younger populations becasue they dont have the cool factor.  I really think that we can help bring the important things in life forward by showing younger people hey it's awesome to help others, hey its cool to be friendly with everyone, no matter their social status, race, or ethnicity.  We as a society have made great strides but i still think there is work to be done.  MountKarma can help burn our path forward over the next decade and hopefully beyond.

Our long term goal with mountkarma is to be a global force for change and good.  I see us as a sort of anti corporation.  A business that is about giving back.  Inspirational people that have helped inspire me have been Carl Sagan, The Dali Lama, Hayao Miyazaki, Duane Lee Chapman, and Felix Baumgratner.

mountkarma is a unique blend of helping others and helping ourselves that makes our project so special.  On one hand your giving charity to someone in need to help them ahcieve there hopes and dreams.  On the other your sending a personal message on a spiritual journey.  whether that message is for a sick loved one, or because you yourself are stuggling, the idea behind this is to give people hope and inspiration.  its a means of release for some and a becon of hope for others.  its about creating postive karma.

Hey even if you cant afford to make a donation, its okay!  If you believe in our mission then tell your friends all about us.  Like us on facebook, follow us on twitter, instagram, tumbler, and youtube.  Letting people know this beautiful idea exists is one of the best things you can help us do.

It’s hard to see your parents or the people you love destroy themselves.  You want so badly to help them.  You want to look up to them and be guided through this crazy world.  Maybe that’s why I am who I am today.  That’s why I want to help people.  People who are struggling.  For me, it’s never been about social status, it’s never been about money, it’s been about being a good person.  At the end of the day, when you look at yourself in the mirror, what kind of person are you?  That has been the driving force for me.  A force for doing good, a force for success.  My background doesn’t make me weak, it makes me strong.  It’s my jet fuel to accomplish great things.  Mountkarma is a projection of who I am and what I want to do for the world.  I want to help create the next generation of forward thinking people.  I want to give the world the ability to come together to create positive energy.  May we live in relationship with one another and be united with one another, in one cause.  I am blessed.
What We Need & What You Get

Starting a company and movement is no easy feat.  It takes a lot of time, energy, and funding.  Time and energy is in abundance, however funding is not.  We've accomplished so so much this far with little money.  I’ve put everything I’ve had into working on this vision however we’ve reached a point where we really need capital to help take this organization to the next level.

Are biggest goal is this.  To have enough to make our message bearers of the world trek to the top of Mount Everest possible.  In order to make it possible there are all sorts of costs that have to be covered.  To start we have legal fees.  This includes business structure and permits.  Next there are office supplies.  We plan on having a lot of letters coming through our headquarters and there is a lot of mail that will be going out to our trekkers (message senders).  We have to mail out bracelets to each person who sends their letter.  With that being said there is a cost to produce each bracelet.  Once we send the letters to Nepal there is a bunch of shipping costs.  International ocean freight. ground transport from Calcutta to Katmandu, and then by foot to the base camp.  We will be taking a camera man with us along the journey as well.  Now those are some of the biggest expenses but there are many small ones as well such as having a landline, internet, and P.O. Box.
A sincere thank you from the founder, every dollar gets us one step closer to Everest!
A custom created thank you postcard from us. We will send your handwritten message on our journey to the top of Mount Everest.  A very spiritual & well crafted hand made MountKarma bracelet.

A custom created thank you postcard from us. A custom created thank you postcard from us. Your name forever engraved (ingrained) on our website contributor’s page as a silver member.  A very spiritual & well crafted hand made MountKarma bracelet.  We will send your handwritten message on our journey to the top of Mount Everest.  Your photo and name forever ingrained on our contributor’s page as a gold member.  An 18”-24” limited edition custom created MountKarma poster.  A personalized postcard from us on our mission to Nepal & a set of prayer flags hand sown from Kathmandu.    A remarkable surprise gift from Nepal.  Become an affiliate and sponsor and have your company/brand permanently listed on our dedicated sponsors & affiliates page.  This includes a company summary, direct link to your website, and logo.  (no drugs, alcohol, or firearm related company is permitted)

By contributing to our cause your helping us build a foundation for not only a organization but your helping to fund a grass roots movement to help change the world and shape the next generation of forward thinkers.

Its all about a mindset, a set of morals and ideals.  Most people have great ideas and intentions but fail to get there plan accepted on a large scale especially by younger populations becasue they dont have the cool factor.  I really think that we can help bring the important things in life forward by showing younger people hey it's awesome to help others, hey its cool to be friendly with everyone, no matter their social status, race, or ethnicity.  We as a society have made great strides but i still think there is work to be done.  MountKarma can help burn our path forward over the next decade and hopefully beyond.

Our long term goal with mountkarma is to be a global force for change and good.  I see us as a sort of anti corporation.  A business that is about giving back.  Inspirational people that have helped inspire me have been Carl Sagan, The Dali Lama, Hayao Miyazaki, Duane Lee Chapman, and Felix Baumgratner.

mountkarma is a unique blend of helping others and helping ourselves that makes our project so special.  On one hand your giving charity to someone in need to help them ahcieve there hopes and dreams.  On the other your sending a personal message on a spiritual journey.  whether that message is for a sick loved one, or because you yourself are stuggling, the idea behind this is to give people hope and inspiration.  its a means of release for some and a becon of hope for others.  its about creating postive karma.

Hey even if you cant afford to make a donation, its okay!  If you believe in our mission then tell your friends all about us.  Like us on facebook, follow us on twitter, instagram, tumbler, and youtube.  Letting people know this beautiful idea exists is one of the best things you can help us do.",2.0,0,"2 Campaigns

column2:
>

After six successful Kickstarter projects, the Power Practical crew is at it again, combining our geeky nature with the desire to create products you can use on a daily basis. The Sparkr and Sparkr mini are unique, multi-functional tools that give you the power to create fire and light wherever your adventures may take you.

column1: The Sparkr has a windproof electric plasma lighter on one end and a flashlight / lantern on the other to make for one essential tool.
Fire Up No Matter The Occassion
column2:
>

 

Regular ol’ butane lighters are riddled with problems - they don’t work well in the wind or when they’re wet, and they can run out of fuel without any warning. Have no fear, the Sparkr is here. Its high-intensity plasma lighter - which creates an electrical arc, rather than a flame - works in the wind, rain, and snow. The large 3,350 mAh rechargeable Li-Ion cell keeps it sparking for hundreds of uses. 

Safety First

To prevent any unwanted fires, the lighter also has a safety feature that requires you to press the button three times in a row before it will activate. The button is located near the head of the flashlight to keep your fingers away from whatever you're burning. 

Two Ways To Light Up
column3:
>

 

Chances are, if you’re in need of a flame, you might also could use a light. That’s why we decided to combine the plasma lighter with a bright, high-efficiency LED flashlight.
column4:
>

 

The Sparkr puts up to 150 lumens of light in your hand, allowing you to confidently make your way through the dark. Choose from 3 brightness settings for a light that perfectly meets your needs.
column5:
>

 

You can attach the translucent plasma lighter cap to the head of the flashlight to transform it into lantern you can hang or hold to evenly light up the space around you.

Charge It On-The-Go

column3: '>Twist the flashlight head to reveal the Micro USB charging port
column4:
>

Rather than the traditional flimsy micro USB port covers, we created a simple mechanism to keep your port free of dirt and dust. Just twist the head of the flashlight to reveal the micro USB charging port to easily juice up your Sparkr anywhere. 

Long Battery Life

The large 3,350 mAh rechargeable lithium ion battery can power the Sparkr’s flashlight for up to 4 hours on high and 16 hours on low. When not in use, the battery can hold its charge for up to a year.

Durable and Ergonomic
column5:
>

 

The Sparkr was designed to be both a functional flashlight and lighter (for a full list of features, please scroll down to the ""Nitty Gritty"" section below).

The Body is made of durable anodized aluminum. The lens body has an ergonomically molded thumb grip to ensure comfort when handling. The lighter cap is a quick twist and lock for both covering the plasma lighter and transforming the flashlight into a lantern.

Two Color Options
column6:
>

 

 Sparkr will be available in either the black or silver color schemes. All backers will chose the color of their choice after the campaign ends!
column10:
> 

Does your precious pocket space belong to only the most useful and compact of tools? Don’t worry, we thought about you too. If you want a lot of utility in the smallest package possible, the Sparkr mini is for you. 

With a familiar shape and interface, it functions much like a traditional flip lighter, but it also has a built-in LED light on the bottom of the case that can be used as a flashlight. 

Fire Up In Style
column11:
>

 

The Sparkr mini offers a classic look with improved function. It’s soft touch plastic provides a premium and durable feel. Plastic casing is ideal for a plasma lighter because it ensures that the plasma doesn’t arc to the case and become unreliable. It also allows the lighter to take a form that will feel good in your hand and your pocket. Safe, simple and sleek - this lighter will be sure to turn a few heads.

A light when you need it most
column12:
>

 

Never be caught in the dark again. The Sparkr mini is small enough to carry with you wherever you go. Anyone got a light? You do.

An Everyday Carry
column13:
>

 

The Sparkr mini is compact enough for a pocket but powerful enough to withstand the wind, rain or snow and light up your surroundings. Taking up minimal space in your pocket, purse or pack, this high power plasma lighter and flashlight is ready whenever you need it. No more worrying about running out of fuel - just charge it up while you sleep and you’re set for a few days.
column16: >
column19: >

column1:
Over the years, we have dabbled in many geeky side projects. One of which really sparked the imagination of our team: building a 6ft. tall Tesla Coil. It took us months to build and we wanted to somehow incorporate it into a Power Practical product.  

That’s when decided to turn our side project into work and thought to ourselves, ""why can’t we put one of these in everybody's pocket?""

Brainstorming Begins
column2:
>

We wanted to make something that would be ideal for our adventures and for everyday use at home or work. After ordering and testing all the current solutions on the market, we started to narrow in on what we did and didn’t like about the products. 

We took all the lighters apart to see how we could make things more versatile and compact. After two weeks of rigorous testing and prototyping, we decided that we needed to make not one but TWO products with a similar feature set to fit our needs.

Building the Prototype
column3:
>

 

After countless discussions, we started to get a brief idea of what features we wanted to include in the Sparkr and Sparkr mini. At this stage, our industrial designer started to mock up possible looks for the Sparkr and Sparkr mini.  

After deciding on a specific look, the team set out to built a prototype. This took weeks of hard work and lots of time spent with foam models, clay, 3-d printers, paint, sandpaper, and electrical work.

Putting the Prototype to the Test
column4:
>

We used the prototypes over a few weeks in real world scenarios from campfires to candles and had a great time while we did it! Thanks for taking the time to learn more about our new products and the story behind them. We wouldn't be here without the support of our AMAZING Kickstarter backers.

Timeline
column5:
>

<div>Packaway backpacks look like well… packaway backpacks.  They are made from thin flimsy fabrics and have uncomfortable thin shoulder straps.  We set out to bring our design experience from our top of the line backpacks to a bag that packs away into it's own front pocket!  Using the same tried &amp
column2: true materials from our current line up we’ve created a packaway backpack that you’ll want to use as your everyday bag too!

column1: • 1000D Cordura with waterproof coating. - Military Grade Fabric, extremely abrasion resistant
• Hidden Snap Hook - to hang the bag for storage or to keep your keys safe
The Deploy is the most durable packaway bag we've ever seen... but don't just take our word for it!  See for yourself in this video where we put the Deploy to the test against ""the other guys""
We make the Deploy in Toronto, Canada!  Cut and sewn by our talented team, your bag is made to our high standards and specifications.
From left to right: Charcoal, Olive, and Oak

The Patrol Packaway Duffle (NEW!)
18"" Long x 10"" Deep x 9"" High
Volume - 26 Liters, 1620 cubic inches
Removable seat belt shoulder strap available as an add on when you fill out the survey at the end of the campaign.

If you want the Magnetic Key Chain AND a Deploy backpack, just choose the Deploy. When the campaign is over, you will complete a survey to select your colour and purchase optional upgrades (such as the Magnetic Key Chain).

While most bag companies grow sales by advertising, our high (domestic) manufacturing costs mean we count on YOU to spread the word. Campaigns like this help us raise the funds we need to keep growing and investing in our equipment, our people, and our products.
By supporting our campaign, you'll be among the first to get your hands on our newest bag, and for a price we may never offer again!

We've been making quality bags for years in our own factory, and we have all the tools and experience we need to deliver the quality products you expect from us. Depending on the volume of production required, it may take longer than anticipated to deliver rewards. We rely on suppliers to deliver the materials we require to make our products. We just stocked up on enough seat belt to make over 5000 Deploy backpacks! Other materials are generally available within 2 weeks, which means production will start almost immediately when the campaign ends.
We chose flexible funding because we already have everything we need to deliver this product in any quantity.
Even if you can't help with a contribution, you can still help us achieve our goal by sharing the campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools to tell your friends about our great Canadian-made products!

We are so grateful be featured in the InDemand section and since we have successfully raised our funding on Kickstarter you can back us knowing that no matter how much we raise here we will have enough money to manufacture the first production run and deliver the perks to all of you amazing backers.  This is our first product and we are incredibly excited to bring it to the world.

WHAT IS IT?

column2: >
column10: >First and Foremost Its a Sleek Aluminum Writing Pen

column2: >Second Its a Survival Pen</figcaption><figcaption style=""text-align: center
column4: >
column9: s=2d2367ced811fc5e125f4f4f9c3aef70"" src="""" style=""""/>

column1: • It writes with almost any refill you want to put in it.  Using an O-ring to retain/center the refill and a set screw to adjust the bore length from 2.5"" long to 4"" long you are able to swap out the Fisher cartridge for your favorite refill in under a minute.
• It can be used to start a fire using fire piston compression technology.  Inside the cap is a cartridge packed with enough tinder to ignite around 20 coals.

• It can be used to break a window in an emergency if you are ever trapped inside a submerged or burning car.  The pen has a hardened glass breaker tip on the back that can shatter glass with a single impact.
• It can be used as a self defense instrument if some unfortunate soul tries to take your new favorite pen.

HOW DOES IT WORK?

Watch and learn my friend.

How to replace the writing refill in the Triune Pen.
How to Start a Fire With The Triune Pen.

column2: >
column8: >Matte Black or Matte Silver Anodized Finish

column1: WHAT ARE SOME OF THE FEATURES?

column2: >
>
column8: >Adjustment Screw to Fit Your Favorite Refill. (adjusts using pen clip or flat head screwdriver)

column2: >
column8: >Removable Plug Seals Tinder Cartridge and Keeps the Refill From Drying Out. (removes using pen clip)

column1: •  The hardened glass breaker tip is press fit into an aluminum part called the cylinder seal.  To store the piston down into the cylinder the air must be vented out the back of the cylinder by partially unscrewing the cylinder seal part.  Once the piston is fully seated, re-tightening the cylinder seal will retain the piston assembly by creating a vacuum.

column2: >
column9: >Primary and Spare Internally Lubricated EPDM O-rings

column1: • EPDM Rubber will function in temperatures ranging from -60°F to +250° F (-50°C to +120°C)

• The O-ring on the right is the primary piston seal.  If this one tears or wears out you can use the pen clip to remove the spare (left o-ring) and place it in the primary o-ring groove.  The spare o-ring is in a smaller groove, so it does not wear at the same rate as the primary.

column2: >
column8: >The Cap Can Be Stored on Back of the Pen

column2: >HOW CAN I STAY CONNECTED WITH AION INNOVATION?

column7:
s=8400c3feed744f255cf163535fcece34"" src="""" style=""""/>

Follow us on Twitter

column1: • My Creator and Savior Jesus Christ for giving me the dreams,  drive, and resources to one day bless the lives of many people.
• My amazing wife and kids for sacrificing time with me while I worked on the project.
• My friend Caleb for sacrificing time and sleep to do my videos.
• My friend Gabe for designing the best logo known to mankind.
• My co-workers for listening to my crazy rants and helping me refine the design.
• The guys in the tool room for giving me advice on how to actually use a lathe.
• My neighbor Steve for letting me borrow tools.
• All the vendors who put in time to give me quotes for the custom parts.
• The random people at Starbucks who humored me while I showed them my project.
• You, the backer who can help fund the first production run!

A few years ago I discovered the fire piston and was fascinated by the fact that you could ignite tinder by compressing air. Being able to heat up air to over 600° F with one quick compression stroke immediately reminded me of all my physics classes I had in college and I had to learn more about it. I did some research and all the commercially available fire pistons were pretty large and bulky. I thought it would be pretty cool to turn a writing pen into a fire piston so that you could carry a reliable fire starting method with you every day without having to carry an extra device. Over the next few months I designed all the parts and pieces in my head, but I never brought my idea into CAD to fully detail it out. A few months ago I was reminded of my idea and discovered that no-one had made a writing pen into a fire piston, so I decided it was time to make it happen. Below are some photos of my journey in bringing the very first Triune Pen to life.

column2: >

column1: After refining all the features in the digital model it was time to make it. So I commandeered a 3D printer and printed the outer body of the pen to decide if the size and shape looked and felt right.

After a few 3D printed iterations it was time to make one in aluminum.  I sent my engineering drawings to a few local machine shops to get quotes for a some fully functional prototypes.  When I received the first quotes totaling a few thousand dollars for 2 pens I realized I was going to have to take a different route.  I've always loved making my own prototypes, but I didn't have a lathe so I did a quick search online to see if I could find one.  I was in luck, I found one for a few hundred bucks and so I went and picked it up.

column2: >

column1: A few long nights and a few mangled parts later the very first Triune Pen was born.

column2: >
column8: >Umm, I don't think its supposed to look like this!

column2: >
column8: >And finally, the last lathe part was complete!

column1: And now how to make a pen clip?  I know, how about I borrow a sheet metal shears and a dremel grinder and I whittle the clip out of a sheet of stainless. Perfect, after burning my fingers it was on to bending the clip in my high-tech press brake.

column2: >

column1: I hope you enjoyed a little of the back story.
Please contact me with any questions you may have and please share this project with your friends.

","Hi Indiegogo Nation,We are so grateful be featured in the InDemand section and since we have successfully raised our funding on Kickstarter you can back us knowing that no matter how much we raise here we will have enough money to manufacture the first production run and deliver the perks to all of you amazing backers.  This is our first product and we are incredibly excited to bring it to the world.---WHAT IS IT?
First and Foremost Its a Sleek Aluminum Writing Pen
Second Its a Survival PenAnd Third Its a Tactical Pen

It writes with almost any refill you want to put in it.  Using an O-ring to retain/center the refill and a set screw to adjust the bore length from 2.5"" long to 4"" long you are able to swap out the Fisher cartridge for your favorite refill in under a minute.
It can be used to start a fire using fire piston compression technology.  Inside the cap is a cartridge packed with enough tinder to ignite around 20 coals.

It can be used to break a window in an emergency if you are ever trapped inside a submerged or burning car.  The pen has a hardened glass breaker tip on the back that can shatter glass with a single impact.
It can be used as a self defense instrument if some unfortunate soul tries to take your new favorite pen.
HOW DOES IT WORK?Watch and learn my friend.How to replace the writing refill in the Triune Pen.
How to Start a Fire With The Triune Pen.
WHAT ARE THE SPECS AND MATERIALS?
Matte Black or Matte Silver Anodized Finish
WHAT ARE SOME OF THE FEATURES?
Adjustment Screw to Fit Your Favorite Refill. (adjusts using pen clip or flat head screwdriver)
Removable Plug Seals Tinder Cartridge and Keeps the Refill From Drying Out. (removes using pen clip)

The hardened glass breaker tip is press fit into an aluminum part called the cylinder seal.  To store the piston down into the cylinder the air must be vented out the back of the cylinder by partially unscrewing the cylinder seal part.  Once the piston is fully seated, re-tightening the cylinder seal will retain the piston assembly by creating a vacuum.
Primary and Spare Internally Lubricated EPDM O-rings
EPDM Rubber will function in temperatures ranging from -60°F to +250° F (-50°C to +120°C)

The O-ring on the right is the primary piston seal.  If this one tears or wears out you can use the pen clip to remove the spare (left o-ring) and place it in the primary o-ring groove.  The spare o-ring is in a smaller groove, so it does not wear at the same rate as the primary.
The Cap Can Be Stored on Back of the Pen
Please pledge for one of the perks shown below
Share our project with your friends on your favorite social media platform.
Tell your favorite blog about our project.
The Triune Pen (includes o-rings and tinder cartridge)
Fisher Space Pen Cartridge (Black Ink Medium Point)
Base Package - The Triune Pen + Fisher Cartridge
The Triune Pen (includes o-rings and tinder cartridge)
Fisher Space Pen Cartridge (Black Ink Medium Point)
Premium Package - The Triune Pen + Fisher Cartridge + Leather Sleeve + Spare Parts Kit
HOW CAN I STAY CONNECTED WITH AION INNOVATION?
My Creator and Savior Jesus Christ for giving me the dreams,  drive, and resources to one day bless the lives of many people.
My amazing wife and kids for sacrificing time with me while I worked on the project.
My friend Caleb for sacrificing time and sleep to do my videos.
My friend Gabe for designing the best logo known to mankind.
My co-workers for listening to my crazy rants and helping me refine the design.
The guys in the tool room for giving me advice on how to actually use a lathe.
My neighbor Steve for letting me borrow tools.
All the vendors who put in time to give me quotes for the custom parts.
The random people at Starbucks who humored me while I showed them my project.
You, the backer who can help fund the first production run!

A few years ago I discovered the fire piston and was fascinated by the fact that you could ignite tinder by compressing air. Being able to heat up air to over 600° F with one quick compression stroke immediately reminded me of all my physics classes I had in college and I had to learn more about it. I did some research and all the commercially available fire pistons were pretty large and bulky. I thought it would be pretty cool to turn a writing pen into a fire piston so that you could carry a reliable fire starting method with you every day without having to carry an extra device. Over the next few months I designed all the parts and pieces in my head, but I never brought my idea into CAD to fully detail it out. A few months ago I was reminded of my idea and discovered that no-one had made a writing pen into a fire piston, so I decided it was time to make it happen. Below are some photos of my journey in bringing the very first Triune Pen to life.
Drawing the Triune Pen in CAD

After refining all the features in the digital model it was time to make it. So I commandeered a 3D printer and printed the outer body of the pen to decide if the size and shape looked and felt right.

After a few 3D printed iterations it was time to make one in aluminum.  I sent my engineering drawings to a few local machine shops to get quotes for a some fully functional prototypes.  When I received the first quotes totaling a few thousand dollars for 2 pens I realized I was going to have to take a different route.  I've always loved making my own prototypes, but I didn't have a lathe so I did a quick search online to see if I could find one.  I was in luck, I found one for a few hundred bucks and so I went and picked it up.
Little Red - My Trusty Mini Lathe
A few long nights and a few mangled parts later the very first Triune Pen was born.
Umm, I don't think its supposed to look like this!
And finally, the last lathe part was complete!

And now how to make a pen clip?  I know, how about I borrow a sheet metal shears and a dremel grinder and I whittle the clip out of a sheet of stainless. Perfect, after burning my fingers it was on to bending the clip in my high-tech press brake.
I hope you enjoyed a little of the back story.
Please contact me with any questions you may have and please share this project with your friends.
SOLAR PUMPED LASERS TO DIRECTLY CONVERT SOLAR RADIATION TO LASER RADIATION
G. Gaviraghi, P. Marzocca, J. Miller, Sh. Payziyev, C. Radley*, A. Sinclair, K. Taggart,
*Corresponding Author, cfrjlr@gmail.com, Leeward Space Foundation,
216 Maple St, Americus, GA 31719, 831-425-2807, http://www.LeewardSpaceFoundation.org

It has been proposed to use microwaves to beam down power to Earth from space based solar power stations in Geosynchronous Orbit.  However the Rayleigh diffraction limited optics requires enormous antennas, typically a few kilometers in diameter, and huge power levels, of 5GW to 10GW.   A much lower cost of entry investment (100x lower) is afforded by use of optical or infrared lasers with much shorter wavelength, hence much smaller system size, e.g. 10MW, with one meter size collimator mirror diameter. Since there is no ""grid power"" in space, most spacecraft today use solar power sources, mostly photovoltaic solar cells.  Powering lasers requires high levels of power. PV solar cells are usually less than 25% efficient.   This multiplied by a typical 20% “wall plug” efficiency of lasers results in overall a mere 5% efficiency (95% waste heat!).   This strongly motivates interest in solar pumping of lasers to greatly increase overall efficiency.  Theoretical efficiency of about 38% is possible.  Other potential benefits of solar pumped lasers would be reduced weight and reduced number of components affording higher reliability (reduced number of failure modes) versus an electrically pumped laser powered from PV cells.

Space based solar power beaming would be most cheaply and efficiently performed using lasers with solar pumping, versus PV electrical pumping. High power and high efficient solar pumped lasers have a large potential for other applications, e.g. nano-materials production, materials processing, magnesium cycle of hydrogen production, free space laser communications, energy transmission. There recently was reported high-efficiency lasing (40% efficient, 300 mW) by using an advanced ceramic, Cr:Nd:YAG ceramic laser medium,  and an artificial solar-light pumping source.  This material lases at 1064 nanometres wavelength. This has opened up ample opportunities for creation of highly effective solar pumped lasers with wide range of powers, on the basis of different solar concentrators or Fresnel lenses, which in turn can promote occurrence of new environment-friendly laser technologies.

We propose the development of a pilot line of solar laser based laser research, development and use of high-effective solar pumped lasers taking advantages of the highly-sensitized Cr:Nd:YAG ceramic laser  mediums and the thin-disk laser technologies. To reach this challenging target, project partners will develop new high-efficient lasers, will research in parallel the most suitable architectures of solar lasers and cost-effective solar laser technologies, and will demonstrate space power beaming technology with solar powered lasers.

Solar lasers have been researched for 50 years with major emphasis on free space wireless optical communication and power transmission applications. Realization is now within reach with advanced ceramic laser materials. The innovation is the development of solar pumped lasers by combining advantages of the highly-sensitized Cr:Nd:YAG ceramic laser mediums (other than above mentioned active element of a rod-form with a low concentration of Cr3+ ions) and the thin-disk laser technologies.

If the efficiency of the laser pumped by solar light is 20%, in order to provide 200kW laser power there will be a need for 1MW of solar power which can be harvested from ~1250m2 at solar radiation intensity at the Earth surface ~800W/m2. In principle this can be realized with the lasers on large scale solar concentrators like the Uzbek big solar furnace (BSF), but from the practical point of view and also in order to meet the requirements such as low cost of equipment and quick return, it is preferable to build the laser-power station consisting of fiber bundle coupled lasers on small-scale parabolic concentrators. For instance a single laser module can be implemented on parabolic concentrator with a diameter of 1-2m.  In the case of 2m concentrator the solar power collected will be of about 2.5kW from which 500W laser power can be obtained at efficiency of 20%. So, in order to reach the power of 200kW there would be a need for 400 such laser modules.

Nanotechnology has made it possible to achieve high transparency, large-size, homogeneous solid state laser materials. The ceramic fabrication technology was a fundamental breakthrough for the  development of high-power laser applications. In particular, the wide opportunity has emerged for creation of the powerful and highly efficient solar pumped lasers. Recently, it was reported high-efficiency lasing (38% efficient) by using an advanced ceramic, Cr:Nd:YAG  ceramic laser medium, and a metal halide lamp as an artificial solar-light pumping source. However, the laser output was only 300mW level.

Combining advantages of the highly-sensitized Cr:Nd:YAG ceramic laser mediums (other than above mentioned active element of a rod-form with a low concentration of Cr3+ ions) and the thin-disk laser technologies could allow to reach high efficiency, close to the result obtained with artificial solar light at the laboratory conditions. This will be a major technology breakthrough.

The principle investigator of this project will be Dr. Shermakhamat Payziyev.  He designed and fabricated the stand of the solar laser on the base of the Big Solar Furnace (BSF) at the Institute for Materials science of the Scientific and Production Association “Physics-Sun” (Uzbekistan). Using crystalline Nd3+:YAG rods his team demonstrated the possibility of utilization of 1 MW BSF for pumping purposes. Laser radiation power of 80W has been obtained from single Nd3+:YAG rod with working sizes of 6x130 mm installed in the multi-element secondary concentrator.

Another main result of these studies was the development of a computer model of the solar lasers which is based on ray-tracing and Monte-Carlo methods. The model makes calculations for lasers of a various configuration and active elements of the different form. Based upon experimental results and with use of the computer models there have been performed numerous calculations for different laser configurations. It was shown that the conversion efficiency of solar energy into the laser can be up to 25% of the solar flux energy collected at the focal area of BSF.

We propose to develop new high-efficient lasers, and to research in parallel the most suitable architectures of solar lasers and cost-effective solar laser technologies. Dr. Payziyev will relocate to Clarkson University in New York, USA where the research will be performed, under Leeward Space Foundation Research Fellowship.

This fund is being raised by Leeward Space Foundation (LSF), which is a 501c3 tax exempt non-profit corporation in Georgia, USA.     Donations to LSF may be tax  deductible to certain US taxpayers, e.g. individuals who itemize deductions.
This article in the Economist explains the huge benefits of solar pumped lasers for solving the energy crisis and climate change:
New power sources could be made using magnesium

The DayPac is a smart, versatile and adaptable backpack designed around the workflows of urban dwellers, photographers, travelers and commuters.

It's more than a simple backpack, it's your daily essential carry workhorse, and it does things NO other backpacks can!

 

 

 

 

It comes in Volcanic Black &
column2:
Space Grey.

 How to Use DayPac Everyday:

column1:
DayPac: Volcanic Black

DayPac: Space Grey

 

And it will make your everyday-carry experience wonderful, no matter what you're doing or where you're going!

When something is ""totally fitting your life"", that means everything is in its right place, and be together flawlessly. 

In a word, 

DayPac adapts to your gears and lifestyles.

Let's see how:

Getting tired of arranging all of your belongings inside of a deep hole within your backpack? DayPac is composed of 3 independent &
column2: combinable compartments for you to organize everything effortlessly.

column1: The PRO Layer: This inner compartment provides 15"" laptop and 10"" tablet sleeves with well-protected soft shells for you to carry your electronic devices. Moreover, it is also with several well-organized pockets for you to cope with your daily challenges wisely and efficiently.

The CORE layer: The middle compartment is designed for everyday use, with well-organized pockets and our unique Whisper Closure, You can carry all kind of your private belongings like travel documents, medicine &
column2: first-aid essentials or your clothes for exercising after work, and it is totally separated from your working equipments.

column1:
The EXO Layer: On the outside comes the top compartment, which provides incredible expandable space for you to carry any kind of stuff you want. Even you intend to carry for 2~3 days luggage, there is no problem. 

Always being annoyed about how to carry your stuff efficiently or getting tired of using giant cubic backpack during your travels? We've created a 3D transformable structure to make it possible to change DayPac’s volume from 20L to 36L.

You can adjust the shape when you need more space or try to keep DayPac slim for daily use. Thus, it totally fits your life for working, commuting and traveling. Moreover, it adapts to all kinds of activities that you pursue and meets your creative life.  

Wanna have a short trip? DayPac's expandable and adjustable layers provide you insanely expandable spaces to pack all of your belongings. Say bye-bye to your briefcases and start to carry DayPac, then enjoy your trip from now on. The CORE Layer is able to be adjusted to merge with The EXO Layer, providing even more spacious storage space for a multiple-day trip.

Remember our Whisper Closure Technology? It provides the quietest user experience when rearranging your Whisper Pods within DayPac.

With the combination of the Whisper Closure and Whisper Pods, you can always keep heavier items at the higher position inside of DayPac, to acquire a more comfortable packing experience, and it will provide better protection for your high-end electronic devices.

 

DayPac could be opened in various angles from 30 degrees to a lie-flat status. It helps a lot when arranging your belongings or using any kind of your personal items inside of the bag. It could also stand by you as a mobile office desk, make it possible for you to access working essentials fluidly.

No matter where you are, simply open your DayPac and you can reach all your stuffs immediately.

DayPac is designed to fit devices up to 15"". Simply open it in 180 degrees, and lay it out flat on the conveyor, and watch your laptop go through the x-ray machine without any mess and inconvenience - and should you for any reason be required to take it out of its slot, you can also do it easily, without rearranging the rest of the bag's contents. 

We've spent tons of time to setup the best organized arrangement to let you use our DayPac with ultra comforts. With our thoughtful setup and the whisper technology to keep heavier stuff on the higher position. You will feel how versatile our DayPac could be and believe that DayPac will become your best accompany for a long time.

Your hands are always full. By cameras, toddlers, even beers...sometimes all three. Hence we're inspired from our DaySling to let you reach your belongings in all directions. DayPac's Universal Zipper is making your life easier!

Just a simple action and everything will be so easy to reach. We also create several stealth ""Quick Access"" pockets to ease your daily life and all kinds of situations.

• Sunglasses Pouch: we know you always need to protect your eyes and become under the spotlight all the time, so we make sunglasses pouch on the easiest spot to reach. Don't mention we protect it with microfiber velvet.
• Card Pocket: No matter it is your metro card, credit card or security card, you are able to use your card promptly any time.

• Stealth Quick Access Pocket: We design perfect locations on both sides of DayPac for you to access your stuff easily but it is also invisible to anyone who would try to steal your belongings. You could hide your wallet on the right, Or put your smartphone on the left, and keep it safe and sound at all times.

• Back Pocket: Just hide your important stuff here and nobody is able to take them away. It can also store up to 10"" Tablet for people who needs their digital device all the time during travel and commuting.

No one will notice Nothing when you put your stuff in these stealth pockets.

Shh! Tell no one while hiding your precious or passport in this secret pocket.

""Quick Access"" to ease your daily life &
column2:
any adventure

Keep all the gadget steady when you are hiking in the mountain

Whoever you are, a urban dweller, digital nomad, traveller, or adventurers.
You will discover why our DayPac is suitable for everyone.

Urban Dwellers: The DayPac's versatile style allows people to move from home to office easily, and perfect for you to use with luggages as a much more amazing substitute of carry-on case since its fabulous accessibility and insanely expandability.

 

Digital Nomads: Today, we barely live without devices! Digital products like laptop, tablet, smartphone and their accessories have become parts of our life. With the PRO layer of DayPac, everything will be in its right place.

Travelers: The light weight and compact usage for people can pack and unpack the bag in a second, saving your time, getting more time to relax.

Commuters: The DayPac's versatile style allows people who live in a life on the move to smoothly transfer between places like offices, appointments and home.

 

Adventurers: Seeking challenge? DayPc will be perfect for you to cope with extreme environments with its optimized organization keeping all your gears up with you, insanely expandable space for all of your equipments, and also excellence weight balance while hiking and climbing. 

 

Students: Won't having to think about what bags to take, your DayPac will be the perfect one to go with you do anything. 3 different layers, bunch of organized pockets, perfect details and its style...We know that you need something cool for your campus life:) 

 

                          

Featuring  details like:

column1:
The Daypac contains cushion and water repellent fabric, extreme function behind the simplist appearance. So, with these tons of great features in one bag, You do not need to buy travel bags and daily bag separately.

HI THERE, WE'RE CYCOP 
CYCOP is an urban lifestyle brand that seeks harmony in populated environments. The name comes from “City of Co-optimality.” We are a group of designers and entrepreneurs from USA, Taiwan, and Malasyia. who try to provide people with new and joy experience through our design. In 2015, we founded CYCOP to define a new way to lifestyle products.

 

Risks and challenges

We’ve successfully completed several projects without any major delays and most of our backers are happy about the whole progress, but there is always some potential risks that might happen.

Manufacturing delays: Even our excellent supplier have great experience and has always delivered items on time or has been transparent about expectations. There are still some uncertain factors that may cause delay. However, we will do our best to prevent this issue.

Fulfillment delay: Fulfillment can be complex and messy but we’ve fulfilled over thousands of rewards from our previous campaigns without a hitch.

International delivery delay: International deliveries are subject to possible customs inspections, which can cause delays. These inspections are beyond our control and can last several business days so please be aware of this possibility. Once the item passes the inspection, it will be delivered shortly.

Finally, we will try our best to prevent any kind of issues to cause any delay and do our best to ensure your rewards will arrive in time.

Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Questions about this project? Check out the FAQ

No one will notice Nothing when you put your stuff in these stealth pockets.Shh! Digital products like laptop, tablet, smartphone and their accessories have become parts of our life. With the PRO layer of DayPac, everything will be in its right place.Travelers: The light weight and compact usage for people can pack and unpack the bag in a second, saving your time, getting more time to relax.Commuters: The DayPac's versatile style allows people who live in a life on the move to smoothly transfer between places like offices, appointments and home. Adventurers: Seeking challenge? DayPc will be perfect for you to cope with extreme environments with its optimized organization keeping all your gears up with you, insanely expandable space for all of your equipments, and also excellence weight balance while hiking and climbing.  Students: Won't having to think about what bags to take, your DayPac will be the perfect one to go with you do anything. 3 different layers, bunch of organized pockets, perfect details and its style...We know that you need something cool for your campus life:)                            Featuring  details like:

The Daypac contains cushion and water repellent fabric, extreme function behind the simplist appearance. So, with these tons of great features in one bag, You do not need to buy travel bags and daily bag separately.HI THERE, WE'RE CYCOP CYCOP is an urban lifestyle brand that seeks harmony in populated environments. The name comes from “City of Co-optimality.” We are a group of designers and entrepreneurs from USA, Taiwan, and Malasyia. who try to provide people with new and joy experience through our design. In 2015, we founded CYCOP to define a new way to lifestyle products. Risks and challengesWe’ve successfully completed several projects without any major delays and most of our backers are happy about the whole progress, but there is always some potential risks that might happen.Manufacturing delays: Even our excellent supplier have great experience and has always delivered items on time or has been transparent about expectations. There are still some uncertain factors that may cause delay. However, we will do our best to prevent this issue.Fulfillment delay: Fulfillment can be complex and messy but we’ve fulfilled over thousands of rewards from our previous campaigns without a hitch.International delivery delay: International deliveries are subject to possible customs inspections, which can cause delays. These inspections are beyond our control and can last several business days so please be aware of this possibility. Once the item passes the inspection, it will be delivered shortly.Finally, we will try our best to prevent any kind of issues to cause any delay and do our best to ensure your rewards will arrive in time.Learn about accountability on KickstarterQuestions about this project? Check out the FAQ",54.0,1,"5 Campaigns

We are The Beaver Blog and we cannot wait for our adventure across Ontario in celebration of Canada’s 150th birthday! We intend to seek out and share 150 wonders of Ontario from all across this big, beautiful province. We are Julia, Ian, and our adorable mascot, Benjamin the Beaver, and we will be travelling across the province and blogging our journey along the way on our website, www.thebeaverblog.com.

We are nature loving, adventure seeking, explorers of life, and we wholeheartedly believe in the importance of getting outside and exploring what can be found right in our own province! There is so much natural beauty in Ontario and we intend to showcase it through both our blog and our active social media presence. We feel most at home in nature and we want to share this love with Canadians all across our great nation!

We are raising money to fund the expenses of this journey, as we aim to both drive and fly to various locations across Ontario. Your generous support with go directly to these expenses in the form of gas, accommodations, plane tickets, canoe rentals, and other expenses that we may incur as we undertake our adventure.

We intend for this not to be our journey, but a collective journey of all Canadians and we look forward to engaging with individuals across Canada as we undertake this exciting expedition. We want to embody the adventurous, inclusive, and certainly polite Canadian spirit as we represent the beautiful country we call home.
Join us as we hike, bike, paddle, and climb our way across Ontario!

• I am a 2nd-year, pre-dental student at UC Berkeley.
• I want to offer dental aid to the underprivileged in developing countries.
• I will do my best to help, educate, and provide sustainable resources to those that I serve.
With your help, my team and I can improve lives for nearly 600 poor families within 9 days.
• I will need $2400 to volunteer in two small towns in Panama.

• About $600 will be for flights, and the other $1800 is for International Service Learning, the organization hosting my trip, which also covers meals, insurance, a home. They will also provide all the dental materials needed along with the dentists.
• I am doing my best to canvass and fundraise the rest through other means with my team.

My goal, above all, is to create sustainable resources for the families in Panama. These small towns suffer from minimal to no dental care per year. As a dental team, our work can range from 30 minutes to hours on a patient to ensure the best dental care we can offer. 

I will film my experience, in hopes of motivating other students my age to engage in volunteer programs whether local or abroad. This will be a powerful learning experience and I know I will grow as an individual to better understand the importance of social responsibility as a privileged student studying in the states.
• Spread the word around! Share this link on FB or on Twitter
• Do you want to be part of the experience, or know someone who does? E-mail me!
• Donating, even just a dollar, helps more than you think !
**The Video attached is from ISL's medical mission trip to Peru

The past two months me (Bart) and my girlfriend (Mirjam) have been cycling from the dusty towns in Syria to Thessaloniki, Greece. In the next months we will be cycling through the majority of the Balkan countries. As a photographer I want to capture how I perceive the balkans showing culture, architecture and 'memories' from former Yugoslavia.

The goal of this project is to create a hardcover book and an exhibition in Holland. Staying at peoples homes I will be able to capture peoples visions on their societies, these stories will be a part of the book. In my photographic work I focus most on decay or the return of nature in urban spaces. This will therefore be an recurring theme in the book.
The project video shows a slideshow of pictures I have made during the cycling trip, to give an idea about my photography style. Please visit our website to see more work:

column2: >Balkan in Beeld' is the Dutch title of this project and means Balkan in Images.

column1: When cycling the world is viewed differently
column2: slower and closer to real life. Highways are evaded, small villages where real life happens become important destinations. Sleeping at local peoples homes creates an experience a a 'normal' tourist will never have.

column1: The book and exhibition will show an artistic impression of the balkans. Hopefully it will inspire people to travel more by bicycle.

I will need an estimate of 2200 dollars for this project. This accounts for the design and print of a hardcover book (number of copies will depend on donations) and the organisation of an exhibition. Furthermore I will be able to take some time to stay longer at locations when needed, since we are now travelling super low budget and have little financial room for 'delay'.
Of course, donations are rewarded with a gift. Check it out on the right side of the page.

Please share this project with people you know. If you know any balkan related organizations please forward this project. Please take advantage of the share tools on this page - add a link on your facebook, Linked In and/or Twitter. Thanks!
