To see what we are doing - watch this video.

My name is Carla Geyser. I am an adventurer, conservationist, humanitarian and expedition leader of the 2018 Rise of the Matriarch Expedition. A few years ago I started the Blue Sky Society Trust – an organisation committed to making a meaningful difference in wildlife and conservation here in Africa. I have spent the past six years travelling extensively through the continent, helping better lives of people in need and doing my bit to protect our beautiful animals.

I believe that every act of kindness can have a positive ripple effect and even the smallest contribution can make a big difference. I believe that one person can bring about significant, positive change and I want to be that person. I believe that if we all join hands and put on a united front, we can make sure that the next generation, and the one after that and after that, will enjoy all the natural magnificence that “Mama Africa” has to offer.
50 days. 4 countries. 9000 km. One important mission.

In September 2018, I will lead an all-women South African expedition on a conservation mission to raise awareness about human-wildlife conflict. It’s a sensitive issue and one of the main threats to the continued survival of many species here in Africa. It’s also a significant threat to local communities who live in close proximity to wildlife. It’s absolutely crucial to educate these communities as their support is essential for conservation efforts.
This is what Journeys with Purpose: Rise of the Matriarch expedition will set out to achieve when we travel across South Africa, Namibia, Botswana and Zimbabwe.

The Journeys with Purpose mission attracted substantial media attention in Africa two years ago, when I headed up South Africa’s first all-female expedition from the tip of Southern Africa to Kenya to help stem the tide of poaching. There were 13 “conservation trailblazers” on the team and we raised nearly R300 000 for various conservation projects, drew widespread continental attention to elephant poaching crisis, distributed 20 000 conservation educational booklets to children and provided support to 37 wildlife organisations along the way.
Now, we are planning to harness the same passion and purpose to make a difference combining adventure travel with ecotourism fundraising.

Here in Africa, we are losing an average of 30 000 elephants a year. That’s about one every 15-25 minutes. But the situation is far more grim. Every single day, two conservation heroes – game rangers – are killed as are three rhinos and countless pangolin.  A few months back, we lost the world’s last Northern White Rhino.
Human-wildlife conflict plays as big a role in this crisis as poaching.

Our conservationists grapple this issue on a daily basis as they seek to educate the youth about conservation and in the process empower communities with skills needed to reduce human-wildlife conflict.

The Journeys with Purpose: Rise of the Matriarch expedition will spend nearly two months visiting communities at a grassroots level, using knowledge to educate and empower, with the aim of protecting parties on either side of the human-wildlife divide. We have 30 000 booklets to distribute that explain ways to minimise this conflict so people and animals can live in harmony, side-by-side. We will connect with anti-poaching groups, visit conservation bodies and schools, and meet with incredible women who are doing remarkable things at a micro-community level to assist in conservation efforts.
The funds we raise will benefit four causes: Elephants Alive (South Africa), Rare and Endangered Species Trust (Namibia), Eco-Exist Project (Botswana) and the Soft Foot Alliance Trust (Zimbabwe).
Yes, it is a mammoth task and I understand what we can’t do it alone. I would really appreciate your help in helping us help our animals here in Africa. Every little bit counts.

I would like to raise over R150 000 from this campaign. (Approx $12000). Each of the women “she-roes” on this expedition is paying their own way. But a journey of this magnitude costs a lot of money. I want 50% of the fundraising to go towards paying for some of these expedition expenses
column2: the remaining 50% will be donated to the four nominated beneficiaries. Except for expedition crew perks (all that will go towards covering expenses)

column1: R50 000 for PR and Media releases (so more people around the world are aware of the human-wildlife crisis and will get involved in finding long-term solutions)
R90 000 to film the expedition for 20 days, (1 x camera person) to cover logistical expenses. This excludes equipment hire, logistics, insurance and fee.
R50 000 post production fee to produce a sizzler reel and 30 x minute film on the expedition
R14 000 for branding two x expedition vehicles
R40 000 for 3 month digital + marketing campaign + media monitoring
R50 000 for insurance, medi-vac, passenger liability, public liability  etc to keep us safe on the road
R36 000 for fuel (2 x vehicles) - this is a estimated value, as we all know fuel is sky high at the moment.
R80 000 for 2nd car hire (1 x vehicle) for 50 days.

*NB: R25 000 to buy a 'sunbox' mini projector - which is a movie case that is powered off solar,  that we want to use in rural communities to show them videos of conservation projects. A brilliant way to re-connect them with nature. One of the movies we will be showing is called 'Sisters of the Wilderness', which has just won the best SA documentary at the Durban International Film festival.  You can watch the trailer by watching the below video

So as you can see there are MANY costs we are trying to cover. So any donation will be greatly appreciated.  Below is an example of what the sunbox by Sunshine cinema looks like. Its an INCREDIBLE opportunity to show videos in rural areas that are affected by Human Wildlife conflict.
THESE ARE THE CONSERVATION WARRIORS WE WILL BE SUPPORTING:
• The Elephants Alive organisation in South Africa
• The Soft Foot Alliance Trust in Zimbabwe
• The Rare and Endangered Species Trust (REST) in Namibia

A journey of this nature requires more than meticulous planning and a dedicated crew. It requires a combined effort of like-minded people who are committed to doing their bit, however little, to save our precious planet, one conservation crisis at a time. It’s not too late to get involved.

Whatever we raise, will be split 50/50. Half will be used to fund the expedition and the other half will be donated to the four nominated beneficiaries: Elephants Alive (South Africa), Rare and Endangered Species Trust (Namibia), Eco-Exist Project (Botswana) and the Soft Foot Alliance Trust (Zimbabwe).

There’s no doubt that millions of ordinary people, like you and I, are gravely concerned about the state of our planet and all the precious life on it. But if we stop there – voicing our fears and articulating our anxieties – we will be no different that those who simply turn a blind eye. The future of Earth depends on decisive action. Now. Not later. But right now. We sadly do not have the luxury of time anymore.

Anything you contribute to the Journeys with Purpose: Rise of the Matriarch expedition will be turned into immediate action points. No time-lapse. No red-tape. No waiting. The planning is done and we will be heading out in September to educate, conserve and fundraise, with whatever little is in our expedition kitty. We will set out with noble hearts to achieve what appears to be impossible. But if there is one thing I have learned during my two decades in conservation, is that as more people come on board, the less insurmountable SOS missions like this are.
Humanity has done a fine job in extending the wildlife extinction list. It’s time we take collective, decisive action to remedy that. Please help us make this journey all the more worthwhile.

In 2016, we celebrated the success of our Journeys with Purpose: Elephant Ignite Expedition. Back then, we spent 100 days travelling across 10 African countries turning the spotlight on the continent’s elephant poaching crisis.

At the end of the 16 000km journey, we had created sufficient “noise” about the dire situation (in the last decade, Central Africa has lost 64% of its elephant population) to mobilise communities to take a stand against poaching.

We also raised nearly R300 000 which we donated to various anti-poaching units. We attracted R6 million in media coverage, thankfully drawing attention to what we set out to do, spurring on more individuals and corporates to get involved in the frontline fight to protect our elephants.
We are determined to do the same now, replicating the Courage, Hope and Love that ignited the first all-women expedition, to address the critical human-wildlife conflict.

A journey of this magnitude and purpose isn’t without challenges and risks. It’s a daily emotional rollercoaster: setting up camp, driving long distances, cooking and cleaning chores, dealing with the impact of hearing devastating stories about wildlife failures and the adrenaline of listening to those that speak of successes.
All expedition members are aware of this. It’s about heading out with the correct mind-set and being open to all that Mama Africa throws our way. There will be no on-journey support team
column2: no-one to help us if we get stuck in a ditch (it happens more often than you think) or if we fall ill (we will, most often, be miles away from medical help), or if something goes wrong with our 4x4 vehicles or if we feel physically unsafe.

column1: Of course, the biggest challenge is funding. The more we raise, the more of impact we can make. As much as my team and I are passionate about the mission, we can’t get by on positivity and passion alone.

While this is my second all-women expedition into Africa, I have been involved in numerous conservation journeys in the continent over the past two decades. I know what is required, the challenges of embarking on a journey of this kind, and more importantly, how to deal with issues when they arise. I have also led two other major expeditions in 2014, and 2016 for Dtours. One being 61 people in 2014 , and the other 83 in 2016. Also a fundraising journey introducing and reconnecting foreigners to Mama Africa.

As expedition leader, I have fantastic on-the-ground support in the countries/areas we are visiting. I have been in contact with key stakeholders for the past few months, alerting them of the expedition and securing their support should anything go wrong from a logistics and operational point of view.

My back-end support team, while based in South Africa, is connected with senior conservation officials in each country so there is a clear line of communication in the event of a crisis that we can’t address by ourselves on the ground.
I am also trained in first-aid, know how to change a flat tyre, and have all the equipment needed if our vehicles get stuck.
All women team members are aware that “camp chores” such as cooking, cleaning, driving and packing up, will be shared .
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Follow us on social media. Share our journey. The more digital awareness we can generate for the cause, the more people will understand how critical the human-wildlife conflict is and what the devastating impact on our planet will be if we don’t address this now.

Talk about the expedition to your friends, families, colleagues, neighbours…anyone who is willing to listen. Let’s grow this community of like-minded individuals who really want to make a difference. More hands and more voices translate into greater impact.

Anything you contribute to the Journeys with Purpose: Rise of the Matriarch expedition will be turned into immediate action points. No time-lapse. No red-tape. No waiting. The planning is done and we will be heading out in September to educate, conserve and fundraise, with whatever little is in our expedition kitty. We will set out with noble hearts to achieve what appears to be impossible. But if there is one thing I have learned during my two decades in conservation, is that as more people come on board, the less insurmountable SOS missions like this are.
Humanity has done a fine job in extending the wildlife extinction list. It’s time we take collective, decisive action to remedy that. Please help us make this journey all the more worthwhile.

In 2016, we celebrated the success of our Journeys with Purpose: Elephant Ignite Expedition. Back then, we spent 100 days travelling across 10 African countries turning the spotlight on the continent’s elephant poaching crisis.

At the end of the 16 000km journey, we had created sufficient “noise” about the dire situation (in the last decade, Central Africa has lost 64% of its elephant population) to mobilise communities to take a stand against poaching.

We also raised nearly R300 000 which we donated to various anti-poaching units. We attracted R6 million in media coverage, thankfully drawing attention to what we set out to do, spurring on more individuals and corporates to get involved in the frontline fight to protect our elephants.
We are determined to do the same now, replicating the Courage, Hope and Love that ignited the first all-women expedition, to address the critical human-wildlife conflict.

A journey of this magnitude and purpose isn’t without challenges and risks. It’s a daily emotional rollercoaster: setting up camp, driving long distances, cooking and cleaning chores, dealing with the impact of hearing devastating stories about wildlife failures and the adrenaline of listening to those that speak of successes.
All expedition members are aware of this. It’s about heading out with the correct mind-set and being open to all that Mama Africa throws our way. There will be no on-journey support team
column2: no-one to help us if we get stuck in a ditch (it happens more often than you think) or if we fall ill (we will, most often, be miles away from medical help), or if something goes wrong with our 4x4 vehicles or if we feel physically unsafe.

column1: Of course, the biggest challenge is funding. The more we raise, the more of impact we can make. As much as my team and I are passionate about the mission, we can’t get by on positivity and passion alone.

While this is my second all-women expedition into Africa, I have been involved in numerous conservation journeys in the continent over the past two decades. I know what is required, the challenges of embarking on a journey of this kind, and more importantly, how to deal with issues when they arise. I have also led two other major expeditions in 2014, and 2016 for Dtours. One being 61 people in 2014 , and the other 83 in 2016. Also a fundraising journey introducing and reconnecting foreigners to Mama Africa.

As expedition leader, I have fantastic on-the-ground support in the countries/areas we are visiting. I have been in contact with key stakeholders for the past few months, alerting them of the expedition and securing their support should anything go wrong from a logistics and operational point of view.

My back-end support team, while based in South Africa, is connected with senior conservation officials in each country so there is a clear line of communication in the event of a crisis that we can’t address by ourselves on the ground.
I am also trained in first-aid, know how to change a flat tyre, and have all the equipment needed if our vehicles get stuck.
All women team members are aware that “camp chores” such as cooking, cleaning, driving and packing up, will be shared .
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Follow us on social media. Share our journey. The more digital awareness we can generate for the cause, the more people will understand how critical the human-wildlife conflict is and what the devastating impact on our planet will be if we don’t address this now.

Talk about the expedition to your friends, families, colleagues, neighbours…anyone who is willing to listen. Let’s grow this community of like-minded individuals who really want to make a difference. More hands and more voices translate into greater impact.",3.0,4,"4 Campaigns

Operation Goddess Shield

My dear friend Elise Lorraine is a performing artist in Los Angeles, CA. She acts, dances, and manipulates props of many different types. Hoops, poi, staff, scarves, dance, anything!! This girl is Talllllennnnteeedd! One of my absolute favorite things about her is that she spreads love and joy wherever she goes. I was privileged to travel with her for over a month and it was absolutely influential on my moral compass in the best way.

Recently, Elise's car was broken in to and all her performance gear was stolen. All her LED and fire performance, and safety gear, and even notes and journals about performance and acting! It was seriously priceless stuff but if you were gonna put a price on it it would be 4 digits. Boooooo!!! Like a boss Elise is keeping her head up and moving forward despite the fact that she used those props in her gigs.

Operation Goddess Shield is a funny name but in truth it is me basically being like aw hell no, this upstanding worthwhile lady is not going to have all her amazing and really expensive performance gear taken from her like that. I truly hope that this community can come together to help her replace some of her tools of her trade. We all know how expensive quality gear is.

I have a decent part time gig, and perform on the side but still live month to month. That being said, I am going to set up this campaign and donate 20 dollars. Its not a lot but its enough to add up, and if I can do it, you can too. If enough of us can do it, these dollaz can add up to new props for Elise. Its what I might splurge on a meal (or two haha).  But, this is for something more important. Elise spreads inspiration and joy with her dance and her energy. She inspires literally thousands of people who in turn inspire others. Sooo beautiful.

Please help her get new props.
column2: >If you dont have money to donate, you can still help by sharing this link with your friends and adding a personal message. The more people that see this, the more we could raise. This is my first time doing crowdfunding. I hope it works, I believe in the cause.

So who am I?
So I guess I should start with introducing myself, Im Louis Lander-Deacon a 21 year old, fashion photography student (Secretly my passion is for documentation photography) from London. Im a keen photographer,  climber and alpinist.
Whats the project all about?

These two things alone bring me onto the subject of why I am on Indiegogo in the first place! Im in my final year of university and for my Final Major Project I'm going to Iceland! Unfortunately my university does not offer an access fund so thats another reason why I am here. My aim is to drive the entire ring road of Iceland and document the owners of guesthouses, farms, houses and anything else that it along the way. Ive extensively planned this, but being a typical guy I seemed to forget some of the most important things (and unfortunately expensive things too!) This project is undeniably the most IMPORTANT project of my life, on a personal level and on an academic one! 
Why would YOUR money help me?

Before I explain my project and plans any more, I would like to say, if you do decide to contribute to this project I would be ENTIRELY grateful! A rough idea of where the money will be going is 120mm film, I need 80 rolls of this stuff (Kodak Portra 400), which is where half of the money shall be going! Around another quarter of the money will be funding other photographic equipment that can handle all the conditions that Iceland can throw at it (I hope) as the film camera that I shall be using is rather delicate! Then the remaining money will allow me to seek the assistance of a mountain guide in Iceland, so I can tackle the unbelievably huge Icelandic Interior (well part of it!) There I shall document the beautiful interior and the locals who live in a somewhat cut of region of Iceland.
Any contribution or help would mean SO much to me, the fact that you believe in myself to the extent that you can help me financially for this project! I shall be forever grateful! Of course the project means a great deal to me! This is my final project for university, the one project where the mark really counts, considering it shall be two thirds of my final grade!
Have I done anything like this before?

In the short, no I haven't! I have carried out projects for companies within the music and fashion industry but I have never embarked on a project of this length or magnitude. Ive photographed a personal project named a 365 (An image a day for a year) but that is small in magnitude to this.
What could go wrong?

Of course I am going to run into some challenges, Ive contacted as many guesthouses and farmhouses as possible at he moment, but I shall still be knocking on the doors of many. This shall be a challenge in itself, with a potential language barrier! Even response so far has been soo friendly, but if I can get the word out there, any local help will be greatly appreciated!  Also keeping the film cold could be an issue, but I'll be in Iceland, I'm sure it will be cold enough! 
Please support me!
Any help or advice would be great! Please take the time too share this, as you can tell it will mean alot!

Here's the Idea

Have you ever had a couple of friends over who wanted to play beer pong and didn't want to move furniture around to set up a table?  Or maybe you thought beer pong was a great idea while out at a tailgate party but needed the table space for food and drinks.  We have been there and that's why we invented Oche Pong over two and half years ago.  Since then we have worked with various design, prototype, and manufacturing companies to provide you with what we feel is an exceptional product in both quality and gameplay.

We are already into production

Oche Pong officially went into production on July 9th, 2015.  We have paid over $10k for the molds required to create Oche Pong..  We also have the funds covered for the initial minimum order quantity required by the manufacturer.  In order to get Oche Pong into everyone hands as early as possible we decided to come to Indiegogo for the last bit of funding we need in order to cover some final transportation and packaging costs.

Our manufacturer has notified us that they should have production samples for us to approve at the end of August.  We will verify that they are truly the quality that we want to provide for you then we will approve the first order of Oche Pong boards.  They should arrive late November which will give us time to ship them out to you in time for holiday and New Year's Eve parties.

To get Oche Pong onto the walls, windows, and tailgate tents we have postponed the development of the the feet attachments until early 2016.  If you decide to help a couple of guys out in this campaign we will provide a coupon code for you for each board that is ordered to receive the feet at a 70% off rate when they are available.

How To Play?

Oche Pong can be played with either one or two boards.  A two board game is similar to regular table played beer pong without the table of course. 

With one board you can simply take turns shooting two balls at the cups with most of your normal house beer pong rules.  The first one to eliminate 6 cups is the winner.   If there is a 5 to 5 tie then set up an extra 3 cup playoff at the bottom of the board.   We have also played using two different color or team marked cups on the single board.  Sink a shot into your own team's cup and you drink and lose it.  We have even played with three different color cups and used the center middle one as a social where everyone indulges a bit when a shot is sunk.

This is just us having fun.  As with normal beer pong we know that various house rules and games will develop as the game is grown.

Big Thanks to our Friends at:

Hello everyone, my name is Oliver and I'm 16 years old from Port Townsend WA. After a few years of working odd jobs I had enough money and parts to buy a new mountain bike. The bike was stolen the day after I bought it.
The picture above is me racing my new bike at the Biketoberfest Super-D in Port Gamble the day my bike was stolen.

I've been lucky enough to be a part of the local mountain bike community because everyone I've dealt with has been so supportive. Everyone seems to want to help, especially the Evergreen Mountain Bike Alliance, who has been amazing in helping me with things such as setting this page up.

I compete on two race teams, the highschool team, and the Broken Spoke Racing team (my local shop team). I'm a junior expert this year and race season is coming up, I'm grateful for anything you can do to help.

column1: <h1>Why do we call it UNCO Jacket  and Vest ?  Well, it's simple ...
Hi, my name is Emilia, welcome to UNCO campaign!
I'm an UNCO CONCEPTS owner, as well as a photographer and a bit of a fashion geek. My parents and my sister are my key supporters.
column2:
>
So this is the family small business and project.

column1: My father Tomasz is a manager and a passionate award-winning photographer and traveller. He is the creator and the designer of the UNCO Jacket and Vest. My mother Jola is an avid photographer and traveller always up for a new adventure. My sister Kasia runs successfully her own small business. She is our consultant and enthusiastic supporter.
For the reasons described in detail below we would like to introduce you to the UNCO Jacket and Vest Project.
Our exclusive, extremely protective UNCO Jacket and Vest is created and designed for you by my father Tomasz - an outdoors enthusiast.
• Whether you often go out of town or travel around the world.
• Whether you are an angler or hiker,
are simply a nature lover or outdoorsmen,

column2:
>... you'll be delighted with our Premium, Unisex and Convertible UNCO Jacket and Vest made of unique, top performance EtaProof cloth - the world most breathable weatherproof Organic Cotton fabric !
[Organic cotton - a non genetically modified and grown without pesticides nor fertilizers.  It is also free from toxic agents (e.g., PFC-free and

column1:
PFOA-free).
We think it's important for all who care about their health and health of the Earth !]
column2:
>
UNCO has specially designed and highly effective padding inserts that protect the back, neck and shoulders. 8mm thick neoprene padding inserts also ensure more even distribution of forces arising due to heavy load of equipment carried or cargo pockets.  This solution positively affects user's comfort and protects the spine against unequal burden.

And to top it all, the UNCO is versatile, comfortable, quiet and built to last. 
You'll be ready for an adventure !

column1: UNCO is made from the unique organic cotton fabric<span style=""color: rgb(178, 34, 34)

However, selling to you directly, eliminating middleman, and setting aside the luxury goods markup we are able to offer you

Furthermore, UNCO stands out with its unique combination of features and qualities that you will not find all at once in other jackets or vests.

You can choose any image of Tomasz, an award-winning photographer, and order any product associated with it in any size (Art Print, Canvas, Acrylic, Metal or Framed Print, etc.). The discount applies to all of products that are sitting in the buyer's shopping cart at the time of checkout.
column4:

Your order will arrive in time for Christmas, if you place it in the coming days.

column1:
In order to make the main page more perspicuous we have mooved the description of some perks to Update tab - UPDATES. You can find those perks in Update 8.
All perks are also visible on the right side of this page.
to offer also classic UNCO Vest. The vest has no sleeves and no hood.
Its manufacturing require slightly less labor than jacket. Needless to
say, it uses fewer materials and accessories. Therefore the price of the
In addition, we have also prepared special B2B Retailer's Packs, which offers an additional discount and lower shipping cost.

Sizing and Colours

You can find below the range of proposed sizes of the UNCO Jacket and Vest. Both the jacket and vest allow you to significantly adjust their size, especially in the chest and hip. We hope that thanks to your support we will be able to offer very soon also S and XXL sizes.
You can find below the range of proposed colours. Recently we have decided to add the fourth colour - Anthracite.  We also hope that soon we will be able to offer another one - Olive.
Please be aware that hues of colours displayed may vary slightly depending on the Internet browser, monitor and your colour settings.

We love to travel, explore and stay close to the nature, but first of all we are the photographers. Many times we had to carry our cameras, backpacks and other heavy equipment throughout the day. <span>
We believe that this sounds familiar to many of you.

We have used and tested many different jackets and vests. Some of them were branded and expensive, others not but none of them ever fulfilled all our expectations and needs as the travellers, outdoorsmen and photographers.
column2: >Why jackets and vests do not meet our requirements?

column1: These are the most important reasons:
• The vast majority of jackets can not be easily converted into a vest.
Most jackets don't protect at all our backs, necks and shoulders against harmful and painful pressure caused by the straps. Other jackets and vests don't provide sufficient protection.
The vast majority of jackets is not made from organic performance cotton.
Some jackets are not weatherproof. And in turn, weatherproof jackets do not provide sufficient breathability.

Weatherproof jackets are often made of synthetic performance fabrics and contain various chemical agents (ie PFC) providing water repellency.
In both cases they emit harmful chemical substances.
• Most of the synthetic performance fabrics have limited durability and don't maintain its properties over the years.
Many jackets and vests do not have enough number of pockets, however, a few has too many. You don't need 42 pockets, do you ?

Most jackets have pockets which are not tailored to the needs of the traveler or photographer. In most cases hand-warming pockets do not really warm hands, cargo pockets are too small and pockets for glasses are annoying or do not exist.
Most of the jackets don't have dedicated pockets for bottles.
• Many jackets are too long and thus unconvenient while sitting, crouching or driving, when the lower pockets are filled with stuff.

I can enumerate further and further. It is annoying and very, very frustrating.
We have learned to live with. Unfortunately, often after years of this discomfort one has various health problems. For example with a back or a neck, and so forth.

column2:
>The Remedy Out of this pain and frustration, Tomasz has dreamed of how to improve the design of jacket or vest to make it compatible with our and Yours requirements and free us from this frustration and pain. That’s how the UNCO was born.
In recent months Tomasz rethought and verified his ideas. These ideas immediately appealed to me, our family, friends and colleagues, so we have invested a lot of effort and money in the design of the jacket as well as experimenting and testing different solutions and materials. The design philosophy was simple: UNCO CONCEPTS products are to be top performance - tough, functional, versatile and comfortable.
column3:
>The result is a unique jacket that is a combination of organic cotton fabric with highly effective padding inserts that protect the back, neck and shoulders and functionality tailored to the specific needs of outdoorsmen.

In the recent months we have started collaborating with a professional company specializing in the apparel product development and pre-production of clothing.  This company works with large manufacturers and well-known designers of clothing. Subsequently, in close co-operation with this company, we have developed several early prototypes. Now we have in our hands three pre-production samples of UNCO Jacket and Vest and we are

column1:
However, we continue testing the jacket and work on further improvements. Currently planned changes include some improvements of pockets and flaps, as well as change of zippers and improvement of sleeve cuffs.
We will also appreciate your suggestions on how to improve our jacket.
Our final product will surely be even better.

column2:
>Why UNCO is compatible with our requirements?

These are the most important reasons:

column1: • UNCO can be easily converted into a Vest, hence UNCO Jacket and Vest.
UNCO, thanks to a specially designed inserts made ​​of perforated Neoprene 8mm and 3mm provides very effective protection of the back, neck and shoulders.
UNCO  is made of a premium EtaProof 100% organic cotton fabric.
• UNCO  is naturally weatherproof - it withstands rainfall and keeps out all but very heavy and persistent rain, and creates an effective barrier guarding you from a wind chill.
• UNCO  maintains extremely high breathability. A very high rate of transpiration of moisture guarantees the comfort with high physical activity.
• UNCO, made of pure organic cotton, does not use PFC or other harmful chemical agents to achieve water repellency hence, its Fluorcarbon free (RUC).
• UNCO, made of EtaProof, is very durable and maintains its properties over the years. It develops a lovely distressed patina of age with use!
• UNCO is sustainable - its made of renewable, organically produced cotton.
• UNCO has 16 pockets of different sizes and tailored to the different needs and appropriately disposed.
• UNCO  is also a bit shorter than most of the jackets to make it more convenient while sitting, crouching or driving.

column2: >We are very proud of the product we have created !

column1: All the materials and accessories used are produced in Europe - in Switzerland, Germany, and UK. And the UNCO will be manufactured (sewn) in EU.  Our jacket - starting from its design, protective functions, comfortability, versatility and exclusive pure organic cotton fabric, through the best sliders, accessories and Neoprene inserts for superior performance - is a product of the highest quality.
column2: >We believe that the quality and functional product will meet your interest !  This is why we came to the conclusion that it is worthwhile to start production of UNCO Jacket and Vest.

>

EtaProof Organic Cotton
Ecology and Sustainability made in Switzerland

column1: UNCO is made of the EtaProof Organic Cotton produced by Stotz &
column2:
Co. AG in Switzerland. Organic cotton is grown from a non genetically modified plants without pesticides nor fertilizers. EtaProof Organic Cotton fabric is also PFC-free (Flourocarbon-free) and PFOA-free (Perfluorooctanoic acid - free) wchich are used in synthetic performance fabrics.

EtaProof Organic Cotton - the superb quality and very dense weave cloth - is carefully woven from extra long staple fibres - 3 times finer than a human hair - only found in certain rare species of cotton plant, and using 30% more yarn than conventional woven fabrics.
column3:
> The resulting textile is not coated or laminated. The combination of a dense weave and the swelling properties of the fibres providing excellent weatherproofing.

This natural and organic textile offers a high level of comfort, look and feel, and is extremely breathable, waterproof, windproof, durable, as well as soft and quiet in use. It also has a strong resistance to tearing and burning. These properties are particularly appreciated by people who take a long-term exercise in difficult terrain. 

The body and the hood of the UNCO are made ​​of the double layer of 200g/m2  EtaProof Organic Cotton.The shell and lining are made of the same fabric. Sleeves of the UNCO Jacket are partialy made of double and partially of single EtaProof layer.

column1: The UNCO Jacket and Vest can be used in a wide range of climates and temperatures. EtaProof is similar to the English Ventile® fabric and has the same uses. It is used in outerwear performance garments and have military, medical and special workwear applications.

<i>This kind of high performance cotton cloth, sometimes known as Oxford cotton or Egyptian cotton has been originally produced in England in the late 1930's. Nowadays, this remarkable cloth can be found under the brands Ventile® or EtaProof®, very similar cloth, but made in

Switzerland. History has it that during the World War II this cloth has been used by British RAF to manufacture fighter pilots' immersion suites. They proved to be very comfortable to wear in the cockpit under combat conditions and thanks to their high water tightness and thermal insulation properties saved lifes of many pilots keeping them warm and dry for long enough to enable them to be rescued.

After the war these fabrics continued to be used for the air force, the navy and the special forces. Designs have changed over the years but you can still find suits made of this performance cotton in modern jets with the RAF and other NATO airforces.  Stotz &
column2: Co. AG, has been weaving such

column1:
special dense cotton fabrics for the Mininstry of Defence (MoD) in Scandinavia and the USA since the 1960's, and since 1990' also for the British MoD. These fabrics were also used by many arctic and mountaineering expeditions, and earned a well-deserved reputation among fans of Bushcraft.

Now, when we are a bit disappointed with the modern synthetic technical fabrics, these unique high performance cotton textile is seeing quite the renaissance and is increasingly being used by luxury and upmarket brands to produce exclusive lines of every day
jackets and coats. Read more about History of this unique cotton.

column2: >UNCO Jacket and Vest - Advantages and Properties
>Effectively Protects Your Back, Neck and Shoulders

column1:
UNCOJacket and Vest has two specially shaped padding inserts made ​​of  This unique design gives your back, neck and shoulders effective protection against the harmful and painful pressure, caused by the stripes of cameras, bags and backpacks. The collar has similar but thinner insert and, in addition, is lined with soft bamboo  microfleece.

The padding inserts are flexible, adapt well to the shape of the body, and at the same time they are very resilient.  This unique design gives your back, neck and shoulders effective protection against the harmful and painful pressure, caused by the stripes of cameras, bags and backpacks.
column2: >The neoprene inserts also ensure more even distribution of forces arising due to heavy load of equipment carried or cargo pockets. This solution positively affects user's comfort and protects the spine against unequal burden.

column1: The different layers in the padding inserts (above and below)
A significant number of large and small perforations in padding inserts ensures the maintenance of a high breathability in the back, neck and shoulders.
The soft bamboo charcoal microfleece wicks moisture away from the skin and helps to keep you dry.  Additionally, the bamboo fabric offers natural odour control and is antimicrobial.

column2: >Weatherproof, Water Repellent, Windproof, Highly Breathable, Balanced

column1: Due to the unique properties of the extra long staple cotton fibers and high density weaving the EtaProof Organic Cotton cloth is naturally weatherproof and windproof. Due to the wax impregnation it is also water repellent. It protects you from rain and snow and creates an effective barrier guarding you from a windchill.

EtaProof Organic Cotton allows excellent ventilation and vapourisation - much better than synthetic performance fabrics.
It is highly breathable - the most breathable weatherproof fabric available !
column2:
>Suitable for Wide Range of Climates

The UNCO is also very nicely balanced - warm when it's cold and cool when it's hot.  It can be used in a wide range of climates and temperatures.

column1: With the use of an appropriate base-layer and mid-layer, the jacket is suitable for temperatures below 0 °C. However, after the conversion, the sleeveless Vest works very well in

The UNCO is a unisex product. Its sleeves can be zipped off and stashed in the back cargo pocket to convert the jacket into the UNCO Vest, The jacket also features a weatherproof hood, which can be zipped to the collar or stored in the back cargo pocket when it's not in use. 

The UNCO is also a bit shorter than most of the jackets. This design makes it more  convenient while sitting, crouching or driving, when the lower pockets are filled with stuff.  The fit is a bit on a bulky side and highly adjustable, so it can be worn over a base-layer or mid-layer for comfortable load-carrying for all outdoor activities. To further increase comfort and mobility, the generous arm holes mean you won’t feel restricted even if you’re wearing several layers. The Jacket can be securely held open to maximise ventilation whilst preventing the sides from excessive movement in extreme circumstances.

UNCO Jacket and Vest has 16 pockets of different sizes. The pockets are tailored to your various needs and appropriately disposed.

12 outside pockets (4 zippered pockets and 6 flap pockets) including small neopren lined pockets for glasses, smartphone and accessories, hand-warming pockets that really warm hands, the large and very large cargo pockets as well as pockets designed to carry bottles or lenses.

4 inner zippered pockets, including 2 pockets, which are designed for documents or wallets and 2 pockets that can accommodate a full size tablet or a large map.
The pocket designed to carry the bottles, the pocket for smartphone, and pocket for glasses.

EtaProof Organic Cotton is very durable and tough - the fabric maintains its properties over the years, does not brittle like coated or laminated synthetic constructions.  Moreover, it has a strong resistance to tearing and burning.

EtaProof Organic Cotton is very quiet. It generates no rustle or perturbing noise. Its ideal for camera work, hunting or bird watching where noise would be a problem. It is also soft, it wears like a cotton shirt, so it can be worn directly on the skin.  All these features make it  very comfortable.

Hi, my name is Emilia, welcome to UNCO campaign!
I'm an UNCO CONCEPTS owner, as well as a photographer and a bit of a fashion geek. My parents and my sister are my key supporters.So this is the family small business and project.

My father Tomasz is a manager and a passionate award-winning photographer and traveller. He is the creator and the designer of the UNCO Jacket and Vest. My mother Jola is an avid photographer and traveller always up for a new adventure. My sister Kasia runs successfully her own small business. She is our consultant and enthusiastic supporter.
For the reasons described in detail below we would like to introduce you to the UNCO Jacket and Vest Project.
Our exclusive, extremely protective UNCO Jacket and Vest is created and designed for you by my father Tomasz - an outdoors enthusiast.
Whether you often go out of town or travel around the world.
Whether you are an angler or hiker,
are simply a nature lover or outdoorsmen,

And to top it all, the UNCO is versatile, comfortable, quiet and built to last.  You'll be ready for an adventure !

In addition, you are getting in early, and getting a premium product ahead of everyone else. We will produce UNCO Jacket and Vest in limited quantities, so it will be a unique product on the market.

We love to travel, explore and stay close to the nature, but first of all we are the photographers. Many times we had to carry our cameras, backpacks and other heavy equipment throughout the day.
We believe that this sounds familiar to many of you.  You know the pain !

We have used and tested many different jackets and vests. Some of them were branded and expensive, others not but none of them ever fulfilled all our expectations and needs as the travellers, outdoorsmen and photographers. Why jackets and vests do not meet our requirements?
These are the most important reasons:
The vast majority of jackets can not be easily converted into a vest.
Most jackets don't protect at all our backs, necks and shoulders against harmful and painful pressure caused by the straps. Other jackets and vests don't provide sufficient protection.
The vast majority of jackets is not made from organic performance cotton.
Some jackets are not weatherproof. And in turn, weatherproof jackets do not provide sufficient breathability.
Weatherproof jackets are often made of synthetic performance fabrics and contain various chemical agents (ie PFC) providing water repellency.In both cases they emit harmful chemical substances.
Most of the synthetic performance fabrics have limited durability and don't maintain its properties over the years.
Many jackets and vests do not have enough number of pockets, however, a few has too many. You don't need 42 pockets, do you ?

Most jackets have pockets which are not tailored to the needs of the traveler or photographer. In most cases hand-warming pockets do not really warm hands, cargo pockets are too small and pockets for glasses are annoying or do not exist.
Most of the jackets don't have dedicated pockets for bottles.
Many jackets are too long and thus unconvenient while sitting, crouching or driving, when the lower pockets are filled with stuff.

I can enumerate further and further. It is annoying and very, very frustrating.We have learned to live with. Unfortunately, often after years of this discomfort one has various health problems. For example with a back or a neck, and so forth.

The Remedy Out of this pain and frustration, Tomasz has dreamed of how to improve the design of jacket or vest to make it compatible with our and Yours requirements and free us from this frustration and pain. That’s how the UNCO was born.In recent months Tomasz rethought and verified his ideas. These ideas immediately appealed to me, our family, friends and colleagues, so we have invested a lot of effort and money in the design of the jacket as well as experimenting and testing different solutions and materials. The design philosophy was simple: UNCO CONCEPTS products are to be top performance - tough, functional, versatile and comfortable. The result is a unique jacket that is a combination of organic cotton fabric with highly effective padding inserts that protect the back, neck and shoulders and functionality tailored to the specific needs of outdoorsmen.In the recent months we have started collaborating with a professional company specializing in the apparel product development and pre-production of clothing.  This company works with large manufacturers and well-known designers of clothing. Subsequently, in close co-operation with this company, we have developed several early prototypes. Now we have in our hands three pre-production samples of UNCO Jacket and Vest and we are ready to deploy production.

However, we continue testing the jacket and work on further improvements. Currently planned changes include some improvements of pockets and flaps, as well as change of zippers and improvement of sleeve cuffs.We will also appreciate your suggestions on how to improve our jacket.Our final product will surely be even better. The UNCO Jacket and Vest
Why UNCO is compatible with our requirements?These are the most important reasons:
UNCO can be easily converted into a Vest, hence UNCO Jacket and Vest.
UNCO, thanks to a specially designed inserts made ​​of perforated Neoprene 8mm and 3mm  provides very effective protection of the back, neck and shoulders.
UNCO  is made of a premium EtaProof 100% organic cotton fabric.
UNCO  is naturally weatherproof - it withstands rainfall and keeps out all but very heavy and persistent rain, and creates an effective barrier guarding you from a wind chill.
UNCO   maintains extremely high breathability. A very high rate of transpiration of moisture guarantees the comfort with high physical activity.
UNCO, made of pure organic cotton, does not use PFC or other harmful chemical agents to achieve water repellency hence, its Fluorcarbon free (RUC).
UNCO, made of EtaProof, is very durable and maintains its properties over the years. It develops a lovely distressed patina of age with use!
UNCO is sustainable - its made of renewable, organically produced cotton.
UNCO has 16 pockets of different sizes and tailored to the different needs and appropriately disposed.
UNCO   is also a bit shorter than most of the jackets to make it more convenient while sitting, crouching or driving.
We are very proud of the product we have created !

All the materials and accessories used are produced in Europe - in Switzerland, Germany, and UK. And the UNCO will be manufactured (sewn) in EU.  Our jacket - starting from its design, protective functions, comfortability, versatility and exclusive pure organic cotton fabric, through the best sliders, accessories and Neoprene inserts for superior performance - is a product of the highest quality. We believe that the quality and functional product will meet your interest !  This is why we came to the conclusion that it is worthwhile to start production of UNCO Jacket and Vest.
EtaProof Organic CottonEcology and Sustainability made in Switzerland

UNCO is made of the EtaProof Organic Cotton produced by Stotz & Co. AG in Switzerland. Organic cotton is grown from a non genetically modified plants without pesticides nor fertilizers. EtaProof Organic Cotton fabric is also PFC-free (Flourocarbon-free) and PFOA-free (Perfluorooctanoic acid - free) wchich are used in synthetic performance fabrics.EtaProof Organic Cotton  - the superb quality and very dense weave cloth - is carefully woven from extra long staple fibres - 3 times finer than a human hair - only found in certain rare species of cotton plant, and using 30% more yarn than conventional woven fabrics. The resulting textile is not coated or laminated. The combination of a dense weave and the swelling properties of the fibres providing excellent weatherproofing. This natural and organic textile offers a high level of comfort, look and feel, and is extremely breathable, waterproof, windproof, durable, as well as soft and quiet in use. It also has a strong resistance to tearing and burning. These properties are particularly appreciated by people who take a long-term exercise in difficult terrain.  The body and the hood  of the UNCO are made ​​of the double layer of 200g/m2  EtaProof Organic Cotton.The shell and lining are made of the same fabric. Sleeves of the UNCO Jacket are partialy made of double and partially of single EtaProof layer.

The UNCO Jacket and Vest can be used in a wide range of climates and temperatures. EtaProof is similar to the English Ventile® fabric and has the same uses. It is used in outerwear performance garments and have military, medical and special workwear applications.

This kind of high performance cotton cloth, sometimes known as Oxford cotton or Egyptian cotton has been originally produced in England in the late 1930's. Nowadays, this remarkable cloth can be found under the brands Ventile® or EtaProof®, very similar cloth, but made in

Switzerland. History has it that during the World War II this cloth has been used by British RAF to manufacture fighter pilots' immersion suites. They proved to be very comfortable to wear in the cockpit under combat conditions and thanks to their high water tightness and thermal insulation properties saved lifes of many pilots keeping them warm and dry for long enough to enable them to be rescued.After the war these fabrics continued to be used for the air force, the navy and the special forces. Designs have changed over the years but you can still find suits made of this performance cotton in modern jets with the RAF and other NATO airforces.  Stotz & Co. AG, has been weaving such

special dense cotton fabrics for the Mininstry of Defence (MoD) in Scandinavia and the USA since the 1960's, and since 1990' also for the British MoD. These fabrics were also used by many arctic and mountaineering expeditions, and earned a well-deserved reputation among fans of Bushcraft.Now, when we are a bit disappointed with the modern synthetic technical fabrics, these unique high performance cotton textile is seeing quite the renaissance and is increasingly being used by luxury and upmarket brands to produce exclusive lines of every day
jackets and coats.  Read more about History of this unique cotton.

The most effective way to be seen when you ride

Since 2007 we've been making cycling more safe and more fun for everyone.  Join us - help fulfill our vision by pledging your support and sharing this project with your friends! 

 

Automatic Awesomeness

All of our new models reliably turn on when you need them.  Just ride your bike.  Our unique triple-sensor technology detects wheel rotation and light levels.  It won't accidentally turn on if it just gets bumped on a bike rack.  If you still want a power button, our A15 &
column2:
A30 lights let you choose between Off, On, and Smart-Auto-On yourself.

 

Total Convenience

Our lights include a stainless steel strap for locking the light onto your spokes.  You can't forget your lights when you leave home or work, and you can't lose them.  The USB-battery capsule pops out for indoor charging, and should last for months between charges.

You may only need to charge your light 4-6 times per year. (A10 and A15 models)

 

Confidence on the Road

We've talked to thousands of our customers around the world.  They tell us how much they love our lights, and how confident they feel when they ride.  No matter where you ride, it really helps to know that you'll be visible from every direction.

 

Durable and Affordable

The best bike lights shouldn't just be for an elite few.  Our products feature a solid rubber molding that lasts for years in the worst conditions.  We give you a 3-year warranty.  Our new Monkey Lights fit nearly any type of bike and are more affordable than ever.  (Check minimum wheel size in the specification chart.  Bicycle wheels with spokes are required).

Waterproof and Iceproof:

Dust and Mudproof:

 

Sleek and Functional Design

Our new models are thinner than ever.  Our solid rubber molding lets us make our lights thinner than any type of plastic shell.  The lights last for years and won't crack or scratch.

A10 &
column3:
A15: Smaller than a typical wheel reflector, these lights put out 25 - 40 lumens of light.

Patented Hub-Mount Battery: Our hub-mount battery offsets the (small) weight of the light and minimizes rotating weight.  This keeps your wheels balanced and responsive when you ride.

A30: The A30 is less than half the size of its predecessor, yet it packs all the functionality and more.  A30 introduces a new molding method that lets us create a more rounded, aerodynamic profile.

visible at any speed, and the patterns are visible from 10 to 40 mph (15 to 65 km/h).

The A30 can include all these, and we're making even more!

What our testers are saying

We've rolled out prototypes for riders to test in real conditions.  They loved what they experienced.  Now we're ready to reach out to the Kickstarter community to get these lights out onto the market.  And we're offering them an affordable price so they can be accessible for any rider.

How do I use it?

1) Install your light: Mount your light and battery to your bike wheel and secure with our anti-theft strap.

2) Ride your bike.

That's it.  

With the A15 or A30, you can change colors or patterns if you like, or just leave your light in shuffle mode.

How does it work?

Each light contains a row of ultra-bright LEDs.  The light is bright and visible at any speed.  Once you start rolling, colorful effects and patterns are created within your wheel.

The light attaches to your spokes, and the battery pack secures to your hub.  The light turns on automatically when your wheel starts to spin in low light conditions.  The battery is USB-rechargeable.

Monkey Lights 2007 - 2017

Specifications and Details

 

Which light is right for me?

","The most effective way to be seen when you rideSince 2007 we've been making cycling more safe and more fun for everyone.  Join us - help fulfill our vision by pledging your support and sharing this project with your friends!  Automatic AwesomenessAll of our new models reliably turn on when you need them.  Just ride your bike.  Our unique triple-sensor technology detects wheel rotation and light levels.  It won't accidentally turn on if it just gets bumped on a bike rack.  If you still want a power button, our A15 & A30 lights let you choose between Off, On, and Smart-Auto-On yourself. Total ConvenienceOur lights include a stainless steel strap for locking the light onto your spokes.  You can't forget your lights when you leave home or work, and you can't lose them.  The USB-battery capsule pops out for indoor charging, and should last for months between charges.You may only need to charge your light 4-6 times per year. (A10 and A15 models) Confidence on the RoadWe've talked to thousands of our customers around the world.  They tell us how much they love our lights, and how confident they feel when they ride.  No matter where you ride, it really helps to know that you'll be visible from every direction. Durable and AffordableThe best bike lights shouldn't just be for an elite few.  Our products feature a solid rubber molding that lasts for years in the worst conditions.  We give you a 3-year warranty.  Our new Monkey Lights fit nearly any type of bike and are more affordable than ever.  (Check minimum wheel size in the specification chart.  Bicycle wheels with spokes are required).Waterproof and Iceproof:Dust and Mudproof: Sleek and Functional DesignOur new models are thinner than ever.  Our solid rubber molding lets us make our lights thinner than any type of plastic shell.  The lights last for years and won't crack or scratch.A10 & A15: Smaller than a typical wheel reflector, these lights put out 25 - 40 lumens of light.Patented Hub-Mount Battery: Our hub-mount battery offsets the (small) weight of the light and minimizes rotating weight.  This keeps your wheels balanced and responsive when you ride.A30: The A30 is less than half the size of its predecessor, yet it packs all the functionality and more.  A30 introduces a new molding method that lets us create a more rounded, aerodynamic profile.How our A30 will look compared to its predecessorWhat our A10/A15 will look like on your spokesColors & ThemesA10 Combo: Set of 2 lights with a classic look: White on your front wheel and Red on your back wheel.A15: Full color: includes 8 colors and 5 simple themes that you can change anytime with the press of a button.  Themes include solid colors, stripes, and blends.A30: More light, more color and more fun. The A30 includes over 40 amazing patterns that display as you ride. Use the buttons to change anytime - or leave the light in shuffle mode. The A30 is bright & visible at any speed, and the patterns are visible from 10 to 40 mph (15 to 65 km/h).The A30 can include all these, and we're making even more!What our testers are sayingWe've rolled out prototypes for riders to test in real conditions.  They loved what they experienced.  Now we're ready to reach out to the Kickstarter community to get these lights out onto the market.  And we're offering them an affordable price so they can be accessible for any rider.How do I use it?1) Install your light: Mount your light and battery to your bike wheel and secure with our anti-theft strap.2) Ride your bike.That's it.  With the A15 or A30, you can change colors or patterns if you like, or just leave your light in shuffle mode.How does it work?Each light contains a row of ultra-bright LEDs.  The light is bright and visible at any speed.  Once you start rolling, colorful effects and patterns are created within your wheel.The light attaches to your spokes, and the battery pack secures to your hub.  The light turns on automatically when your wheel starts to spin in low light conditions.  The battery is USB-rechargeable.Monkey Lights 2007 - 2017Specifications and Details Which light is right for me?",13.0,0,"2 Campaigns

column1: We are very excited to launch our first project on Indiegogo.  The name Vorx stands for Versatile, Outgoing, Revolution and Xenogeneic.  Our goal is to introduce functional but yet interesting concepts into reality and share with everyone that likes our idea.

The core concept of Hexglo is simple but very different from any other sports bottle in the market. We want to create a bottle that is useful for cycling, training, hiking and camping but also practical for everyday life use.
Hexglo features with single handed operated lock &
column2: open cap which is stylish and ergonomically friendly.  As the same with all other high quality drinking bottle, the body is made with Triton plastic which is 100% BPA free and eco-friendly.

column1: Operating the lantern is just a simple click of button.  The unique hexagonal profile design of our bottle body allows for a nice and even spread of light diffusion, which makes it ideal to use as a personal lantern at either indoor or outdoor.

The light module at bottom is detachable for use.  Simply detach it by turn and pull, it can be used as a wide angle flashlight.  For camping or other outdoor use, you can also hang the module inside of a tent or on a tree, and it will become a handy spot light.

We have designed the size of Hexglo such that it can fits into any bicycle holder.  When the light is switched on as flash mode during cycling, it will not only make it easier to locate the bottle but at the same time give a very good visual alert to others.  This safety feature is what we think is good for city riding.
Hexglo is also suitable for in-car use.  In case of vehicle break down, the flash mode can provide additional signal indication to other drivers and avoid accidents.
Simply use the breathing light function as a soft mood light for sleeping or just to relax.
The inbuilt 3600 mAh lithium battery is good enough to power maximum brightness for up to 4 hours on bright and 8 hours on normal.
We value your input to our campaign

We have spent hours of research and development over the past eight months on this project. In Vorx we have a full team of design and engineering specialist, thus we are very confident for a successful completion. Your support as our backer will be the last piece of puzzle bringing this product into reality.  The fundings will be well used for the final touch ups of our production molds (which will be the largest part of our initial set up cost), and to meet with our manufacturer's requirement on minimum material orderings.  We will also set a certain part of budget on component sourcing and testings in order to deliver the product in it's finest detail.
If you’d like to become a Hexglo distributor, please email us at sales@kimetics.com.hk.

While we have spent long time on product developments we are getting great help from other people for our video production.  If you like our presentation too then please share to your friends to see more of their fantastic work:
Shirley To - Thank you for such a great video with animations!
David Hughes - We love the music you created!
Jennifer Wabich - Last but not least we want to give you our biggest thank you!  Your appearance in the video have completed our product story!

We are almost ready to go. All the team members in Vorx are experienced with design, manufacturing and trading for international markets. We believe that all aspects of preparations are covered in this project, and that the risks are very minimal. However we are always prepared on the worst case scenario thus here're our list of concerns: 
Funding Target: 
We hope that we can meet with our funding goal but in case of unsuccessful situation then we will not be able to deliver this product. 
Quantity: 
We are prepared to fulfil larger than expected orders, however in case of order is much larger than expected, our promised delivery time will be extended. 
Shipping: 
Dealing with large numbers of individual shipments can be a painful task to our team. However we are in partnership with top tier fulfilment company, thus the logistic problem will be kept into minimal. 
Lost Packages: 
This could be an uncontrollable risk but we can assure you with our soonest follow ups should this be happening.

Apart from supporting us on Indiegogo you can also share about us on your social media.  Alternatively if you would like to explore more about our product story / project status, please follow us on our social networks below:

An advertising car drives a year throughout Europe, toured countries and cities. It is fitted over and over with advertising messages and labels. You may think that advertising on a vehicle is old news? Not, however, when a brightly colored, eye-catching advertising car travels through a great part of the world. There is a lot of creative energy in each individual logo and all these creativity together result in the art work ""onemillioncar"". Once the car is completely emerged in advertisement, ""onemillioncar"" sets off on the long trek through Europe.
onemillioncar therefor, because the value of all advertising space adds up to 1 million euros.

But the car can do much, much more than just being a show in itself - it also offers free carpool opportunities. Have you ever sat inside an advertising column and waved to passersby? You can do so - no problem. The rolling art and advertising object is game for anything. For example scavenger hunts would be a great thing: who finds the colorful car first? Furthermore, those who have the same route as this ambassador on wheels, could use it for a joint venture. How amazing is
column2: >free rent on a car used for taking holidays?

column1: And the main thing for passersby is that they should have fun,
make a video in front of the car where they dance or even sing
maybe to send a message to your love

And the best entries received will get a prize for their creativity and effort.

Of course, everyone should know where his advertising message currently is ... therefore, there is a GPS as well as a map on the Internet.
A touch of adventure is always good because life is serious enough. The colorful car also experiences
column2: >many adventures along the way. And this

column1: For more information about renting an advertising space, please visit our site www.onemillioncar.com

column3: >WHAT WILL THE FUNDS BE USED FOR?

column1:
My past attempts making the project known, unfortunately didn't have much success. So I need professional support through a marketing agency, which will help me in spreading of the project. Therefore, I would like to invest € 8,000.
In addition, I still need the necessary vehicle for the project. The remaining € 42,000 will be used for buying the vehicle.
If the target is not reached, the money received is used for marketing and promotional activities.

column2:
>THE BRAIN is a computer scientist and the creator of this project.
My wife,
column3:
>THE HEART, is a pedagogue working for the Ludwig-Maximilians University of Munich and gives me moral support.
My daughter,
column4:
>THE SOUL, is the person i get in touch when i need a break. She can not speak, but i think she had the idea with the dance choreography.
We all live in Germany, Munich.

column1: • If you are a marketing Specialist and want to help, please contact us at pr@onemillioncar.com
I am still looking for a funny dance choreography for the project. It will be the official dance of onemillioncar. You can share your videos at www.facebook.com/onemillioncar
If you have further ideas how to involve the car in funny games you can contact us at ideas@onemillioncar.com
And of course if you know somebody having an own business and maybe interested in placing his logo on the car, tell him/her about this project.

Hi!  My name is Kim and I am a wife and mother of two.  I recently went back to work as a Legal Assistant at a law firm and my husband David stays home with our two girls while dealing with his Hodgkins Lymphoma Cancer.  My daughter Isabella is in 2nd grade and my little girl Elena is two and stays home with dad.  We have been blessed with wonderful family who is such an amazing support who helps our family is so many ways.  We have also been blessed beyond measure with so many wonderful friends who are also a constant support for us.

My husband and I were raised Catholic, but have gotten involved in Christian life by attending a Christian church and participating in many different bible studies. God has brought so many wonderful people into our lives that have helped us grow in our faith and learn more about God and Jesus.

We have been attending Kenmore Alliance Church for over a year now and it was several months ago when I was sitting in service and our pastor was talking about an orphanage in Swaziland that our church ministers too and helps.  He mentioned an upcoming trip to Swaziland to help those at the orphanage and nearby villages.  I was so moved by the presentation and seeing all the kids faces, that I knew I had to go.  My family and I have been going through several trials lately, but through Gods grace and strength we are surviving and I know that this is something he wants me to do.

I thank you for your time and consideration of my Swaziland missions trip and pray that with your prayers and possible financial help, I will be able to make the trip to Swaziland and spread God's word to those in need. Thank you!!

Everyone who shares our campaign link on social media and posts on comments will get a FREE Survival Bracelets! Only 100 Left！
column5:
>

 More Application Scenarios

Compared with the 1st generation, PockeTool 2.0 is fatter with more well-rounded features and designs for outdoor activities. A pulley is added into the design with a maximum load of 10kg, which can easily lift and move heavy objects. The optimized flint device is far superior and makes life more convenient. Another remarkable feature is the added sharp blade, which not only allows you to quickly cut rope or stuff but with the serrated design at the end of the blade, it can also be used for cutting off branches, etc.
column11: >PockeTool 2.0 has all the basic tools you need in daily life e.g. bottle opener, letter opener, cardboard box opener, flat head screwdriver, Philips screwdriver, staple remover, scratching lottery scratchers and cutting off tags, etc. This tiny and lightweight multitool works great as an everyday carry.
column18:
>  More Application Scenarios

PockeTool 2.0 includes multiple hex wrenches that can be used as M7-M13 wrench spanners. It also has a Philips screwdriver and a flat head screwdriver. Its unique geometric design allows maximum use of any given screw type. PockeTool 2.0 is a good example of maximizing simplicity while achieving functionality. The semi-circle at both ends of the tool provides a slot to fit the wires, in order to clip the wire/rope or twist a thick wire more easily. Along with a multi-functional 4.5cm, a long ruler provides you a handy measuring instrument for instant measurement.

 

After numerous tests, we finally unified the product into 420 stainless steel.
column21:
> 

Made of high-quality 420-grade stainless steel with stonewash finish that hides minor scratches very well. PockeTool 2.0 is extremely corrosion resistant which prevents rust formation and protects the underlying metal. It is tough, reliable, extra-durable, super lightweight, and can cling to any magnetic surface. 

PocketTool 2.0 looks pretty sexy with the beautiful stonewashed finish and makes it more appealing. It is designed ergonomically with excellent performance and feels nice in hand. Its smooth surface and obtuse edge feel good, ensures it is safe to use and protect you from cutting yourself while using it. 

This handy PockeTool 2.0 is compact for travel that can ride in carry-on luggage/backpack, hang it from your belt loop or jeans, and even small enough to drop into a pocket/wallet with ease. Great for normal people living their everyday lives and a necessity for travelers, backpackers, hikers, bicyclists and adventurers.
