column1:
0,"

Welcome to Slô, a retreat where silence, (inner)peace and nature are central. We believe it’s essential to switch off the noise to appreciate the beauty of life and recharge your batteries surrounded by nature.

Our 6 off-grid hanging cabins invite you to escape from the rat race and reconnect with what ultimately matters most: nature, yourself and your loved ones. Nestled in a forest in the Belgian Ardennes, our comfortable minimalist design retreats remind you that true luxury is all around you. 

WHAT:

We offer an experience in 6 off-grid cabins, up in the trees hidden in a 11 ha forest. We combined unique architecture with minimalist design and a low ecological footprint.

While we aim to minimise our impact on nature, our goal is to maximise our impact on you.  Our 6 cabins come in 3 unique designs – quite literally – detach you from the ground and the hustle and bustle of daily life.

Providing a unique hidden location is the first axe through which we try to let you deconnect. the second way we try to do is through the amenities in the cabins. This is not your ordany hotelroom where heating and cooking are taken for granted. We deliberately want you to give attention to things, that would be normally considered as trivial. By focussing on these ""simple"" things, we want you to defray your focus from your daily stressed life.

The last awareness we want to create is our ecological footprint. We use 80% less water than normal residential dwellings. This is through eco-friendly techniques but mainly by simply using less water. Instead of waisting 90 liters of clean water through showers and toilets we provide hot showers that require the minimum time to wash yourself as well as composting toilets that are inspired by sailing boats.

Our 3 types:

  • The Glass Cube

Suspended at more than 5 metres above the ground, this bright glass cabin provides singles or couples with an unforgettable experience of being 360° surrounded by nature. The only way up is via a ladder. And once you’re in, there’s a good chance you might not want to leave anymore. The 28m² Glass Cube cabin has a mezzanine that sleeps 2 people and comes with an off-grid kitchen, bathroom and composting toilet.

To allow you to fully see, experience and even smell nature the Glass Cube also has a 15m² rooftop terrace between the treetops with unique views on your surroundings. 

 

  • The Flying Fermette

Perhaps you long to get out in nature, but you also appreciate the cosy, private feeling of more secluded shelter at night. Then our Flying Fermette will make you right feel at home whilst constantly reminding you that you are on an unforgettable adventure between the treetops. At 4 metres above the ground, the 31m² cabin has 2 large glass fronts on both ends of the cabin that provide splendid views on the surrounding forest. The 5m² covered terrace allows you to get just that little bit closer to nature, even when it rains.

The walls and roof, made from recycled barn wood, give this retreat an unexpected familiar feel in an uncommon setting as it is inspired by the traditional Belgian farmhouse. The Flying Fermette cabin has an off-grid kitchen, bathroom with composting toilet, living room and a dining room followed with the covered patio attached to it. The mezzanine accommodates 2 people and a sofa with mattress can sleep 2 more guests.

  • The cathedral

Our impressive 8-metre tall Cathedral offers the best of both worlds for you and your family. It’s a safe haven close to the earth. At 1 metre above the ground, it’s easily – and safely – accessible for all ages. This 30m² sturdy retreat is all about real and authentic connection as its design encourages you to spend uninterrupted time together. At the same time, you’ll never lose touch with nature through carefully framed views on each side of the cabin. Create an intimate atmosphere by making a warm, cosy fire together in the stove.

And what better way to finish a magical day than by stargazing from the 8-metre high rooftop terrace between the highest treetops? The Cathedral provides shelter to a maximum of 5 people. The 2 mezzanines each have room for 2 people to sleep and a sofa bed can sleep a 5th person. The cabin has an off grid kitchen, living room, dining room and a bathroom with a toilet and shower.

Timing

We are in the last stage of the construction phase which are the interior works.

What will the money be used for?

The entire project was financed through a mix of our own equity and traditional bankloans. The money we raise is a way to create working capital in advance so we can acquire supplies for the hotel exploitation.

","Welcome to Slô, a retreat where silence, (inner)peace and nature are central. We believe it’s essential to switch off the noise to appreciate the beauty of life and recharge your batteries surrounded by nature.Our 6 off-grid hanging cabins invite you to escape from the rat race and reconnect with what ultimately matters most: nature, yourself and your loved ones. Nestled in a forest in the Belgian Ardennes, our comfortable minimalist design retreats remind you that true luxury is all around you. WHAT:We offer an experience in 6 off-grid cabins, up in the trees hidden in a 11 ha forest. We combined unique architecture with minimalist design and a low ecological footprint.While we aim to minimise our impact on nature, our goal is to maximise our impact on you.  Our 6 cabins come in 3 unique designs – quite literally – detach you from the ground and the hustle and bustle of daily life.Providing a unique hidden location is the first axe through which we try to let you deconnect. the second way we try to do is through the amenities in the cabins. This is not your ordany hotelroom where heating and cooking are taken for granted. We deliberately want you to give attention to things, that would be normally considered as trivial. By focussing on these ""simple"" things, we want you to defray your focus from your daily stressed life.The last awareness we want to create is our ecological footprint. We use 80% less water than normal residential dwellings. This is through eco-friendly techniques but mainly by simply using less water. Instead of waisting 90 liters of clean water through showers and toilets we provide hot showers that require the minimum time to wash yourself as well as composting toilets that are inspired by sailing boats.Our 3 types:The Glass CubeSuspended at more than 5 metres above the ground, this bright glass cabin provides singles or couples with an unforgettable experience of being 360° surrounded by nature. The only way up is via a ladder. And once you’re in, there’s a good chance you might not want to leave anymore. The 28m² Glass Cube cabin has a mezzanine that sleeps 2 people and comes with an off-grid kitchen, bathroom and composting toilet.To allow you to fully see, experience and even smell nature the Glass Cube also has a 15m² rooftop terrace between the treetops with unique views on your surroundings.  The Flying FermettePerhaps you long to get out in nature, but you also appreciate the cosy, private feeling of more secluded shelter at night. Then our Flying Fermette will make you right feel at home whilst constantly reminding you that you are on an unforgettable adventure between the treetops. At 4 metres above the ground, the 31m² cabin has 2 large glass fronts on both ends of the cabin that provide splendid views on the surrounding forest. The 5m² covered terrace allows you to get just that little bit closer to nature, even when it rains.The walls and roof, made from recycled barn wood, give this retreat an unexpected familiar feel in an uncommon setting as it is inspired by the traditional Belgian farmhouse. The Flying Fermette cabin has an off-grid kitchen, bathroom with composting toilet, living room and a dining room followed with the covered patio attached to it. The mezzanine accommodates 2 people and a sofa with mattress can sleep 2 more guests.The cathedralOur impressive 8-metre tall Cathedral offers the best of both worlds for you and your family. It’s a safe haven close to the earth. At 1 metre above the ground, it’s easily – and safely – accessible for all ages. This 30m² sturdy retreat is all about real and authentic connection as its design encourages you to spend uninterrupted time together. At the same time, you’ll never lose touch with nature through carefully framed views on each side of the cabin. Create an intimate atmosphere by making a warm, cosy fire together in the stove.And what better way to finish a magical day than by stargazing from the 8-metre high rooftop terrace between the highest treetops? The Cathedral provides shelter to a maximum of 5 people. The 2 mezzanines each have room for 2 people to sleep and a sofa bed can sleep a 5th person. The cabin has an off grid kitchen, living room, dining room and a bathroom with a toilet and shower.TimingWe are in the last stage of the construction phase which are the interior works.What will the money be used for?The entire project was financed through a mix of our own equity and traditional bankloans. The money we raise is a way to create working capital in advance so we can acquire supplies for the hotel exploitation.",3.0,0,"1 Campaign

• More convenient than a Fitbit, Apple Watch or other smartwatches and fitness trackers, EyeCo displays real-time color coded notifications in your peripheral vision.
Hands-free and fully customizable thanks to its IOS/Android companion app.
Clip EyeCo to your lens with its magnetic attachment and it will help you to race, train or navigate in the most extreme situations!

Featured in:

















1. Clip-in:
Clip the EyeCo device in your goggles or helmet visor.


2. Connect to your Smartphone:

- Track your activities with its companion app or download existing track/activities in our Community section (we already have thousands of trails worlwide).
- You can also sync activities from Strava or upload a .gpx file. We’ll keep adding new platforms.
- Program your alerts by associating a waypoint or any other data with a color and/or audio message.

3. Enjoy Eyeco:

Thanks to EyeCo, receive audio and visual real-time feedback in your peripheral vision:
split-time, navigation, coaching and more!
 







From personal experience and talking to other sports enthusiasts, we know that you don’t want distracting data for the sake of data. That’s why we decided to keep things simple and we limited the display to our single Smartpixel.
Human brain is conditioned to interpret color clues really efficiently.
Colors take considerably less ""brain-power” than text and shapes to be identified.
This allows us to display any range of information without taking your attention away from the track.
Like a quick whisper in the ear, you can continue to concentrate on your route but with just the minimal amount of additional information you need to be the fastest version of you.


We are an ambitious group of sports racing and technology enthusiasts based in San Diego, California. Our founder, Jerome, is a downhill mountain biking champion and a veteran software developer.
We combine our experience of action sports and video game design to create innovative products.

We know what it’s like to compete and always be looking for that edge. We have spent thousands of hours of work to bring this product to you.
Our goal is to make you faster and more competitive. Our biggest dream is to see winners in every sport making use of our technology and hard work.

This team brings together years of successful product development at companies such as Rockstar Games, Disney, Qualcomm and Airbus.



- Handlebar mount:
What if you could also clip EyeCo on your handlebar!!
(or anything else with a 28mm to 35mm circular section)

 

- WristBand:
Why should you only use EyeCo on goggles or helmets when you could also wear it on your wrist!
Now you have the most versatile sport tracker!

- High precision GPS built in the unit:
We’ll add a GPS to the unit so you’ll be able to use EyeCo to track your activities without your phone!

 

- More colors:
If we are able to manufacture enough units, we could offer more colors so EyeCo will perfectly match all your gears!

 

- IFTT integration:
Connect your EyeCo to your favorite online service thru the IFTT recipes! Your imagination is the only limit!


We have big plans for our company and are committed to bring the best wearable product.
We believe technology has potential to keep helping humans do what they love more efficiently and safely.

We have been able to bring to market many technological products with other companies.
This time we decided to bootstrap with our own funds this venture to carry our own vision. That’s why we need your help to be successful. Back us and be part of the Team Victorise
column2:
-)

While we are beyond grateful for your pledge, you can also help us to spread the word about EyeCo through your various social media platforms.

The power of social media is great and with greater exposure comes greater opportunities and possibilities for the EyeCo campaign.

Manufacturing a product will always have its share of challenges and there are often discoveries once stepping into the production phase.

The only phase we have not fully vetted is the silicone mold
column3:
so far we’ve only used in-house 3d printing. We are planning to use part of your funding to work with a reputable company in this field.

However, we’ve already produced multiple prototypes and pre-productions, and have secured relations with third parties. We have especially chosen to work as much as possible with local companies based in San Diego
column4:
it allows us to have a good quality control.

Q: Is the EyeCo light going to blind my eyes?

A: No, the EyeCo light is positioned in your peripheral vision and does not shine directly to your eye. Furthermore, EyeCo has a light sensor to adjust its brightness based on ambient conditions.

Q: When will EyeCo(s) ship?

A: After the campaign is complete,  your device is expected to ship within 15-20 weeks.

Q: Is EyeCo compatible with my equipment?

A: EyeCo is compatible with most googles. We tested it with 100%, Oakley, Smith, POC, Giro, Von Zipper and with many other helmet visors.
If your lens is too thick (double wall for snow goggles) or if your lens is curved too much, the magnet might not provide a strong attachment but our adhesive attachment can be used instead.

Q: Is EyeCo strongly secured to the lens?

A:EyeCo is really light so it will not be affected too much by vibrations. Even while jumping, dropping or bombing thru rock gardens, we never experienced the EyeCo falling! Thanks to its magnetic or adhesive attachment.

Q: Is EyeCo compatible with tear-off ?

A:If your tear-off covers the complete lens surface, you will not be able to use the magnetic attachment. However, you will be able to stick EyeCo (with the provided adhesive mount) inside the lens or visor.

Q: Can I use 2 EyeCos (one on each side)?

A:Yes, EyeCo can be installed on any side and it’s possible to rock one EyeCo on each side.

Q: How will domestic or international shipping costs be covered?

A:Shipping costs will be added during the pre-order transaction.

Q: Will EyeCo make me faster?

A:Yes, it will make you as fast as you could possibly be in your specific context
column5:
-)

Q: Wireless charging, what is it?

A:We used Qi Charging, it’s the same technology than the Iphone 8, IphoneX or Samsung phones. Just put EyeCo on the charging base and it will recharge. EyeCo is a low power device so it won’t take long to charge .

More questions? Please Ask Us at contact@geteyeco.com!


Interested in writing about the EyeCo by Victorise? You can find Hi-Res images, press release content, and much more in our PRESS KIT. And please feel free to email us at
column6:
body=I%20need%20more%20info!"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">contact@victorise.com if you need any assistance.


Indiegogo supporters will be rewarded first.
Product specifications may change during the crowdfunding process to ensure the product is made as best as possible. If any specifications are changed, we will notify everyone in the “Update” section of the crowdfunding page.
We will try our best to meet our targeted release timing. However, due to supply chain, quality control or other issues may arise which can cause delays to the delivery of the product. We hope to have your understanding in those circumstances.
Thank you!

The Shift Pack

The Shift Pack was designed with one goal in mind, to be an ultra-versatile backpack that can instantly ‘shift’ from a professional photography bag, to a travel bag, to an everyday tech bag. The Shift Pack offers the ultimate one bag experience.
column2:

 FOLLOW US
column3: >
column4: >
column5: >

column3:

Born On Kickstarter

This is not our first rodeo. Last year, we successfully launched an everyday bag called the 7ven Messenger right here on Kickstarter. We received amazing feedback from our backers and have improved every segment of the business to keep bringing you awesome, high-quality gear.

column12:

DJI Drone Storage

The padded bottom compartment was specifically made to hold the DJI Mavic Pro and Spark drone. Now you can take them anywhere you go.
column14:

More Camera Storage Options

If you are a casual photographer, the drone compartment is big enough for a full-size camera body and one camera lens. If you need to carry more camera gear upgrade to the full photography experience using our removable CAMERA KIT SYSTEM (available for order after the campaign).
column15: >

Tripod Mount

The Shift Pack was designed to provide versatility to the photographer. It features a removable magnetic tripod strap system for securing your tripod (available for order after the campaign).
column18:

Equipment Protection

The multi-purpose drone/camera compartment is FULLY PADDED for protection against accidental drops and bumps.

 

Not a Regular Camera Bag

When you are traveling with your expensive camera gear you want to be discrete about it. This is why Shift Pack wasn't designed to look like a regular camera bag.

Adaptable Storage Space

The Shift Pack uses a unique transformable storage space that can divide the backpack's main compartment into two sections when needed. Now you can store your clean clothes and dirty laundry separately.

column1: The optional tactical tech pouch is compatible with all ALPAKA products and it can be carried as a standalone EDC pouch.
Our German Magnetic Locking system is not only cool but also very efficient.
Shift Pack is engineered for high-quality. All the stitches, stress points, and tear points are reinforced.
3D padding ensures better airflow to reduce sweating.
Made to carry all your essentials (phone, camera, passport, wallet, keys, etc). It can easily fit your DJI Mavic or Spark drone in the main compartment.
This is why we created the Go Sling: a small sling bag that is designed to hold all your travel essentials in a light, sleek, and secure way.

When we designed the Go Sling, we imagined it as a travel sling bag that will go everywhere with you. With this in mind, we created the Go Sling to be modular with a removable and reversible strap (for both left and right-hand use), so that it will fit perfectly inside the Shift Pack. We also added a flexible and quick adjusting shoulder strap, which allows you to have several wearing styles for maximum comfort and security.

Born on Kickstarter. Our name was inspired by the South American animal alpaca. It roams in the toughest conditions in the Andes and represents the idea of perseverance and the 'keep moving forward' mentality.
Our vision is to solve problems by integrating a progressive style, ergonomic design and technical fabrics in the most sustainable way we can.
Every design we make comes from our idea of what beautiful aesthetic and great functionality should be.
Our products are hand-crafted and they are inspired by the multi-faceted lives of modern times. Minimal and made for urban life, but also durable and versatile for short nature trips.

column2: >To all my facebook family and friends,

column1: There are those in our world who live in shacks made of whatever materials they can find.  Drink water from contaminated streams.  Eat only one meal a day.  There are children whose only toy is a stick and a rocks.  Children who are on the brink of death due to severe malnutrition   Children who wear the same clothes day after day.  It is such a sad sight.  How could I be so blessed and yet others have so little. We may not have the answer
column3: There is nothing more rewarding than to help provide a a malnourished child with <span style=""line-height: 1.45em
column4: >medical care and nutrition, to see a child smile from ear to ear at the sight of a simple gift bag of toys, and to watch an elderly lady dance because of the new pair of shoes adorning her tired feet.  Let those who have, help those who have not.

column2: >God works through all of us to deliver His message of  hope and love to those in need. Rachel and I have been blessed to serve our Lord and Savior on four previous mission trips to Nicaragua. When we participated in our first trip in December 2009 we began a journey that has changed us. We learned that a successful life is not about the things we accumulate, it is about understanding our purpose here on earth and answering the call that God has planned for each of us. We feel a calling to reach out to those in need through mission trips.  Rachel and I are so excited to share this life changing experience with Ryan.  The three of us, along with seven of our fellow missionaries, will personally deliver gifts to the children, share Gods word, and lend a working hand to do whatever is asked of us by our missionary host.

>My dear friends and family, we are humbly asking for your financial donation to assist with the cost of the trip for Ryan, Rachel, and myself.  It will cost our family approximately $4,500 and with your help, and the donations we will be receiving from our church fundraisers, we trust that God will provide.  Any amount that we received above and beyond our trip expense will go towards the gift bags we pack for the children and supplies for the re-nutrition
column4: >This money will only be used for this cause. If you prefer, donations can be made to the missions fund by contacting the church directly at 941-922-4434. Learn more about my church by going online to

column1: Some might say, 'Why not just send the money to those in need instead of spending it on the expensive of each of us traveling?'   I also wondered the same and when I asked the question the heartwarming answer I received was this
column2: ""We are the messengers and when those in need see us go our of our way to travel to their home to help them, they feel and see God's love working through us.""

column1: We thank you in advance for your contribution and your prayers.

column4: ","To all my facebook family and friends,

column1: There are those in our world who live in shacks made of whatever materials they can find.  Drink water from contaminated streams.  Eat only one meal a day.  There are children whose only toy is a stick and a rocks.  Children who are on the brink of death due to severe malnutrition   Children who wear the same clothes day after day.  It is such a sad sight.  How could I be so blessed and yet others have so little. We may not have the answer
column3: There is nothing more rewarding than to help provide a a malnourished child with medical care and nutrition, to see a child smile from ear to ear at the sight of a simple gift bag of toys, and to watch an elderly lady dance because of the new pair of shoes adorning her tired feet.  Let those who have, help those who have not.

column1: God works through all of us to deliver His message of  hope and love to those in need. Rachel and I have been blessed to serve our Lord and Savior on four previous mission trips to Nicaragua. When we participated in our first trip in December 2009 we began a journey that has changed us. We learned that a successful life is not about the things we accumulate, it is about understanding our purpose here on earth and answering the call that God has planned for each of us. We feel a calling to reach out to those in need through mission trips.  Rachel and I are so excited to share this life changing experience with Ryan.  The three of us, along with seven of our fellow missionaries, will personally deliver gifts to the children, share Gods word, and lend a working hand to do whatever is asked of us by our missionary host.

My dear friends and family, we are humbly asking for your financial donation to assist with the cost of the trip for Ryan, Rachel, and myself.  It will cost our family approximately $4,500 and with your help, and the donations we will be receiving from our church fundraisers, we trust that God will provide.  Any amount that we received above and beyond our trip expense will go towards the gift bags we pack for the children and supplies for the re-nutrition center.  This money will only be used for this cause. If you prefer, donations can be made to the missions fund by contacting the church directly at 941-922-4434. Learn more about my church by going online to www.fccsarasota.com.

Some might say, 'Why not just send the money to those in need instead of spending it on the expensive of each of us traveling?'   I also wondered the same and when I asked the question the heartwarming answer I received was this
column2: ""We are the messengers and when those in need see us go our of our way to travel to their home to help them, they feel and see God's love working through us.""

column1: We thank you in advance for your contribution and your prayers.

>This past year we created and programmed our financial website designed to help anyone leverage off their homes, hobbies and skills to become financially independent - tiny or not. The site is free. We also built our Tiny House (the exterior) and started filming. Whew!

We'll be finished by late Spring and will hit the road. The tour will take about 4-5 months, depending on our filming schedule, weather etc.

column1: We've already started interviewing people running businesses from home - see the gallery tab at the top of this page for examples. These real life experiences and examples of how they set up home businesses, their challenges, costs and successes, will be added to our library on the site.
Throughout the tour, we'll be filming and adding more interviews with tiny and small homeowners running businesses, and highlighting economic and ecological issues.

Where and when we can deliver early - we absolutely will! When you purchase with PayPal, we can get you your perks faster, and we'll be updating you on delivery times and downloads. We are 1000% committed to delivering what we promise - besides, we're kind of ""do it now"" tenacious types! You will hear from us within 24-48 hours or sooner!

Tiny House or Small House living is not only financially and personally liberating - but it's smart, and a solution which could help thousands upon thousands of people to secure a brighter future. Self reliance, by running a small business from home is also a natural fit. We built Homazooma to help people achieve their financial goals - both as tiny or small house dwellers and as small home based business owners.

If you simply want to support the entrepreneurial spirit, or help those who feel helpless in their own destinies, then please contribute for that reason. If you want to be a part of the launch of something that will redefine how we think of our lifestyles in conjunction with our financial futures, please support us and share the vision, the fundraiser and the website.
As a society, we all benefit when we encourage and help each other pursue creative and industrious activity.

column4: > Pssst...! Other Things You Can Do to Help

column6: >If you can't contribute - that's okay. What you can do right now, that would be most helpful to both you and us is:

column1: Sign up as a member at Homazooma.com and start using the tools.

Most important... Please share the fundraiser and the site with your family and friends using the Indiegogo share tools above (so your personal # is attached). If you help us get 15 new members or 3 contributors - you'll get a Homazooma Tee - FREE!
• If you know anyone in the media, we need coverage, starting now. We have created an awesome product to help people understand their personal finance - and that's newsworthy!
• We need a PR company or a publicist who is willing to support us and be a part of the management of this process.

• Also, we need more corporate sponsors who are often looking to align themselves with some goodwill publicity. If you know anyone (in the PR or Marketing departments) at the following companies, please let them know about our mission, tour and fundraiser:
• We're looking to stop at Home Depot locations across the US and Canada.
• We still need a truck to pull this Tiny House, so if you know someone at Ford, GM or Dodge please let them know about us.
• We will be travelling with an entourage, so lodging will be a concern to us - we'll probably need a hotel chain like Holiday Inn or Hampton Inn (or comparable) to sponsor us.
• An electrical distributor/supplier like Westburne Rexel (or comparable)  for our electrical supplies.
• A tire supplier like Good Year, Michelin, Yokohama, Uniroyal (or comparable)  as we'll need several sets of tires and spares, for the long journey.

column1: And Thank You for reading this far. That's a task in itself!  We exist for you and because of you. We succeed when you succeed.

column3: >Please come out to meet us if we're anywhere near where you are. We'd love to meet you - seriously! You're AWESOME!

column2: Successful New Year! Thank you again,

column1: ","This is our house. We're taking it on tour.
The plans or even the originalCAD plans are great perks!

We created homazooma.com to foster home based businesses. The site is FREE for everyone. For our Tiny House community we created a Tiny House Tool to assess the costs and benefits of living Tiny vs Big. To help make sense of off grid costs and requirements, we even created an Electrical Use & Off Grid Tool.

This past year we created and programmed our financial website designed to help anyone leverage off their homes, hobbies and skills to become financially independent - tiny or not. The site is free. We also built our Tiny House (the exterior) and started filming. Whew! We'll be finished by late Spring and will hit the road. The tour will take about 4-5 months, depending on our filming schedule, weather etc.

We've already started interviewing people running businesses from home - see the gallery tab at the top of this page for examples. These real life experiences and examples of how they set up home businesses, their challenges, costs and successes, will be added to our library on the site.
Throughout the tour, we'll be filming and adding more interviews with tiny and small homeowners running businesses, and highlighting economic and ecological issues.

Where and when we can deliver early - we absolutely will! When you purchase with PayPal, we can get you your perks faster, and we'll be updating you on delivery times and downloads.  We are 1000% committed to delivering what we promise - besides, we're kind of ""do it now"" tenacious types! You will hear from us within 24-48 hours or sooner!

Tiny House or Small House living is not only financially and personally liberating - but it's smart, and a solution which could help thousands upon thousands of people to secure a brighter future. Self reliance, by running a small business from home is also a natural fit.  We built Homazooma to help people achieve their financial goals - both as tiny or small house dwellers and as small home based business owners.

If you simply want to support the entrepreneurial spirit, or help those who feel helpless in their own destinies, then please contribute for that reason. If you want to be a part of the launch of something that will redefine how we think of our lifestyles in conjunction with our financial futures, please support us and share the vision, the fundraiser and the website.
As a society, we all benefit when we encourage and help each other pursue creative and industrious activity.
Pssst...! Other Things You Can Do to Help
If you can't contribute - that's okay. What you can do right now, that would be most helpful to both you and us is:
Sign up as a member at Homazooma.com and start using the tools.

Most important... Please share the fundraiser and the site with your family and friends using the Indiegogo share tools above (so your personal # is attached).  If you help us get 15 new members or 3 contributors - you'll get a Homazooma Tee - FREE!
If you know anyone in the media, we need coverage, starting now. We have created an awesome product to help people understand their personal finance - and that's newsworthy!
We need a PR company or a publicist who is willing to support us and be a part of the management of this process.

Also, we need more corporate sponsors who are often looking to align themselves with some goodwill publicity. If you know anyone (in the PR or Marketing departments) at the following companies, please let them know about our mission, tour and fundraiser:
We're looking to stop at Home Depot locations across the US and Canada.
We still need a truck to pull this Tiny House, so if you know someone at Ford, GM or Dodge please let them know about us.
We will be travelling with an entourage, so lodging will be a concern to us - we'll probably need a hotel chain like Holiday Inn or Hampton Inn (or comparable) to sponsor us.
An electrical distributor/supplier like Westburne Rexel (or comparable)  for our electrical supplies.
A tire supplier like Good Year, Michelin, Yokohama, Uniroyal (or comparable)  as we'll need several sets of tires and spares, for the long journey.
Thank You and Bless You for all your efforts of any kind!
And Thank You for reading this far. That's a task in itself!  We exist for you and because of you. We succeed when you succeed.
Please come out to meet us if we're anywhere near where you are. We'd love to meet you - seriously! You're AWESOME!
Warmest Wishes for a Prosperous & Successful New Year! Thank you again,

We went to Montana and made a 2-hour DVD that is truly ALL you need to get started.  You could be holed up north of the Arctic Circle with a cup of hot chocolate and our film, and you'd soon have fish too!  We have hand-selected great gear packages as well to help you learn on equipment that's high in quality, yet won't fillet your wallet.  Get it now for  15% off!

Shawn and I have taught a lot of people to fly fish.  The most we've ever managed to teach at one time was about 10 junior high kids in a school fly fishing club Shawn started.  That's a pretty good number of people, but what if we had a comprehensive video to give them, something they could go back to when skills and memory need a refresh??
Our goal is to teach 10,000 people to fly fish, and we believe we have created one of, if not THE most complete, comprehensive fly fishing teaching video ever made.  Why are we motivated to do this?

column2:
What You Get

It's fairly simple.  We've spent all of our own disposable funds in recent months on the purchase of exceptional camera and sound gear.  We are film buffs, and one of us is a music teacher.  We want high quality production value.  We got the gear.  We shot the footage--excellent, scenic, teaching footage from all over Montana and Idaho.  We're pretty stoked about our video content.

What we lack is funding to complete the production--money to pay for our talented cameraman and video editors who will trick out the video and make it pop with graphics and fine tuning, funds for DVD cover art and to run off the first 250 DVDs, funds to build a proper website, and funds to possibly make a follow-up filming trip with our cameraman.

If put on a shoestring here, we think we can get the editing done for $2500 or so, DVDs printed for $500, and a website for $1000.  If we surpass our goal, we'll invest it developing distribution for the DVD, a follow up filming trip, and a short TV series for distribution with local cable television companies.

PERKS!

Bronze Gear Package--The optimal minimum required gear to make your fly fishing learning experience as successful as possible.  We are quite honest about our disdain for bargain basement gear, and our equal disdain for expensive luxury gear.  This package hits the sweet spot of good quality and adequate affordability. Includes:

column1:
Rod-4 piece, 5 weight beginner rod
Rod Case
Reel-Quality Basic Beginner Reel
Line-Beginner General Purpose Line (DT-5-F)
Fly Box-It Floats!
Flies-16 basic starter flies
Backing (For behind the fly line on the reel)
Floatant (To keep dry flies afloat)
Snips, Forceps, Retractor, Line Straightening Tool
2 Tapered Leaders-7.5 ft 3x Nylon Tapered Leader
Tippet-4x Nylon Tippet Spool
Tippet-5x Flourocarbon Hardy Tippet Spool

Silver Gear Package--Given a quality rod (our basic rod), the best gear upgrades to make early in your fly angling life are in the reel and line department.  Our silver package gets you to the next level with a hardier and more elegant reel, as well as a more durable and smooth running fly line.  It doesn’t hurt to treat yourself a little.

Rod-4 piece, 5 weight beginner rod
Rod Case
Reel-*Upgraded* Premium Quality Reel with interchangeable spool capability
Line-*Upgraded* Premium Quality Double Tapered Reversible 5 weight Floating Line (DT-5-F)
Fly Box
Flies-16 basic starter flies
Backing (For behind the fly line on the reel)
Floatant (To keep dry flies afloat)
Snips, Forceps, Retractor, Line Straightening Tool
2 Tapered Leaders-7.5 ft 3x Nylon Tapered Leaders
Tippet-4x Nylon Tippet Spool
Tippet-5x Flourocarbon Hardy Tippet Spool

Gold Gear Package
For starter gear, this is the best you can get.  Premium upgraded rod, reel, line, and flies.  Swap in your extra reel spool holding your new sinking line to head subsurface and go deep for the lunkers hiding in the depths.  This is our most versatile and complete package.  Beyond this you are paying for high end luxury gear and knick knacks that are not absolutely necessary for the beginner, in our straightforward opinion.

Rod-*Upgraded* Premium Quality Beginner Fishing Rod-4 piece, 5 weight
Rod Case
Reel-*Upgraded* Premium Quality Reel with interchangeable spool capability
Line-*Upgraded* Premium Quality Double Tapered Reversible 5 weight Floating Line (DT-5-F)
Fly Box
Flies-*Upgraded* to 16 premium quality, durable starter flies
2 spools of Backing (For behind the fly line on the reel)
Floatant (To keep dry flies afloat)
Snips, Forceps, Retractor, Line Straightening Tool
2 Tapered Leaders-7.5 ft 3x Nylon Tapered Leaders
Tippet-4x Nylon Tippet Spool
Tippet-5x Flourocarbon Hardy Tippet Spool

The Impact

If you want to learn to fly fish, or you think it would be fun for someone you know, our DVD and perks are a fantastic and fun way to get started--enjoyable (even goofy at times) instruction and we do the work of selecting and sending you the precise minimum of gear that you need.  No more, no less!  We are extremely serious about making fly fishing accessible to anyone and everyone, young or old, female or male.

Fly fishing is one of those things that spreads economy far and wide.  It benefits small towns all over the country and all over the world.  It’s also a small business for a lot of families and parents, be they guides, shop owners, rod builders, fly tiers, etc.  Your money, contributed here, is an economy builder, and certainly very valuable to our effort to build a small business for our families based on our creative instructional DVD.  We dream of publishing our knowledge and experience.

5%--As we’ve said elsewhere, we are in this for teaching and conservation, and the love of it, in addition to hoping it will be a small business for our families.  5% of our profit as a small business will be donated to conservation organizations like American Rivers and Trout Unlimited.  These organizations are dedicated to the promotion and protection of clean, free flowing rivers.  That’s good for fish, and for humans.

We will also be looking for opportunities to donate our instructional DVD to schools and kids fishing clubs, where kids who need an interest in the outdoors can see that fly fishing is for everyone.  We founded a fishing club at our local junior high, and we know that this is a sport that kids can love!

Other Ways You Can Help

We are hoping that even if you don’t join the cause, you know someone who wants to give a gift to their husband, wife, friend, or kid.  Please send along the campaign link, and know that we are recognizing your help in our consciousness each day.
And that’s all there is to it.

Your investment is propelling the final production of our DVD and helping us purchase our first batch for distribution!

My name is Michelle Papale. At age 15 I started to have a desire to help and take the time to know the overlooked and poor people of the earth. I didn't know how, where, or when I would do this, but as I was sure that God had planted the desire in me, I kept my heart and mind open to anything He brought my way. 

This past year (August 2011- Present) I have been working non stop and saving EVERY PENNY so that when God opened a door, I would have the finances to be able to walk through it. Finally in February, God gave me the opportunity to go to India for a 1 week missions trip. It was amazing! All of the money I had worked so hard to obtain went towards the trip but it was COMPLETELY worth it. But now I find myself with another opportunity to go to India! This time it is for two months, and I will be involved with MUCH more than on my first trip:
• Teaching English and Hygene in a slum's school
• Helping with the expansion into India of a teen to teen outreach program called BreakDown International
I need to raise $2,000 dollars by May 11.
• $300 to buy clothes and shoes to bring for children in need
• $200 as a donation to the people giving me free room and board and

None of this money will go towards spending money for any shopping or tourism I will do. I will pay for that myself. ANY and ALL extra money will be used to purchase clothing, shoes, or food for people in need.
I will not be able to pay for this trip without your help! Please consider making a donation to my cause no matter how small it  is!
If you aren't able to financially support me, or would like to help me in another way, please advertise my cause on Facebook, Twitter, or anywhere else you can think of. THANKS!!!","Short Summary

The White Cloud is the newest addition to the Tenkara Rod Co. lineup.  At 8 ft. long, it is our shortest Tenkara rod, but don't let its size fool you, this is an incredibly fun rod.  Built for those tight spaces and small waters or a great tool for teaching young people how to fish.

 

The White Cloud is great for teaching kids how to fish.  The smaller rod is manageable for kids, and by not having a reel, you don't have to worry about your kid learning line management, aka untangling line all day.  The action of the White Cloud helps kids to learn how to feel the loaded line so that they understand the mechanics of casting.  Tenkara is also very easy to learn so that kids can focus on fly presentation.  The quicker you get to focus on where to put the how to present it, the faster you will learn how to become a good fly fisher.

This is a really fun rod to pack with you on adventures.  Take it biking, running, hiking, camping, backpacking, climbing, etc.  Its easy to carry around and doesn't take up much space.  You will fish more often because of how easy and fast it is to go from collapsed to fishing.

 

Tenkara Rod Co. was born on crowdfunding over 5 years ago with our first project for the Teton and Sawtooth rods.  Since then, we have done multiple other crowdfunding projects and shipped tens of thousands of Tenkara rods all over the world.  We definitely love to fish, but we also really enjoy helping other people to get outside and enjoy nature through Tenkara fishing.

Thanks for photo and video contributions from: Tyler Coleman, Pitt Grewe, Tommy Tatham, Geoffroy Dubreuil, and Francois Marclay. 

 

This isn't our first campaign and hardly our first production run.  We have been working closely with our manufacturer for years and we are confident that we can deliver the White Cloud Rod on time and with the quality that has been expected of us so that you can get out and fish.

0,"
A first step in reaching our dream of building
the world's first, genuine, Jurassic style adventure park!

If you're interested in revolutionizing the theme park industry, creating cutting edge twenty-first century entertainment, providing meaningful, well paying employment for hundreds of people, educating young people in a physically challenging environment, enlightening the old and along the way helping to promote sustainable business practices, then read on!  If you want to actively participate in promoting all these things then lace up your hiking boots, you might just be going on a dinosaur expedition.  ALL THE ACTION WILL BE LIVE STREAMED TO THE INTERNET MAKING THIS THE WORLD'S FIRST LIVE INTERNET MOVIE! This project is one giant perk for as many supporters as we can accommodate. If you can't participate financially, but still want to help the project, use the Indiegogo share tools. Tell your friends, tell family, tell strangers its been 65 million years and the dinosaurs are back!

Greetings to dinosaur enthusiasts, theme park addicts and internet denizens. Robert Vowles here, pondering the element of coincidence in everyday life. I'm working on a revolutionary dinosaur theme park project and this crazy Irish guy with an eye patch comes to my office bloviating about cloned dinosaurs. Hey, a dinosaur theme park with real dinosaurs, that would be revolutionary.

The expeditions involve small groups of participants entering a dangerous dinosaur wilderness. Each group will be led by a Team Leader who is trained in wilderness survival and first aid. Each expedition team has an assignment involving dinosaur research. These assignments involve everything from photography and egg harvesting to the tranquilizing of dangerous predators for the acquisition of blood samples. At any time these plans are subject to immediate suspension should one of the other expedition teams have an emergency or some other disaster occurs. At this point your expedition immediately becomes a rescue team or a mobile forensic unit.
To get an idea of what the expedition would be like read the Dienonychous Adventure on the link below ""The Theme Park Revolution Article.""
REMEMBER ALL THE ACTION WILL BE LIVE STREAMED TO THE INTERNET!

For those seeking adventure with a smaller component of fear, expeditions will be arranged that only venture into areas inhabited by herbivores. You still need to be tough, but the possible horror element will be eliminated.

The dinosaur expeditions last approximately 12 hours. At the end of the 12 hours a dinosaur feast will be held at which time the bravery and resourcefulness of our intrepid explorers will be celebrated. Expedition members and staff will share stories, review video and discuss how the experience can be improved. At the close of festivities you are invited to camp in our safe area if you wish. You have until twelve noon the next day to  check out. Any visitors found on the property after this time will be taken to the Deinonychous area to participate in feeding time.

Expedition participants are responsible for their own travel expenses unless otherwise arranged. If someone merits inclusion we will provide extra help if we have the resources. Those going on 12 hour expeditions are responsible for their own camping equipment, keep it light and lean.  We provide the food, you are responsible  for making us aware of any allergies. We will make every reasonable effort to modify expeditions to accommodate our supporters, but at the end of the day I have to say the 12 hour expeditions are rough.
• If you can't run up two flights of stairs without panting.
• If you have a history of heart disease or any other ailment that makes extreme physical exertion or intense psychological stress likely to result in life threatening symptoms.
• If you close your eyes at the scary parts in horror movies.
• If exposure to dirt gives you an overwhelming desire to shower and change your clothes.
• If a mosquito bite sees you running for the first aid kit.
• If your favourite possession is your mattress.
• If you feel like the conveniences and creature comforts of the modern world are a natural part of your life support system.

If any of the above are true of you (especially the first 2), then our dinosaur expeditions are to be avoided! If you're just a little out of shape and you still want to go, then use that desire as motivation to diet and exercise. Reach for your potential and you could find yourself on a 12 hour dinosaur expedition
column2: probably a good idea to try camping, if you've never set foot outside a city. As Andy likes to say, ""You've got to be tough!"" How will you know if you're tough if you've never been tested?

column1: All perks related to expedition participation are subject to the success or failure of our fund raising campaign. If we don't come close to our funding targets we will be forced to modify the quality and quantity of expeditions. Whatever happens our philosophy is to be creative in adversity and so we will make the best of whatever situation we find ourselves in. Expeditions are slated to occur in the summer of 2014.

If we get support far above the requested amount we will consider organizing elite expeditions utilizing experienced participants who we know can handle the profound physical and mental challenges. These expeditions would last at least 24 hours.

If you do not like the requirements and demands of the Dinosaur Expedition option you can chose the Dinosaur Adventure, just ""Vote for the Therizinosaurus"".  With this perk you and five other people are entitled to a two hour adventure, summer 2014 and one Dinosaur Expedition Field Bag. You will be contacted to arrange a time and date for your adventure. Remember if we don't come close to our fund raising goal the duration and quality  of the adventure component of your perk will be adversely affected. You don't want to go on a dinosaur expedition and not see any dinosaurs!
TELL EVERYONE YOU KNOW ABOUT THE DINOSAUR EXPEDITION. THE MORE FUNDING WE GET, THE BETTER THE EXPERIENCE!
All those supporters selected to go on an Expedition can opt for the two hour adventure. Please give us atleast 48 hours notice of any changes.
For those interested only in the dinosaur expeditions skip to: The Perks and everything after that.

I have a curriculum vitae the Coen brothers could turn into a screen play. I've done every kind of theater from Murder Mysteries and Improv to absurdist Ionesco.  As a special effects model maker I've worked on everything from TV shows to ad campaigns. I've earned a contractors top rate and as a blue collar labourer I've made minimum wage. You could say I have a well rounded perspective on the working world.

In the early nineties I got heavily involved in theme park design and promotion. This culminated in my leading a team of twenty-eight top creative and professional people as project manager for the Labyrinth project. This concept called for the creation of a vast complex of historical venues featuring interactive live theater seamlessly integrated with completely themed simulator rides. No theater seating! The action would have propelled people on to all manner of conveyances from horse drawn wagons and old sailing vessels  to space ships. In fact the experience would have been so realisitc that people would not have realized they were on simulator rides. The 250 million dollar Labyrinth was never built, but I learned many valuable lessons and I have applied them in developing my latest project.

The purpose of this Indiegogo Campaign is to introduce a revolutionary, twenty-first century theme park project. It is revolutionary because it is everything that twentieth century theme parks are not.

It can be built for less than ten percent the cost of a traditional park, it is environmentally sensitive, there are no lineups, no price gouging and it recognizes that people are not the same as they were in 1955
column2: nor is the social fabric or the technological infrastructure. The rigid architecture and operating structures of the traditional theme park mitigate against a full realization of the potential of the internet. Look at a contemporary theme park and it's like the internet was never even invented.

column1: In our proposed park the visitor's experience will be so personalized and so compelling that their adventure acquires significant entertainment value and can be live streamed to the internet on a pay for view basis. But people half way around the world won't just be watching, they'll be participating. Welcome to the world's first wired theme park. Share with your friends, family and the whole world.
Honestly who would pay to see someone on a roller coaster or dark ride? But they would pay to see a real time adventure as exciting as any movie. Welcome to the age of live movies.

Our ultimate goal is to break the monopoly the big entertainment companies hold over the multi-billion dollar theme park industry by building an attraction for less than fifty million dollars. Our philosophy is to stress programming and special effects and minimize the amount spent on costly infrastructure so damaging to the environment and investor's nerves. This project marks the evolution of the theme park from an obsession with physical architecture to a story architecture bolstered by an evocative wilderness and astounding special effects.
For those interested only in the dinosaur expeditions and adventures skip to: The Perks and everything after that.

Since the early days of the theme park industry it has been a cardinal rule that attractions should be built to accomodate peak day attendance. With their fantastic architecture and sophisticated ride infrastructure this is a costly precept. But it has generated enormous profits for large entertainment companies and made theme parks an enduring part of modern culture.

In the last twenty years increasing costs and economic instability have thrown the viability of theme parks into question. Disney's California Adventure, Bonfante Gardens and the ill fated Hard Rock Park are glaring examples of the perils of contemporary theme park development. Only companies like Disney have the resources to spend a billion dollars in one year on damage control.
Rather than build an attraction where the visitor experience is oriented around costly architecture and ride technology
column2: capital assets that must be built to accommodate massive numbers that are only present 20 to 30 percent of the time. We propose a park where the experience is oriented around out door adventure. This requires a minimum of expense. In fact we propose to create both the biggest theme park in the world and the least expensive. We can absorb huge numbers, but when our park is only a quarter full we are not bleeding money because a billion dollars in capital assets is under utilized.

column1: In our park there are no fairy tale castles or towers of terror. There is only powerful immersive experience and the truly unexpected. Venture back into time 65 million years when predators had 8 inch fangs and browsing herbivores weighed as much as a herd of elephants. Excitement comes from interacting in a myriad of ways with these strange denizens of the park
column2: dinosaurs. Weird, wonderful, dangerous and always on the move!

column1: (To see how Theme Adventures uses theme park industry equations to evaluate the viability of a dinosaur park in the Chattanooga, Tennessee market place, hit the Gallery tab at the top of the page and go to Files. The ""Adding Up the Numbers"" document comprises one section of the Theme Adventures, Labyrintyme Dinosaur Park business plan).

While balancing the heavy demands of personal and professional responsibilities I have devoted a tremendous amount of time over the last twenty years to developing a new kind of theme park. I reject the traditional  theme park model with its cacophony of themes and frenzied, effects driven rides. In contrast I propose an attraction with one comprehensive theme. Visitors are invited to immerse themselves in this alternate reality for extended periods of time. They not only participate, they help shape the course of events. In this attraction special effects are in the service of story elements, not the other way around.
The Labyrinth was one incarnation of this new kind of theme park on the road I took to the Dinosaur Park concept
column2: an attraction that saves money and drastically decreases damage to the natural environment by having a minimal infrastructure. Traditional theme parks literally gut the natural world as they create hugely expensive artificial paradises. The possibility of building a theme park is no longer the monopoly of an exclusive club when hundreds of millions of dollars of infrastructure are no longer required.

column1: An ecologically friendly business model that can be adapted to the unique requirements of developing countries could open the door to large scale ecotourism. By increasing the perceived value of disappearing natural systems we recalibrate the calculations of cash strapped local governments in favour of ecologically sustainable development strategies. Such approaches could also help lift underemployed populations out of recurring cycles of poverty and overpopulation.

The elements of sharing, proactive behaviour and empowerment are part of people's everyday lives as they play their computer games, share music with friends and decide moment to moment what they will watch, listen to and participate in. I propose to weave these elements into the dinosaur theme park. What better way to begin than with a series of expeditions into a wilderness inhabited by these most fascinating and dangerous of creatures.  The plans for the eventual park are on the drawing board, thousands of hours have yet to be committed and yet people will be experiencing the sharp edge of what the park will someday offer. This is product development with the customer at the heart of the creative process. With live streaming to thousands of potential customers watching and sharing their brutally honest evaluations, we truly open up the creative process. With engagement on many levels we achieve a quality of participation that excites public interest and informs our creative process.

In many ways this project is inspired by the empowerment brought about by the internet age. It is also inspired by a less positive manifestation of the new web world. A significant number of people have become so consumed with their electronic gadgets they are increasingly alienated from their own physicality and their place in the natural world. We hope that our project can play a small part in helping to reverse this trend.

I am a science fiction enthusiast, I don't know how many times I've watched the Alien movies. You could call me a history buff. I read every book in Colleen McCullough's Masters of Rome series and hungered for more. Why develop another dinosaur attraction when this theme has been done to death? As well there are  many exciting themes that have not been exploited, why not do one of these?

First of all, other themes I'd like to explore require too much infrastructure. The cost is prohibitive. The dinosaur theme requires minimal infrastructure and results in less environmental impact. The second reason I chose the dinosaur theme arises from the glaring fact that no dinosaur attraction, no dinosaur event, no dinosaur movie correctly portrays the scientifically established behaviours and capabilities of the clade dinosauria. Certainly it is true that my attraction can't possibly recreate their lost world even if I have live dinosaurs. Be that as it may, the attraction I propose by having dinosaurs outside in a wilderness location, moving rapidly and behaving naturally, will come closer to capturing the essence of dinosaurs than any previous portrayal.

You can have the most sophisticated animatronic T Rex in the world, but if it's shuffling about letting 10 year olds stroke it's snout, then it is really nothing more than a scary looking puppet. In our attraction no one will be allowed anywhere near the T Rex. In our attraction if you find yourself in the presence of the T Rex you will understand primal fear.
The T Rex (Regina) and the Expedition for Knowledge.
(By all estimates the female T Rex was larger than the male, hence Tyrannosaurus Regina).

We hope to have many different types of dinosaurs for expedition participants to study and observe. In fact by your level of support you will help to determine what kind of dinosaurs will inhabit the dinosaur wilderness.  It is my advice to anyone hoping to join an expedition that they avoid providing any support for a T Rex cloning program. An examination of the historic T Rex will validate my advice and also underline my declaration concerning the inaccuracies of past T Rex portrayals and by extension the numerous flawed depictions of dinosaurs prevalent in popular culture.

Through fossil forensics we have discovered healed wounds on large herbivores that could only have come from a T Rex. In this case tooth size and shape are the smoking gun. This evidence would seem to close the debate over whether the Rex was a carnivore or merely an opportunistic scavenger. All physiological evidence seems to point to an extremely active and hungry carnivore. This behaviour in a creature weighing upwards of 8 tons would definitely pose a danger to humans. How much danger?

To appreciate the horrible death potential posed by a full grown  or even a half grown Tyrannosaur we need to examine its capabilities. For our purposes it is instructive to contrast the scientifically established capability with a portrayal in popular culture. I'm sure everyone remembers the scene in the first Jurassic Park movie when Dr. Grant was standing beside the overturned jeep with Hammond's granddaughter. There in front of them stands a hungry T Rex. Apparently the lawyer was merely an appetizer.

The good doctor advises the girl that the Tyrannosaurus can't see them if they don't move. Of course he means voluntary movements, but of course there are many involuntary movements and I'm afraid the T Rex was equipped to see all of them. This terrifying animal had depth perception superior  to other carnivorous dinosaurs. With its perfect binocular vision it had a canny ability to judge distances, a useful capability for an apex hunter. The eyes themselves were incomparable. Imagine a hawk with binoculars and you get some appreciation for  the Rex's visual acuity. So I'm afraid Dr. Grant the Tyrannosaur can see your chest move as you breath, every twitch of your face, every micro movement of your eyes. He sees about as well as it is possible to see.

The olfactory capability was every bit as formidable. Imagine an 8 ton blood hound, but keep in mind the nostril separation in this hound from hell allowed for 3D olfactory perception. He could smell a triceratops fart from a mile away and move towards its author with the accuracy of a guided missile. This sensory arsenal was completed by a sense of hearing of incomparable acuity. In a scientifically accurate Jurassic Park the T Rex could hear the breathing, the heart beat and the gas bubbles percolating in the churning guts of the three terrified humans by the overturned jeep. So if we neutralize for a moment Spielberg's genius for drama and rely on cold hard science there is no dramatic moment by the jeep. Nature's ultimate predator eats the goat, the lawyer, Doc Grant and the two kids in seconds. But is he fast enough to catch the jeep? The latest research seems to indicate that we have underestimated the tail muscle mass the T Rex used to maximize speed by as much as 45%. So before the jeep even gets up to speed its 3 occupants are already dead.

If Dinosaur Expedition supporters indeed successfully vote for a T Rex a series of protocols will be established invoking distance requirements, the  use of visual, auditory and olfactory decoys and the utilization of a number of repellent technologies. If the Rex demonstrates predatory behaviours towards expedition participants we will get to the nearest ATV trail and rendezvous with our ATV mobile security detail for extraction. Under no circumstances will firearms be utilized. The potential for making a tragic situation catastrophic is too great. Andy's AK47 is permanently retired.

Thinking a dinosaur's appearance tells the whole story makes about as much sense as saying a man's shadow explains his essence. For too long the entertainment business has been satisfied with shallow depictions and the complex reality of these creatures has been ignored. They knew the T Rex was a monster, but even the paleontologists weren't sure how dangerous was the beast. With the latest research it's hard to imagine it could be any more lethal. The more we find out about both carnivorous and herbivorous dinosaurs the more we develop respect for these awesome creatures.
Instructed by the facts and emboldened by the capabilities science gives us, we will attempt to do justice to the T Rex and creatures like it. The educational possibilities are electrifying!
This links to a video on T Rex.    http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4URe7c7Gq30
Accurate T Rex Illustration by Scott Hartman

Your support will give us the financial muscle we need to make the expeditions and adventures possible. But your personal commitment to the project is what brings it to life. It is through the Indiegogo perks that together we mediate how you as a supporter will engage with the project. If you desperately want to go on an expedition your chances improve as your level of support increases. If you just can't afford to give much support, but still want to improve your chances you can seek an endorsement from a higher level supporter. If this higher level supporter is selected for an expedition their endorsement can greatly improve your chances. (Higher level supporters are allowed to give one endorsement).

If you wish to support the project with a generous contribution, but have no desire to wade through mosquito infested swamps looking for predators the size of school buses, then we'll reward your generosity with a fine prehistoric themed gift. If you're too old or out of shape to go on expeditions yet long for adventure, we will provide a modified experience of shorter duration.

The Indiegogo perks empower our supporters in other ways. Each level of support is a vote for a particular type of dinosaur. The greater the support at a particular level, the better the chance the dinosaur associated with that level will be cloned, (if second generation hatched or if already in existence, selected for survival in our park). The votes of higher levels are worth more than lower level votes. Higher levels of support are also associated with all types of significant participation in the project, not necessarily involving exposure to the dinosaur wilderness. This could involve designing a shirt for our online store. If the shirt design is selected it will be featured, we will provide links to your online dinosaur themed store and other exciting perks. Another perk offers the supporter the opportunity to create video content for our online channel. Selection criteria would include things like the educational content, entertainment value and quality.

At the higher levels, expedition participation is guaranteed and the potential for significant involvement with the dinosaur theme park is offered. In all cases more support means better perks, but merit is also an important factor. Chose a perk that allows you to highlight your best qualities and you may find yourself an important part of the project. Don't delude yourself. Do not involve yourself at a level of support involving participation and assume you will be successful if you have no experience in the skill associated with that type of participation.

Certain key members of the project team are in place, but the funding we receive will determine the ultimate size and character of the group. The skills involved in designing and implementing important parts of the project are highly specialized and require appropriate remuneration.

We are very lucky indeed to have Walter Klassen join the team as technical advisor. He is a legend in the movie business and his encyclopedic technical knowledge will bolster the entire dinosaur expedition project. (To see a recent newspaper article on Walter hit the link on my 21st. June, 2013 favourite tweet). https://twitter.com/RobertVowles

This project is temporarily dominated by old guys and Juliana Vowles provides the priceless perspective of a young professional. She has work experience in the public and private sector and her perceptive mind and limitless creativity is an invaluable asset.

A number one priority for the project team is to make the expeditions as safe as possible. Alex Smith in his role as Program Coordinator for Recreation and Leisure at Fleming College in Peterborough, Ontario is in an ideal position to provide us with qualified expedition team leaders.

It is my intention to employ a substantial number of students in parts of the project where I believe their contribution will be invaluable.. I have been in touch with the wireless technology department at Fleming and they are interested in making involvement with the project both a school assignment and a source of summer employment for students.
As project manager it is my job to mediate between three fundamental objectives.
1. The creation of mind blowing experiences.
3. The ultimate goal of creating the worlds first, truly 21st century

It is essential that I put together a team that can help me reach all these goals. It is my belief that this project will generate opportunities that will make project goals not only achievable and mutually supportive, but also a means to undreamed of potential.
There are rules that must be followed, failure to follow rules may result in the immediate termination of the expedition. Here's a sample of some of our rules.
• You must be 18 years or older at the time your expedition is to occur.
• No firearms or weapons of any kind on the expeditions, you do not want your adventure to end in a long stay in a Canadian penal institution.
• No alcohol or illicit drugs are permitted.
• No racist, sexist, inflammatory comments or abusive behaviour is allowed.
• No reckless behaviour likely to result in injury to yourself or others.

column2: the threat of forest fire and the health concerns of others make this rule non-negotiable.

column1: • No persons with a history of serious mental instability or violent criminal behavior.
• It is imperative that you obey the orders of your Team Leader at all times.

If you don't like rules and resent being told what to do that's fine, stay home we don't want you on the expeditions! DO NOT misrepresent your physical or mental condition when being interviewed. All those selected for expeditions will undergo VIGOROUS TESTS prior to transportation to the Dinosaur Wilderness. You will only be inconveniencing other people and jeopardizing your own participation at a level that is safe for you by being loose with the truth.

All businesses especially themed attractions go to great pains to insure their facilities are safe. Artificial worlds are constructed specifically for we fragile humans and still accidents happen. It seems everyone has a  lawyer ready to seek their version of justice. If you wish to go on our expeditions have no illusions, there is danger and you will be signing away your legal redress
column2: wild animals are dangerous, insects and snakes are poisonous, water can drown you and tree roots can trip you. In addition I brew my coffee boiling hot, if you spill it on yourself don't call your lawyer.

column1: Our eventual attraction will have adventures for visitors with safety concerns. But at this stage we can only offer expedition participants blood, toil, tears and sweat with the chance of incredible thrills. If you have concerns you should seriously consider staying home. All expedition participants will be required to sign our comprehensive liability waver without exception.

I have endeavoured to create a flexible cost structure that allows me to adapt to the input that I get from my supporters and satisfy my own requirements. My primary goal and the goal that sustains all others is the goal of demonstrating that dynamic immersive entertainment of extended duration has huge potential. This goal is balanced by the need to move as many supporters as possible safely through the expedition process. With so many unknowable elements it will be fascinating to see how the project eventually manifests itself.
Depending on the choices of our supporters the
dinosaur population will incline towards many smaller
dinosaurs on the one hand or a few large dinosaurs                      $205,000
at the other extreme. The more meat eaters selected
the more dangerous the expeditions. Remember if no
herbivores are selected the only readily available  food
For the kind of quality experience we are proposing you
need trained, high quality staff. One of our goals is to
provide people with decent well paying jobs. The fact this               $86,400
goal rebounds to the benefit of our supporters is a double
A full range of vehicles from trucks to ATVs will be required
for the movement of staff, equipment, expedition participants         $45,000
