When presenting a business plan to investors it is customary for entrepreneurs to detail the weaknesses in their plans. I believe this courtesy is also appropriate when seeking funds from the Indiegogo community. You value your money and you deserve the straight goods.

The idea of giving the public immersive, participatory adventures of extended duration has great appeal. If it wasn't so fraught with difficulties the theme park industry would have done it long ago. Our intention of live streaming the action adds an additional element of peril to the endeavour.

Unfortunately it is the case that some people when given the opportunity to participate  see this as a license to behave in a boorish and infantile manner, amusing themselves at the expense of everyone else. On a number of visits to theme parks I observed such behaviour on rides where limited participation was offered in the pre-shows. In my time as a carnival showman I experimented with crowd participation and developed a number of effective tactics for insuring the entertainment went in a positive direction. Of course I didn't have to deal with live dinosaurs.

In the context of the overall project there is a vast, untested strategic vision that must be implemented. Challenges involving staffing, equipment selection and expedition management are all very daunting. Situating the project in a wilderness location poses risks to supporters and staff. Although every reasonable precaution will be taken, anything can happen. The logistics of getting injured or ill participants to a hospital are complex. In regards to wild non-dinosaur animals I have been venturing into wilderness areas all my life in groups and also alone.  I find even the larger animals want nothing more than to avoid humans at all costs. If you extend them the same courtesy there shouldn't be a problem.

Perhaps the biggest failing of this project is the potentially large number of small supporters who want to go on expeditions and aren't selected because of inadequate capacity. There is a simple mathematical reality at work here. The cost for one person to go on an expedition is well over a thousand dollars if we take into account total project cost. My good intentions can't change this fact. It takes a large number of small supporters to pay for one expedition participant. It is my hope that premium perks attract enough big supporters to underwrite the involvement of lesser supporters. If you're a small supporter you can have a huge impact on the project if you tell the right person that the DINOSAURS ARE BACK  and there's an  EXPEDITION !

If we reach our funding goal and our fixed capital costs have been met a higher a percentage of any additional funds can go towards operating costs. That means more financial resources can be directed towards insuring a higher percentage of lower level supporters can go on additional expeditions. Unfortunately management and safety issues preclude us stuffing existing expeditions with more people.

Robert Vowles and Theme Adventures makes no guarantees as to the reality of dinosaur cloning or the creation of living dinosaurs. All references to cloned dinosaurs are based on unsubstantiated claims by dubious characters and evidence that has not been scientifically evaluated. Robert Vowles and Theme Adventures can only assure expedition participants that every effort will be made to provide them with a genuinely prehistoric experience.
A first step in reaching our dream of building
the world's first, genuine, Jurassic style adventure park!

If you're interested in revolutionizing the theme park industry, creating cutting edge twenty-first century entertainment, providing meaningful, well paying employment for hundreds of people, educating young people in a physically challenging environment, enlightening the old and along the way helping to promote sustainable business practices, then read on!  If you want to actively participate in promoting all these things then lace up your hiking boots, you might just be going on a dinosaur expedition.  ALL THE ACTION WILL BE LIVE STREAMED TO THE INTERNET MAKING THIS THE WORLD'S FIRST LIVE INTERNET MOVIE! This project is one giant perk for as many supporters as we can accommodate. If you can't participate financially, but still want to help the project, use the Indiegogo share tools. Tell your friends, tell family, tell strangers its been 65 million years and the dinosaurs are back!

Greetings to dinosaur enthusiasts, theme park addicts and internet denizens. Robert Vowles here, pondering the element of coincidence in everyday life. I'm working on a revolutionary dinosaur theme park project and this crazy Irish guy with an eye patch comes to my office bloviating about cloned dinosaurs. Hey, a dinosaur theme park with real dinosaurs, that would be revolutionary.

The expeditions involve small groups of participants entering a dangerous dinosaur wilderness. Each group will be led by a Team Leader who is trained in wilderness survival and first aid. Each expedition team has an assignment involving dinosaur research. These assignments involve everything from photography and egg harvesting to the tranquilizing of dangerous predators for the acquisition of blood samples. At any time these plans are subject to immediate suspension should one of the other expedition teams have an emergency or some other disaster occurs. At this point your expedition immediately becomes a rescue team or a mobile forensic unit.
To get an idea of what the expedition would be like read the Dienonychous Adventure on the link below ""The Theme Park Revolution Article.""
REMEMBER ALL THE ACTION WILL BE LIVE STREAMED TO THE INTERNET!

For those seeking adventure with a smaller component of fear, expeditions will be arranged that only venture into areas inhabited by herbivores. You still need to be tough, but the possible horror element will be eliminated.

The dinosaur expeditions last approximately 12 hours. At the end of the 12 hours a dinosaur feast will be held at which time the bravery and resourcefulness of our intrepid explorers will be celebrated. Expedition members and staff will share stories, review video and discuss how the experience can be improved. At the close of festivities you are invited to camp in our safe area if you wish. You have until twelve noon the next day to  check out. Any visitors found on the property after this time will be taken to the Deinonychous area to participate in feeding time.

Expedition participants are responsible for their own travel expenses unless otherwise arranged. If someone merits inclusion we will provide extra help if we have the resources. Those going on 12 hour expeditions are responsible for their own camping equipment, keep it light and lean.  We provide the food, you are responsible  for making us aware of any allergies. We will make every reasonable effort to modify expeditions to accommodate our supporters, but at the end of the day I have to say the 12 hour expeditions are rough.
If you can't run up two flights of stairs without panting.
If you have a history of heart disease or any other ailment that makes extreme physical exertion or intense psychological stress likely to result in life threatening symptoms.
If you close your eyes at the scary parts in horror movies.
If exposure to dirt gives you an overwhelming desire to shower and change your clothes.
If a mosquito bite sees you running for the first aid kit.
If your favourite possession is your mattress.
If you feel like the conveniences and creature comforts of the modern world are a natural part of your life support system.

If any of the above are true of you (especially the first 2), then our dinosaur expeditions are to be avoided! If you're just a little out of shape and you still want to go, then use that desire as motivation to diet and exercise. Reach for your potential and you could find yourself on a 12 hour dinosaur expedition
column2: probably a good idea to try camping, if you've never set foot outside a city. As Andy likes to say, ""You've got to be tough!"" How will you know if you're tough if you've never been tested?

column1: All perks related to expedition participation are subject to the success or failure of our fund raising campaign. If we don't come close to our funding targets we will be forced to modify the quality and quantity of expeditions. Whatever happens our philosophy is to be creative in adversity and so we will make the best of whatever situation we find ourselves in. Expeditions are slated to occur in the summer of 2014.

If we get support far above the requested amount we will consider organizing elite expeditions utilizing experienced participants who we know can handle the profound physical and mental challenges. These expeditions would last at least 24 hours.

If you do not like the requirements and demands of the Dinosaur Expedition option you can chose the Dinosaur Adventure, just ""Vote for the Therizinosaurus"".  With this perk you and five other people are entitled to a two hour adventure, summer 2014 and one Dinosaur Expedition Field Bag. You will be contacted to arrange a time and date for your adventure. Remember if we don't come close to our fund raising goal the duration and quality  of the adventure component of your perk will be adversely affected. You don't want to go on a dinosaur expedition and not see any dinosaurs!
TELL EVERYONE YOU KNOW ABOUT THE DINOSAUR EXPEDITION. THE MORE FUNDING WE GET, THE BETTER THE EXPERIENCE!
All those supporters selected to go on an Expedition can opt for the two hour adventure. Please give us atleast 48 hours notice of any changes.
For those interested only in the dinosaur expeditions skip to: The Perks and everything after that.

I have a curriculum vitae the Coen brothers could turn into a screen play. I've done every kind of theater from Murder Mysteries and Improv to absurdist Ionesco.  As a special effects model maker I've worked on everything from TV shows to ad campaigns. I've earned a contractors top rate and as a blue collar labourer I've made minimum wage. You could say I have a well rounded perspective on the working world.

In the early nineties I got heavily involved in theme park design and promotion. This culminated in my leading a team of twenty-eight top creative and professional people as project manager for the Labyrinth project. This concept called for the creation of a vast complex of historical venues featuring interactive live theater seamlessly integrated with completely themed simulator rides. No theater seating! The action would have propelled people on to all manner of conveyances from horse drawn wagons and old sailing vessels  to space ships. In fact the experience would have been so realisitc that people would not have realized they were on simulator rides. The 250 million dollar Labyrinth was never built, but I learned many valuable lessons and I have applied them in developing my latest project.

The purpose of this Indiegogo Campaign is to introduce a revolutionary, twenty-first century theme park project. It is revolutionary because it is everything that twentieth century theme parks are not.

It can be built for less than ten percent the cost of a traditional park, it is environmentally sensitive, there are no lineups, no price gouging and it recognizes that people are not the same as they were in 1955
column2: nor is the social fabric or the technological infrastructure. The rigid architecture and operating structures of the traditional theme park mitigate against a full realization of the potential of the internet. Look at a contemporary theme park and it's like the internet was never even invented.

column1: In our proposed park the visitor's experience will be so personalized and so compelling that their adventure acquires significant entertainment value and can be live streamed to the internet on a pay for view basis. But people half way around the world won't just be watching, they'll be participating. Welcome to the world's first wired theme park. Share with your friends, family and the whole world.
Honestly who would pay to see someone on a roller coaster or dark ride? But they would pay to see a real time adventure as exciting as any movie. Welcome to the age of live movies.

Our ultimate goal is to break the monopoly the big entertainment companies hold over the multi-billion dollar theme park industry by building an attraction for less than fifty million dollars. Our philosophy is to stress programming and special effects and minimize the amount spent on costly infrastructure so damaging to the environment and investor's nerves. This project marks the evolution of the theme park from an obsession with physical architecture to a story architecture bolstered by an evocative wilderness and astounding special effects.
For those interested only in the dinosaur expeditions and adventures skip to: The Perks and everything after that.

Since the early days of the theme park industry it has been a cardinal rule that attractions should be built to accomodate peak day attendance. With their fantastic architecture and sophisticated ride infrastructure this is a costly precept. But it has generated enormous profits for large entertainment companies and made theme parks an enduring part of modern culture.

In the last twenty years increasing costs and economic instability have thrown the viability of theme parks into question. Disney's California Adventure, Bonfante Gardens and the ill fated Hard Rock Park are glaring examples of the perils of contemporary theme park development. Only companies like Disney have the resources to spend a billion dollars in one year on damage control.
Rather than build an attraction where the visitor experience is oriented around costly architecture and ride technology
column2: capital assets that must be built to accommodate massive numbers that are only present 20 to 30 percent of the time. We propose a park where the experience is oriented around out door adventure. This requires a minimum of expense. In fact we propose to create both the biggest theme park in the world and the least expensive. We can absorb huge numbers, but when our park is only a quarter full we are not bleeding money because a billion dollars in capital assets is under utilized.

column1: In our park there are no fairy tale castles or towers of terror. There is only powerful immersive experience and the truly unexpected. Venture back into time 65 million years when predators had 8 inch fangs and browsing herbivores weighed as much as a herd of elephants. Excitement comes from interacting in a myriad of ways with these strange denizens of the park
column2: dinosaurs. Weird, wonderful, dangerous and always on the move!

column1: (To see how Theme Adventures uses theme park industry equations to evaluate the viability of a dinosaur park in the Chattanooga, Tennessee market place, hit the Gallery tab at the top of the page and go to Files. The ""Adding Up the Numbers"" document comprises one section of the Theme Adventures, Labyrintyme Dinosaur Park business plan).

While balancing the heavy demands of personal and professional responsibilities I have devoted a tremendous amount of time over the last twenty years to developing a new kind of theme park. I reject the traditional  theme park model with its cacophony of themes and frenzied, effects driven rides. In contrast I propose an attraction with one comprehensive theme. Visitors are invited to immerse themselves in this alternate reality for extended periods of time. They not only participate, they help shape the course of events. In this attraction special effects are in the service of story elements, not the other way around.
The Labyrinth was one incarnation of this new kind of theme park on the road I took to the Dinosaur Park concept
column2: an attraction that saves money and drastically decreases damage to the natural environment by having a minimal infrastructure. Traditional theme parks literally gut the natural world as they create hugely expensive artificial paradises. The possibility of building a theme park is no longer the monopoly of an exclusive club when hundreds of millions of dollars of infrastructure are no longer required.

column1: An ecologically friendly business model that can be adapted to the unique requirements of developing countries could open the door to large scale ecotourism. By increasing the perceived value of disappearing natural systems we recalibrate the calculations of cash strapped local governments in favour of ecologically sustainable development strategies. Such approaches could also help lift underemployed populations out of recurring cycles of poverty and overpopulation.

The elements of sharing, proactive behaviour and empowerment are part of people's everyday lives as they play their computer games, share music with friends and decide moment to moment what they will watch, listen to and participate in. I propose to weave these elements into the dinosaur theme park. What better way to begin than with a series of expeditions into a wilderness inhabited by these most fascinating and dangerous of creatures.  The plans for the eventual park are on the drawing board, thousands of hours have yet to be committed and yet people will be experiencing the sharp edge of what the park will someday offer. This is product development with the customer at the heart of the creative process. With live streaming to thousands of potential customers watching and sharing their brutally honest evaluations, we truly open up the creative process. With engagement on many levels we achieve a quality of participation that excites public interest and informs our creative process.

In many ways this project is inspired by the empowerment brought about by the internet age. It is also inspired by a less positive manifestation of the new web world. A significant number of people have become so consumed with their electronic gadgets they are increasingly alienated from their own physicality and their place in the natural world. We hope that our project can play a small part in helping to reverse this trend.

I am a science fiction enthusiast, I don't know how many times I've watched the Alien movies. You could call me a history buff. I read every book in Colleen McCullough's Masters of Rome series and hungered for more. Why develop another dinosaur attraction when this theme has been done to death? As well there are  many exciting themes that have not been exploited, why not do one of these?

First of all, other themes I'd like to explore require too much infrastructure. The cost is prohibitive. The dinosaur theme requires minimal infrastructure and results in less environmental impact. The second reason I chose the dinosaur theme arises from the glaring fact that no dinosaur attraction, no dinosaur event, no dinosaur movie correctly portrays the scientifically established behaviours and capabilities of the clade dinosauria. Certainly it is true that my attraction can't possibly recreate their lost world even if I have live dinosaurs. Be that as it may, the attraction I propose by having dinosaurs outside in a wilderness location, moving rapidly and behaving naturally, will come closer to capturing the essence of dinosaurs than any previous portrayal.

You can have the most sophisticated animatronic T Rex in the world, but if it's shuffling about letting 10 year olds stroke it's snout, then it is really nothing more than a scary looking puppet. In our attraction no one will be allowed anywhere near the T Rex. In our attraction if you find yourself in the presence of the T Rex you will understand primal fear.
The T Rex (Regina) and the Expedition for Knowledge.
(By all estimates the female T Rex was larger than the male, hence Tyrannosaurus Regina).

We hope to have many different types of dinosaurs for expedition participants to study and observe. In fact by your level of support you will help to determine what kind of dinosaurs will inhabit the dinosaur wilderness.  It is my advice to anyone hoping to join an expedition that they avoid providing any support for a T Rex cloning program. An examination of the historic T Rex will validate my advice and also underline my declaration concerning the inaccuracies of past T Rex portrayals and by extension the numerous flawed depictions of dinosaurs prevalent in popular culture.

Through fossil forensics we have discovered healed wounds on large herbivores that could only have come from a T Rex. In this case tooth size and shape are the smoking gun. This evidence would seem to close the debate over whether the Rex was a carnivore or merely an opportunistic scavenger. All physiological evidence seems to point to an extremely active and hungry carnivore. This behaviour in a creature weighing upwards of 8 tons would definitely pose a danger to humans. How much danger?

To appreciate the horrible death potential posed by a full grown  or even a half grown Tyrannosaur we need to examine its capabilities. For our purposes it is instructive to contrast the scientifically established capability with a portrayal in popular culture. I'm sure everyone remembers the scene in the first Jurassic Park movie when Dr. Grant was standing beside the overturned jeep with Hammond's granddaughter. There in front of them stands a hungry T Rex. Apparently the lawyer was merely an appetizer.

The good doctor advises the girl that the Tyrannosaurus can't see them if they don't move. Of course he means voluntary movements, but of course there are many involuntary movements and I'm afraid the T Rex was equipped to see all of them. This terrifying animal had depth perception superior  to other carnivorous dinosaurs. With its perfect binocular vision it had a canny ability to judge distances, a useful capability for an apex hunter. The eyes themselves were incomparable. Imagine a hawk with binoculars and you get some appreciation for  the Rex's visual acuity. So I'm afraid Dr. Grant the Tyrannosaur can see your chest move as you breath, every twitch of your face, every micro movement of your eyes. He sees about as well as it is possible to see.

The olfactory capability was every bit as formidable. Imagine an 8 ton blood hound, but keep in mind the nostril separation in this hound from hell allowed for 3D olfactory perception. He could smell a triceratops fart from a mile away and move towards its author with the accuracy of a guided missile. This sensory arsenal was completed by a sense of hearing of incomparable acuity. In a scientifically accurate Jurassic Park the T Rex could hear the breathing, the heart beat and the gas bubbles percolating in the churning guts of the three terrified humans by the overturned jeep. So if we neutralize for a moment Spielberg's genius for drama and rely on cold hard science there is no dramatic moment by the jeep. Nature's ultimate predator eats the goat, the lawyer, Doc Grant and the two kids in seconds. But is he fast enough to catch the jeep? The latest research seems to indicate that we have underestimated the tail muscle mass the T Rex used to maximize speed by as much as 45%. So before the jeep even gets up to speed its 3 occupants are already dead.

If Dinosaur Expedition supporters indeed successfully vote for a T Rex a series of protocols will be established invoking distance requirements, the  use of visual, auditory and olfactory decoys and the utilization of a number of repellent technologies. If the Rex demonstrates predatory behaviours towards expedition participants we will get to the nearest ATV trail and rendezvous with our ATV mobile security detail for extraction. Under no circumstances will firearms be utilized. The potential for making a tragic situation catastrophic is too great. Andy's AK47 is permanently retired.

Thinking a dinosaur's appearance tells the whole story makes about as much sense as saying a man's shadow explains his essence. For too long the entertainment business has been satisfied with shallow depictions and the complex reality of these creatures has been ignored. They knew the T Rex was a monster, but even the paleontologists weren't sure how dangerous was the beast. With the latest research it's hard to imagine it could be any more lethal. The more we find out about both carnivorous and herbivorous dinosaurs the more we develop respect for these awesome creatures.
Instructed by the facts and emboldened by the capabilities science gives us, we will attempt to do justice to the T Rex and creatures like it. The educational possibilities are electrifying!
This links to a video on T Rex.    http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4URe7c7Gq30
Accurate T Rex Illustration by Scott Hartman

Your support will give us the financial muscle we need to make the expeditions and adventures possible. But your personal commitment to the project is what brings it to life. It is through the Indiegogo perks that together we mediate how you as a supporter will engage with the project. If you desperately want to go on an expedition your chances improve as your level of support increases. If you just can't afford to give much support, but still want to improve your chances you can seek an endorsement from a higher level supporter. If this higher level supporter is selected for an expedition their endorsement can greatly improve your chances. (Higher level supporters are allowed to give one endorsement).

If you wish to support the project with a generous contribution, but have no desire to wade through mosquito infested swamps looking for predators the size of school buses, then we'll reward your generosity with a fine prehistoric themed gift. If you're too old or out of shape to go on expeditions yet long for adventure, we will provide a modified experience of shorter duration.

The Indiegogo perks empower our supporters in other ways. Each level of support is a vote for a particular type of dinosaur. The greater the support at a particular level, the better the chance the dinosaur associated with that level will be cloned, (if second generation hatched or if already in existence, selected for survival in our park). The votes of higher levels are worth more than lower level votes. Higher levels of support are also associated with all types of significant participation in the project, not necessarily involving exposure to the dinosaur wilderness. This could involve designing a shirt for our online store. If the shirt design is selected it will be featured, we will provide links to your online dinosaur themed store and other exciting perks. Another perk offers the supporter the opportunity to create video content for our online channel. Selection criteria would include things like the educational content, entertainment value and quality.

At the higher levels, expedition participation is guaranteed and the potential for significant involvement with the dinosaur theme park is offered. In all cases more support means better perks, but merit is also an important factor. Chose a perk that allows you to highlight your best qualities and you may find yourself an important part of the project. Don't delude yourself. Do not involve yourself at a level of support involving participation and assume you will be successful if you have no experience in the skill associated with that type of participation.

Certain key members of the project team are in place, but the funding we receive will determine the ultimate size and character of the group. The skills involved in designing and implementing important parts of the project are highly specialized and require appropriate remuneration.

We are very lucky indeed to have Walter Klassen join the team as technical advisor. He is a legend in the movie business and his encyclopedic technical knowledge will bolster the entire dinosaur expedition project. (To see a recent newspaper article on Walter hit the link on my 21st. June, 2013 favourite tweet). https://twitter.com/RobertVowles

This project is temporarily dominated by old guys and Juliana Vowles provides the priceless perspective of a young professional. She has work experience in the public and private sector and her perceptive mind and limitless creativity is an invaluable asset.

A number one priority for the project team is to make the expeditions as safe as possible. Alex Smith in his role as Program Coordinator for Recreation and Leisure at Fleming College in Peterborough, Ontario is in an ideal position to provide us with qualified expedition team leaders.

It is my intention to employ a substantial number of students in parts of the project where I believe their contribution will be invaluable.. I have been in touch with the wireless technology department at Fleming and they are interested in making involvement with the project both a school assignment and a source of summer employment for students.
As project manager it is my job to mediate between three fundamental objectives.
1. The creation of mind blowing experiences.
3. The ultimate goal of creating the worlds first, truly 21st century

It is essential that I put together a team that can help me reach all these goals. It is my belief that this project will generate opportunities that will make project goals not only achievable and mutually supportive, but also a means to undreamed of potential.
There are rules that must be followed, failure to follow rules may result in the immediate termination of the expedition. Here's a sample of some of our rules.
You must be 18 years or older at the time your expedition is to occur.
No firearms or weapons of any kind on the expeditions, you do not want your adventure to end in a long stay in a Canadian penal institution.
No alcohol or illicit drugs are permitted.
No racist, sexist, inflammatory comments or abusive behaviour is allowed.
No reckless behaviour likely to result in injury to yourself or others.

column2: the threat of forest fire and the health concerns of others make this rule non-negotiable.

column1: No persons with a history of serious mental instability or violent criminal behavior.
It is imperative that you obey the orders of your Team Leader at all times.

If you don't like rules and resent being told what to do that's fine, stay home we don't want you on the expeditions! DO NOT misrepresent your physical or mental condition when being interviewed. All those selected for expeditions will undergo VIGOROUS TESTS prior to transportation to the Dinosaur Wilderness. You will only be inconveniencing other people and jeopardizing your own participation at a level that is safe for you by being loose with the truth.

All businesses especially themed attractions go to great pains to insure their facilities are safe. Artificial worlds are constructed specifically for we fragile humans and still accidents happen. It seems everyone has a  lawyer ready to seek their version of justice. If you wish to go on our expeditions have no illusions, there is danger and you will be signing away your legal redress
column2: wild animals are dangerous, insects and snakes are poisonous, water can drown you and tree roots can trip you. In addition I brew my coffee boiling hot, if you spill it on yourself don't call your lawyer.

column1: Our eventual attraction will have adventures for visitors with safety concerns. But at this stage we can only offer expedition participants blood, toil, tears and sweat with the chance of incredible thrills. If you have concerns you should seriously consider staying home. All expedition participants will be required to sign our comprehensive liability waver without exception.

I have endeavoured to create a flexible cost structure that allows me to adapt to the input that I get from my supporters and satisfy my own requirements. My primary goal and the goal that sustains all others is the goal of demonstrating that dynamic immersive entertainment of extended duration has huge potential. This goal is balanced by the need to move as many supporters as possible safely through the expedition process. With so many unknowable elements it will be fascinating to see how the project eventually manifests itself.

Unfortunately it is the case that some people when given the opportunity to participate  see this as a license to behave in a boorish and infantile manner, amusing themselves at the expense of everyone else. If you extend them the same courtesy there shouldn't be a problem.

Perhaps the biggest failing of this project is the potentially large number of small supporters who want to go on expeditions and aren't selected because of inadequate capacity. There is a simple mathematical reality at work here. The cost for one person to go on an expedition is well over a thousand dollars if we take into account total project cost. My good intentions can't change this fact. It takes a large number of small supporters to pay for one expedition participant. It is my hope that premium perks attract enough big supporters to underwrite the involvement of lesser supporters. If you're a small supporter you can have a huge impact on the project if you tell the right person that the DINOSAURS ARE BACK  and there's an  EXPEDITION !

If we reach our funding goal and our fixed capital costs have been met a higher a percentage of any additional funds can go towards operating costs. That means more financial resources can be directed towards insuring a higher percentage of lower level supporters can go on additional expeditions. Unfortunately management and safety issues preclude us stuffing existing expeditions with more people.

Robert Vowles and Theme Adventures makes no guarantees as to the reality of dinosaur cloning or the creation of living dinosaurs. All references to cloned dinosaurs are based on unsubstantiated claims by dubious characters and evidence that has not been scientifically evaluated. Robert Vowles and Theme Adventures can only assure expedition participants that every effort will be made to provide them with a genuinely prehistoric experience.

Andiamo iQ was created to act as an integrated technology platform that accompanies your luggage. This smart luggage has been designed to act as a personal charging and Wi-Fi connectivity station, eliminate excess baggage fees and make traveling more convenient.


iQ also connects with your smartphone (iOS and Android devices) and sends you alerts about your luggage and travel plans. Lastly, the lightweight, aluminum-framed carry-on suitcase serves as a charging station and global Wi-Fi hotspot through its USB port.
column3: >

column1: Not only does the Wi-Fi hotspot enable secure internet access on all of your devices, but it also gives you international Wi-Fi access, wherever you may be. Just purchase a local SIM card at your international destination and insert it into iQ's card slot for instant coverage and connectivity.

<span>The compact battery unit within your suitcase removes easily so you can carry it anywhere, even without your luggage. There is also a phone and tablet holder attached for easy viewing and charging with iQ. The power pack totals 8000mAh
column2: the removable pack has 6000mAh and the base of the case also has another 2000mAh. The USB port allows one device to be charged at a time and can charge a smartphone up to 5 times!

column1: Now you don’t have to worry about being surprised by overweight charges. With its scale built directly into the handle, the iQ Smart Luggage will measure and display the weight of your suitcase conveniently on your smartphone, so you can plan accordingly.

iQ Smart Luggage can send a text message to your smartphone if the luggage moves 30 meters (98 ft.) away from you. It can also send an alert to your smartphone as the luggage is coming towards you on the ramp.
The app, compatible with iOS and Android devices, will also serve as your travel companion, informing you of things like suggestive packing lists for business and leisure travel and more.

The lightweight, aluminum frame with 360-degree silent spinner wheels and turning functionality makes moving through airport security and down the concourse easier than before. iQ also includes built-in, TSA-approved locks. The unique, three-digit combination locks will keep your belongings safe too!

Andiamo iQ was designed to be smart luggage from its inception. The sleek, modern design allows it to stand out easily in the crowd, so you can be recognized for your “smart” choice. Manufactured with state-of-the-art equipment and facilities, the iQ has gone through rigorous testing, including Drop Test, Handle Test and Rolling Test, to ensure its durability.

A graduate of Cornell University Engineering Department, Yi has extensive cross-industry experience serving as strategy consultant for General Motors, IKEA and other multinational firms. In his free time, Yi enjoys scuba diving and a good game of Texas Hold’em.

column2: >Christina Bogert DePonte is a premier travelware designer known around the world for her compassion and dedication to design and product development. A founding partner of 24-7 International LLC. and creative force behind their acclaimed brand portfolio, Chris’ career began at Pratt Institute of Technology in New York. Prior to being appointed EVP of Design and Marketing for 24-7, she was head designer for Monarch, Capezio and American Flyer Luggage Companies. Her portfolio of work and patents have been recognized for numerous awards including Partners in Progress, Design Excellence, Vendor of the Year, Good Housekeeping Design, Best Behind the Scenes and Best Overall in the Show.

>Marcy Schackne is a seasoned marketing executive in consumer products and a 16-year veteran of the travel goods industry. She oversees marketing for the 40-year-old brand, bringing expertise from her tenure with Revlon, Applica
column3: > and Travelpro. She is an MBA candidate from Florida International University and has a B.A. from the University of South Florida. A lifelong traveler, she has visited 105 countries on all seven continents.

>Fernando Padron graduated from William Paterson University with a major in finance and a minor in economics. With nine years of experience in account management and sales, he enjoys staying active and weight training. In his spare time, he loves to cheer on the Dallas Cowboys, New York Yankees and the Los Angeles Lakers.

column4: >We chose crowdfunding as the path to market for Andiamo iQ because we want to make sure that what we think people want, is in fact what they actually do want. Crowdfunding is a great way to do that. We really appreciate your feedback, as well as your support. What we hear from you will help us make Andiamo iQ the best it can be! We also would like to hear about what features you think could make iQ more meaningful to you.

column1: In maintaining the Andiamo legacy of being the finest and most technology-driven travel goods brand, we are constantly seeking the latest in innovation. We achieve this by working with the top material and component suppliers in order to provide luggage that you will not only be proud of, but insistent on using.

We - Jayanthi and Johann - are the first Sri Lankans to attempt the summit of Mt. Everest. With over a decade of mountaineering experience each, we have both individually and as a team successfully attempted many of the world’s most challenging treks, including Island Peak in the Himalayas, Mt. Kilimanjaro, Mt. Imja Tse, Mt. Kinabalu, and the Andes.

column3: >will be our greatest challenge yet. At 8,848m
column4: >above sea level, the legendary Mount Everest is one of the most testing physical challenges a human can attempt.
column5: >Thus far, no Sri Lankan has ever attempted to summit this peak. Until now.
column7: >we need your help to do it.

column4: >The Everest Expedition is not cheap. This expedition has a budget of approximately USD 136,000. And while we are also getting financial sponsorship from the corporate sector and other donors, we would like to reach out to you, the global community, to help us on our way.

column1: The $10,000 raised through this campaign will support the $87,000 Expedition Fees of the International Mountain Guides (IMG). The fees will cover climbing permits, Sherpa and guides, internal flights, food and accommodation, medical supplies and safety equipment. The full proposal and budget can be accessed here.
be part of a larger team led by IMG, a globally
renowned mountaineering company which has led a number of successful Mt. Everest
expeditions over the past 30 years.
includes hiking to the Lobuche Peak Base Camp for acclimatization on the way to
Everest Base Camp at the beginning of the expedition, a subsequent ascent of
Lobuche Peak for further acclimatization and training prior to the first
rotation on Everest. This will be followed by two acclimatization climbs on
Everest (one to Camp 2 and one to Camp 3) prior to the Everest summit bids. The
goal is maximum practice and acclimatization before attempting the summit, for
the best possible chance of success.
• Financially just short - help us get to the top of the world!

We - Jayanthi and Johann - are the first Sri Lankans to attempt the summit of Mt. Everest. With over a decade of mountaineering experience each, we have both individually and as a team successfully attempted many of the world’s most challenging treks, including Island Peak in the Himalayas, Mt. Kilimanjaro, Mt. Imja Tse, Mt. Kinabalu, and the Andes.

This will be our greatest challenge yet. At 8,848m above sea level, the legendary Mount Everest is one of the most testing physical challenges a human can attempt. Thus far, no Sri Lankan has ever attempted to summit this peak. Until now. And we need your help to do it.

The Everest Expedition is not cheap. This expedition has a budget of approximately USD 136,000. And while we are also getting financial sponsorship from the corporate sector and other donors, we would like to reach out to you, the global community, to help us on our way.

The $10,000 raised through this campaign will support the $87,000 Expedition Fees of the International Mountain Guides (IMG). The fees will cover climbing permits, Sherpa and guides, internal flights, food and accommodation, medical supplies and safety equipment. The full proposal and budget can be accessed here.
be part of a larger team led by IMG, a globally
renowned mountaineering company which has led a number of successful Mt. Everest
expeditions over the past 30 years. The expedition itinerary
includes hiking to the Lobuche Peak Base Camp for acclimatization on the way to
Everest Base Camp at the beginning of the expedition, a subsequent ascent of
Lobuche Peak for further acclimatization and training prior to the first
rotation on Everest. This will be followed by two acclimatization climbs on
Everest (one to Camp 2 and one to Camp 3) prior to the Everest summit bids. The
goal is maximum practice and acclimatization before attempting the summit, for
the best possible chance of success.
Financially just short - help us get to the top of the world!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

column4: >Stop Fogging Up – Keeping All Surfaces Fog-Free

column1:
We have all experienced fogged-up glasses or sunglasses at one time or another. What a nuisance! As useful as these are (along with all our other glass-based products), there is no denying that fog can render them completely useless or at least cause us some unnecessary annoyance.

Stop Fogging Up is the solution: an innovative, specialized tool for keeping your glasses, sunglasses, and more totally fog-free, Just Wipe is easy to use. You simply run Stop Fogging Up across the fogged-up surface, removing the fog and covering it with an anti-fog coat that will prevent any additional fog from building up. It is that simple.
column3: >You can use Stop Fogging Up as many as 300 times. 300 times – and every wipe lasts 48 hours or more!
column5:
>Have you encountered this situation?

 

  Forget about fogged-up glasses, camera lenses, smartphones, mirrors, and other glass surfaces. Stop Fogging Up is the straightforward, go-anywhere solution that you have been looking for. When you have Stop Fogging Up with you, you never need to worry about fog getting in your way ever again. Where paper towels and plain cloths have failed, Stop Fogging Up succeeds, eradicating fog from your life once and for all! 

 

 

Clear off any smartphone screen and keep it clear of fog. This is especially useful if you are driving and using your smartphone for directions. 

Don't let fog get between you and all of life's special moments!

 Breath fogging up your glasses because of the protective mask you have over your mouth? Stop Fogging Up can prevent that.

Drink up your favorite hot beverage without any fear of fog. Stop Fogging Up is an effective form of anti-fog protection.

Keep your vision unobstructed as you navigate the mountain range, preventing fog on your ski goggles.

   Out for a run? Your sunglasses or glasses are important for ensuring your safety. Let them do their job – with the power of Stop Fogging Up.

  Gas masks frequently mean the difference between life and death in war situations. Prevent the goggles from fogging with Stop Fogging Up. 

 You need your car mirrors to be clear so that you can see hazards while you are driving. Stop Fogging Up has you covered. 

Let your fish swim about their aquarium and peace – so that you can enjoy them too. Stop Fogging Up is the way! 

 

 

You can use Stop Fogging Up as many as 300 times. 300 times – and every wipe lasts 48 hours or more! That means you do not need to hold back: use it whenever there is a little fog on any surface, running it over the affected area or even preempting fog by running it over surfaces that could become foggy. Because of its reusability, it is a high-value product.

Cold Fog or Warm – Either Way
column11:
>Warm Fog

Whether your glasses become fogged because of hot coffee or because of cold air, Stop Fogging Up remains effective. This product is versatile, affording you the ability to get rid of fog of all types. In winter and in summer, in the coldest parts of the world and the deepest parts of the tropics, Stop Fogging Up is the help that you need to escape fog's frustrations.
column12:
>

Carrying Stop Fogging Up around in its case, which comes included, you can take Stop Fogging Up anywhere and everywhere. Headed to work for the day? Take Stop Fogging Up with you! Going out for lunch? You never know when you are going to need it, and because of the compact design, it conveniently portable. 

  Our nanotech applies a sleek anti-fog coat on the lens without causing it any damage.

Non-abrasive and ultra-soft, Stop Fogging Up is gentle on all lenses – but tough on fog! Because of the extreme density of Stop Fogging Up, it can remove dust and oil without creating static electricity.
column13:
>

 To prevent volatilization, all you need to do is store Stop Fogging Up in its carrying case.

 Note: don't wash Stop Fogging Up (as water may damage the nanotech).

src=share_button"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">

We appreciate all your support. Thanks for taking the time to read about Stop Fogging Up!

Risks and challenges

Because we have already put the time and resources into developing and perfecting Stop Fogging Up, there is very little risk inherent to what we are doing. We know that we have a useful, cutting-edge product ready, and we will do whatever it takes to bring it to market. If any logistical challenges arise during distribution, we will figure out a way forward, just as we have throughout the development process.

column2: >If you are, great! You are going to love what we have in store for you. Sadly, though, there are many people who cannot answer ""yes"" to this question honestly. They are not doing what they need to do to protect their feet – two of the most precious things any of us will ever be able to call their own. Ask anyone who has suffered a severe accident to their feet: their lives are never quite the same. For anyone who has not put thought into what they are doing to keep their feet safe and functional, we can only encourage you to think of often you use them and to imagine how your life would change without them.
>Our mission is to provide comfortable, stylish, and safe work shoes that are built to last.

>On the flip side, when you do take measures to protect your feet form accident and injury, there is no telling how boldly you can move about the world and how fearlessly you can trek into even the most unforgiving terrains, let alone your local hiking path. This is why we have created Indestructible Shoes, to embolden and empower people to use their feet the way they want, to live their lives on their own terms, and to know, not simply think but know, their feet are going to be safe. We have set a mission for ourselves, to offer you world-class protection via a pair of stylish steel-toed shoes.

>We have followed the European style of steel toe for Indestructible Shoes, sourcing heavy-duty steel that you can count on to protect your toes from anything that may happen to fall on them or pose a crushing hazard. From boulders to sledgehammers, there is just about nothing that is even going to make a dent in Indestructible Shoes, which also feature military-grade material for puncture resistance around the rest of the feet. Add to both these materials a shock-resistant sole, and you will see just how freely you can roam about this wild world, wary but never afraid of all threats and obstacles.
>

>You may assume that because we have engineered such a heavy-duty shoe, we must have sacrificed comfort in favor of security. That assumption, however, would be wrong. We have you covered on the comfort front too, integrating a breathable, moisture-wicking flymesh into the shoe lining to optimize airflow and prevent overheating. Underneath that, there is an extra-padded heel cup that delivers 3D support to your arch and works in conjunction with the flymesh for and incredibly soft feel. In all, each shoe weighs less than a pound too – so you can wear Indestructible Shoes all day long, even if you are on your feet for week eight, ten, or twelve hours at a time.
>

>Thinking not just about your feet but your well-being in general, we have added a reflective stripe to Indestructible Shoes, signaling to cars and people at night that there is a pedestrian in front of them and keeping you safe from harm when you are out for your evening walk or early-morning jog. The springy, flexible composition is also effective at distributing your weight evenly across your feet, helping you avoid the chronic balance issues that many people face because of poor posture and less-than-ideal foot structure.
>

>Knowing how important your feet are to you and realizing how easy it is to act on this knowledge, you should see what we see: the value of a pair of reliable, heavy-duty shoes. Comfortable, dependable, tough, and available in a variety of colors and styles, Indestructible Shoes are going to change the way you think about your feet, keeping you moving and healthy from here on out.

>Right now, we are turning to you for help raising the funds that we need to market Indestructible Shoes to a wider audience and expand our distribution. Our goal through this campaign is to put together $30,000, which will cover the costs that we are facing as we work to scale up the Indestructible Shoes brand. Whatever we raise in excess of our goal, we will divert to our marketing budget, continuing to increase name recognition for Indestructible Shoes.
>To say thanks to everyone who makes a contribution to this campaign, we are offering some exciting rewards, including discounts on our shoes and other Indestructible Shoes-branded merchandise.
>Make your contribution and claim your pair of Indestructible Shoes now!

>Because Indestructible Shoes is already operational, we foresee minimal challenges to our scale-up efforts. We are confident that we can expand production and distribution smoothly, and if any major obstacles do get in our way, we will come up with solutions just as we always have so far. To all our contributors, we pledge to keep you updated about the progress that we are making, letting you know about any promotions and any new products that we launch in the future.

>In addition to making a monetary contribution to this campaign, you can show your support for Indestructible Shoes by sharing a link to the campaign on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, and any other social media platforms you use. The more people are aware of what we are doing, the smoother the next few months will go for our brand. We want people in all environments, from the factory floor to the classroom, to respect their feet and to take real steps to protect them – steps in a pair of Indestructible Shoes, of course!
>We appreciate all your support, and we thank you for your time.

column1: ","If you are, great! You are going to love what we have in store for you. Sadly, though, there are many people who cannot answer ""yes"" to this question honestly. They are not doing what they need to do to protect their feet – two of the most precious things any of us will ever be able to call their own. Ask anyone who has suffered a severe accident to their feet: their lives are never quite the same. For anyone who has not put thought into what they are doing to keep their feet safe and functional, we can only encourage you to think of often you use them and to imagine how your life would change without them.
Our mission is to provide comfortable, stylish, and safe work shoes that are built to last.

On the flip side, when you do take measures to protect your feet form accident and injury, there is no telling how boldly you can move about the world and how fearlessly you can trek into even the most unforgiving terrains, let alone your local hiking path. This is why we have created Indestructible Shoes, to embolden and empower people to use their feet the way they want, to live their lives on their own terms, and to know, not simply think but know, their feet are going to be safe. We have set a mission for ourselves, to offer you world-class protection via a pair of stylish steel-toed shoes.

We have followed the European style of steel toe for Indestructible Shoes, sourcing heavy-duty steel that you can count on to protect your toes from anything that may happen to fall on them or pose a crushing hazard. From boulders to sledgehammers, there is just about nothing that is even going to make a dent in Indestructible Shoes, which also feature military-grade material for puncture resistance around the rest of the feet. Add to both these materials a shock-resistant sole, and you will see just how freely you can roam about this wild world, wary but never afraid of all threats and obstacles.

You may assume that because we have engineered such a heavy-duty shoe, we must have sacrificed comfort in favor of security. That assumption, however, would be wrong. We have you covered on the comfort front too, integrating a breathable, moisture-wicking flymesh into the shoe lining to optimize airflow and prevent overheating. Underneath that, there is an extra-padded heel cup that delivers 3D support to your arch and works in conjunction with the flymesh for and incredibly soft feel. In all, each shoe weighs less than a pound too – so you can wear Indestructible Shoes all day long, even if you are on your feet for week eight, ten, or twelve hours at a time.

Thinking not just about your feet but your well-being in general, we have added a reflective stripe to Indestructible Shoes, signaling to cars and people at night that there is a pedestrian in front of them and keeping you safe from harm when you are out for your evening walk or early-morning jog. The springy, flexible composition is also effective at distributing your weight evenly across your feet, helping you avoid the chronic balance issues that many people face because of poor posture and less-than-ideal foot structure.

Knowing how important your feet are to you and realizing how easy it is to act on this knowledge, you should see what we see: the value of a pair of reliable, heavy-duty shoes. Comfortable, dependable, tough, and available in a variety of colors and styles, Indestructible Shoes are going to change the way you think about your feet, keeping you moving and healthy from here on out.

Right now, we are turning to you for help raising the funds that we need to market Indestructible Shoes to a wider audience and expand our distribution. Our goal through this campaign is to put together $30,000, which will cover the costs that we are facing as we work to scale up the Indestructible Shoes brand. Whatever we raise in excess of our goal, we will divert to our marketing budget, continuing to increase name recognition for Indestructible Shoes.
To say thanks to everyone who makes a contribution to this campaign, we are offering some exciting rewards, including discounts on our shoes and other Indestructible Shoes-branded merchandise.
Make your contribution and claim your pair of Indestructible Shoes now!

Because Indestructible Shoes is already operational, we foresee minimal challenges to our scale-up efforts. We are confident that we can expand production and distribution smoothly, and if any major obstacles do get in our way, we will come up with solutions just as we always have so far. To all our contributors, we pledge to keep you updated about the progress that we are making, letting you know about any promotions and any new products that we launch in the future.

In addition to making a monetary contribution to this campaign, you can show your support for Indestructible Shoes by sharing a link to the campaign on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, and any other social media platforms you use. The more people are aware of what we are doing, the smoother the next few months will go for our brand. We want people in all environments, from the factory floor to the classroom, to respect their feet and to take real steps to protect them – steps in a pair of Indestructible Shoes, of course!
We appreciate all your support, and we thank you for your time.",21.0,0,"1 Campaign

Kiri is the most customizable daily backpack ever created. Magnetic buckle technology allows you to swap effortlessly between your choice of Kiri kits designed for all of the adventures that fill your life. Whether it's an overnight trip, an afternoon by the beach, a morning photo expedition, or a hike in the mountains, there is a kit for any adventure!

Our goal is to make it easy for you to explore your world and leave it a better place. That’s why every Kiri backpack provides a child in the developing country of Cambodia with essential school supplies for a year. By supporting education, your backpack helps build a better world. Access to education means brighter futures for each of these students, and on a global scale helps to increase environmental awareness, work towards gender equality and decrease poverty rates.
column2: >
column4:
>We use only the highest quality materials, from premium Fidlock buckles to YKK zippers and rugged Kodra nylon. Our products are built to last! If your Kiri backpack (or any of your kits) are defective, we’ll fix them. If we can’t fix the problem, we’ll replace the product. That’s our promise to you.

 

 

 

At Banana Backpacks we believe that your everyday backpack should be manufactured to the highest standards, in a way that you would be proud of. That means the highest manufacturing quality and highest ethical standards are non-negotiable.

Our manufacturer is located just outside the busy metropolis of Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. They have been one of the world’s best bag manufacturers for over 15 years and specialize in building highly technical outdoor gear, where product failure can result in life or death. We’re talking extreme backcountry avalanche bags and mountaineering packs. They’re also incredible at building camera gear designed to keep insanely expensive technical equipment safe. With this kind of expertise, you can rest assured your gear was built to last.

They also pride themselves on their safe working environment, low employee turnover (a proxy for factory worker satisfaction), and support of the local community.

We’ve spent the past year working alongside them as we developed the Kiri Collection to make sure you can feel as good about the way your gear was made as you do when those silky soft straps hang from your shoulders.

In May 2018, we began selling our 60L travel pack, the Khmer Explorer, through our website after funding our first production run with a combination our own life savings and direct pre-orders. We delivered our first production run on time and without a delay (a streak we intend on keeping!).

One year later, we're ready to launch our second, more ambitious backpack collection. And that's where you come in! We would humbly like to ask you to join our adventure.

As a full collection with large minimum order quantities, we can’t bring Kiri to life without your help. So if you can, please back our project and pre-order your Kiri. Having tested it vigorously over the last year (on opposite sides of the world), we can wholeheartedly say it will change the way you explore!

We’re so excited to have you here, and we can’t wait to continue the Banana Backpacks journey with you. If you have questions, feedback, or just want to say what's up, reach out to us at
column5:
body=Hey%20Banana%20Team%2C%20"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">help@bananabackpacks.com. We’ll get back to your question as soon as this two sibling team can! 

Happy exploring! :)

Michael &
column6:
Anika

P.S. If you want to see how our first pack, the Khmer Explorer, turned out, check out this video:

column2:
url=https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/kiri-the-customizable-everyday-backpack--4/"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" target=""_blank"">

Duties &

column1: We cannot estimate duties and taxes for all countries. If your Kiri will be shipped to Canada or the United States, all orders will be sent from our Canadian Fulfillment Center and not subject to duties. If not, you can use this calculator to get an estimate of the duties and taxes that may be applicable to your order..

This is not our first time manufacturing an awesome pack and our last product launch went off without a hitch or delay. We have a wealth of experience understanding what goes into a project like this. From logistics to materials to manufacturing, we are confident in our ability to not only deliver, but deliver on time. In the extremely unlikely event that something unexpected does occur, we promise to communicate with the highest level of transparency and concern for you, our incredible backers.

Delays: The unloading and loading of shipping containers aren't always the most streamlined or timely processes and labour strikes or general tardiness can cause our large metal box full of backpacks to sit at the port waiting for unloading longer than we'd like. We bake delays like this into our schedule, but they can sometimes be longer than even we'd accounted for.

Acts of God: We distribute our gear from Vancouver, Canada, which sits uncomfortably close to the locked Juan de Fuca plate and within a major earthquake zone. It's been a few centuries since this plate slipped and we're hopeful it will stay locked for some time. The NHL playoffs have concluded and the risk of angry fan riots during our proposed timeline is also quite low. In the unlikely event that the God(s) do not smile fondly upon us, we'll work together with you to persevere and get you your Kiri..

>GRAPHENE: THE STUFF OF SCIENCE FICTION

Scientists won the Nobel Prize in Physics for Graphene technology in 2010. Graphene is a form of carbon consisting of a single layer of carbon atoms arranged in an hexagonal lattice. It is the strongest material ever tested, efficiently conducts heat and electricity, and is nearly transparent.

While Scientists have theorized about it &

column9:
>FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

Where We Ship:

We are able to ship to US, Canada, Japan, Korea, the UK, and all European countries. VAT and GST not included. FREE shipping everywhere. 

When We Start Shipping: 

The crowdfunding campaign ends March 22, we'll collect your size and color selection the week thereafter. This batch ships in April 2018. Please allow 7 days for it to reach your doorstep from the time of delivery. 

Risks, Challenges, &
column10:
Our Pledge to You

We've tested these jackets ourselves, and now we're looking to ship out first batch worldwide to a select group of winter-lovers like you. In return for your early support, we hope to continue giving you insider perks and deals just for believing in us. 

Return &
column11:
Refund Policy

We guarantee that the product has no defects. If it does have a defect, then please ship it back within 15 days of receiving the jacket for a refund. We'll provide refunds within 10 business days after receiving it back to our warehouse.

If you changed your mind about size or color, then we're happy to exchange it within 15 days after you receive it. Just send us an email and then pay for shipping &
column12:
handling based on your location.

 

What is this Breakthrough Graphene Heating Technology? 
Scientists won the Nobel Prize in Physics for Graphene technology in 2010. Humbgo is one of the first to incorporate it in our jackets and use this lightweight, durable material for its excellent heating capabilities.

How Durable is it? 
The shell is made from the same fabric used by mountain climbers and protected with a coat of Teflon to make it extra tough. Teflon makes the exterior tear-resistant, water and stain resistant (even in heavy rain), and machine washable. The Graphene heating panels inside are diamond-strong and resistant to wear.

Do the Hand Heaters Also Heat the Abdomen? 
Yes! We've even had our women testers report they help with abdominal cramps. 

Does the Back Heater Help With My Lower Back? 
Yes! The Back Heater extends to the full back so that your back is all taken care of. 

I've Backed Crowdfunding Campaigns Before. What Makes You Sure You Can Deliver?
Unlike other crowdfunding campaigns, we've got all our manufacturing, testing, certifications, and everything else out of the way. These jackets are ready to go from our warehouse. That's why we're 100% confident that you'll get your jacket on time.

When Will I Select My Size, Color, and Confirm My Shipping Address?
Our Indiegogo Campaign Ends on Thursday, March 22. We will send out the surveys afterward for you to confirm your details!

Will I Get a Discount if I Buy Two? 
Yes, we've discounted the two-pack more than buying a single jacket alone. 

Why Don't You Ship the Battery Outside of the US &
column13:
Canada? 
Due to international shipping restrictions, it's very difficult to ship Lithium Ion batteries across borders. we recommend getting a 5V, 10,000 mAh from your local retailer. 

Do you accept PayPal?
No
column14:
Indiegogo uses a secure credit card processing tool that does not include PayPal. 

Other Questions?
We're responding to your comments in the Comments Section of this page!

Interested in a Distribution Partnership?
Email Us at info@humbgo.com.

FOR YOUR KEYS &
column2:
EDC AND POCKET TOOLS!

Attach the MagBeats to your belt loop and lounge comfortably. 

Stop stuffing your keys into pockets!

At Silipac, we believe that a keyring must meet its match through value in simplicity and design.  With this simple thought, and with grit, we started the company to improve the way we carry our keys or pocket tools. 

With a MagBeads, we make sure that you are prepared for small emergencies of our unpredictable world.

Our Core Values:

column1:
Along with the stylish, minimalist design Silipac MagBeads holder is available in 3 variants (2 of them are 100% PURE Titanium and 1 is 100% PVD Coated Stainless steel) to match your aesthetic. Whether doing sports activities, working, or traveling the Silipac MagBeads combines classic style and functionality.

 

The Story

In 2020 Sergey Beregovskiy sought to come up with a functional EDC keychain that led the way to the creation of Silipac MagBeads. A great mix of innovation and design defines this magnet keychain which proved to be among the world’s most stylish and functional EDC carriers.

The magnet keyrings are considered a work of art and engineering that echoes the creative genius of our founder, the timeless sensuality and distinction. 

 

 

More than just a tool holder

The Silipac Mag Beads connector marries sophisticated styling with ultimate functionality for a match that exceeds expectations. With its minimalist design and wealth of fine materials, the MagBeads holder is an impeccable holding instrument that is as contemporary as it is timeless.  

FASHIONABLE WAY TO Carry THINGS!

If you strive for a smart lifestyle, why not going with a fancy tool? The Silipac EDC Mag Beads holder is handcrafted to exude modern elegance. Its weighted, ergonomic configuration definitely will suit your preferences.   

That Quick Attach/Detach action!

Save your time with Silipac’s uniquely designed EDC keychain featuring quick Attach/Detach action. With its stylish look, you’d love to parade with it everywhere ready for action whenever your next need strikes.

Silipac Signature Craftsmanship

EDC keychain with style &
column2:
sophistication epitomizes timeless design shaping the future with functionality and minimalist design. The perfect partner for all of your EDC things, it features a well-balanced sleek shape that hangs comfortably in your belt loop or on car key or anywhere you can imagine. 

Premium Quality You Deserve

Silipac MagBeads keychain is available in 3 variants: Pure Titanium Black Brushed Finished, Pure Titanium Polished Finish, and Blue PVD Coated Stainless Steel. All have an extra-strong magnet that is secure and reusable. The keychains are made of premium 100% stainless steel or 100% Titanium giving them balanced weight, expensive feel, and ergonomic solid grip. 

Flights Friendly.

Traveling interstate or to another country? No need to worry as the EDC MagBeads complies with current TSA regulations for air travel. Please see the FAQ for more details.

Your EDC holder keychain for big moments! 

Attach the MagBead to your belt loop and lounge comfortably. 

No matter what you do from work, sport, hobbies, or around the house, it's the small things that can become BIG and stop you in your tracks. EDC Magbeads was created to help keep you doing what you love...Organize your keys, tools, gadgets to get easy access with the quick-release EDC MagBeads by Silipac.

MANUFACTURING PRECISION

WE USE CRYSTALLINE DIAMONDS TO CUT THE CHAMFERS

Its weighted, ergonomic configuration definitely will suit your preferences.   That Quick Attach/Detach action!Save your time with Silipac’s uniquely designed EDC keychain featuring quick Attach/Detach action. With its stylish look, you’d love to parade with it everywhere ready for action whenever your next need strikes.Silipac Signature CraftsmanshipEDC keychain with style & sophistication epitomizes timeless design shaping the future with functionality and minimalist design. The perfect partner for all of your EDC things, it features a well-balanced sleek shape that hangs comfortably in your belt loop or on car key or anywhere you can imagine. Premium Quality You DeserveSilipac MagBeads keychain is available in 3 variants: Pure Titanium Black Brushed Finished, Pure Titanium Polished Finish, and Blue PVD Coated Stainless Steel. All have an extra-strong magnet that is secure and reusable. The keychains are made of premium 100% stainless steel or 100% Titanium giving them balanced weight, expensive feel, and ergonomic solid grip. Flights Friendly.Traveling interstate or to another country? No need to worry as the EDC MagBeads complies with current TSA regulations for air travel. Please see the FAQ for more details.Your EDC holder keychain for big moments! Attach the MagBead to your belt loop and lounge comfortably. No matter what you do from work, sport, hobbies, or around the house, it's the small things that can become BIG and stop you in your tracks. EDC Magbeads was created to help keep you doing what you love...Organize your keys, tools, gadgets to get easy access with the quick-release EDC MagBeads by Silipac.MANUFACTURING PRECISIONWE USE CRYSTALLINE DIAMONDS TO CUT THE CHAMFERS",35.0,0,"1 Campaign

Step 1: Insert the support pole in the elastic strap located at the back of the target. Propping the front of the target up, and at an angle.

Step 2: Insert the foam noodles for floatation.

Step 3: Fill the weight bags with water, rocks, etc. This will stabilize the target on shore, or to the bottom of your pool, lake, river, or ocean. Keeping the targets from floating away.

SHIPPING POLICY

It is critical that you enter your correct, valid address when placing your order. If our shipping carrier attempts delivery to you and you don't get it because you’re not there, wrong address or moved without notifying us, and the package returns back to our warehouse, it will be the buyer's responsibility to pay the shipping fee to reship the order. When you receive your tracking number, please keep an eye out for the package.

CUSTOMS &
column11:
DUTIES INFORMATION

Our prices do not include VAT, GST or other country taxes.

Our terms of sale for international orders are FOB destination. This means that you pay all duties or taxes in your country if applicable. As we are shipping these products all over the world, it is impossible for us to build in the various duties, VAT and GST tax for each location through Indiegogo.

If you would like to estimate your duties, you can use this online tool (remember to convert the U.S. dollars to your local currency):

simplyduty.com/import-calculator/

For international customers who are required to pay customs, you will receive an email from your local customs authorities asking for payment to have your order processed through customs. Unfortunately, there is no legal way around customs (including marking an order as a gift, which we cannot do). Once you make that payment to the customs broker your order will be processed for final delivery.

Risks and Challenges

Recently, we have been reminded that unprecedented situations such as a pandemic can tie up companies and keep them from being able to perform to the best of their ability. Most importantly my team was reminded that not even a pandemic can slow down our company. Our ability to launch this summer is a testament to our ability to not be overcome by even the toughest obstacles. We believe that with the proper preparation it is possible to properly manage expectations even in the worst case in scenarios. The way we have done this is by having back ups for everything. Back up manufactures back up fulfillment centers etc. We built a buffer into our timeline just in case everything that could go wrong does go wrong. We know that with resilience it is possible to overcome even the toughest situations. We are prepared for anything. In the case that something does go wrong our backers will be the first to know. We appreciate your support and since you are now a part of our Skip NN' Hole family you are our #1 priority.

Daniel Moores and Abraham Cohen are expert cyclists who have completed cycling marathons worldwide, including the Dead Sea, the lowest place on earth. Now they're off to the highest place in the world– Mount Everest. Their mission is to raise to raise funds for TEVEL, an Israeli NGO working to improve the quality of life in impoverished Nepali communities (www.tevelbtzedek.org) using a holistic development model that focuses on agriculture, education, health and women's empowerment.

Daniel and Avi will cross mountainous terrain riding their bikes on highest road in the world. The road is about 1200 km in length and around 4000/5000 meters high.The marathon will start at Lhasa, Tibet during the week of April 23th and end two weeks later in Kathmandu, Nepal.
Help us raise funds for TEVEL’s work in Nepal by donating and by spreading the word. Updates will be published daily so you can keep track of Daniel and Avi’s progress.

Daniel Moors, Abraham Cohen, Micha Odenheimer and Zaki Djemal

Pictured is Joe Horbelt who was in a horrific motorcycle accident in Florida on 7-26-2014. He is presently at Orlando Regional Medical Center. He has two collapsed lungs, seventeen rib fractures, spinal fractures, two chest tubes, tracheostomy and is on a respirator. He has cheated death many times through God and hundreds of prayers. His family wants to bring him home to NJ to complete his recovery in rehab. Mary, his wife, will have to return to work in September.

 The monies collected will cover transportation via medivac, the only way to safely bring him home. We do not want to leave him in Florida alone. We want him close to his family and friends to help with his recovery. We would be so grateful for any help you can give to bring Joe home.

Thank you,

Family and Friends of Joe Horbelt







Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

• Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

column1:
• Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

• Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

column2:
Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

column1:
• Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

• Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
